60#define CLI11_VERSION_MAJOR 2
61#define CLI11_VERSION_MINOR 3
62#define CLI11_VERSION_PATCH 1
63#define CLI11_VERSION "2.3.1"

65// The following version macro is very similar to the one in pybind11
66#if !(defined(_MSC_VER) && __cplusplus == 199711L) && !defined(__INTEL_COMPILER)
67#if __cplusplus >= 201402L
68#define CLI11_CPP14
69#if __cplusplus >= 201703L
70#define CLI11_CPP17
71#if __cplusplus > 201703L
72#define CLI11_CPP20
73#endif
74#endif
75#endif
76#elif defined(_MSC_VER) && __cplusplus == 199711L
77// MSVC sets _MSVC_LANG rather than __cplusplus (supposedly until the standard is fully implemented)
78// Unless you use the /Zc:__cplusplus flag on Visual Studio 2017 15.7 Preview 3 or newer
79#if _MSVC_LANG >= 201402L
80#define CLI11_CPP14
81#if _MSVC_LANG > 201402L && _MSC_VER >= 1910
82#define CLI11_CPP17
83#if _MSVC_LANG > 201703L && _MSC_VER >= 1910
84#define CLI11_CPP20
85#endif
86#endif
87#endif
88#endif
89
90#if defined(CLI11_CPP14)
91#define CLI11_DEPRECATED(reason) [[deprecated(reason)]]
92#elif defined(_MSC_VER)
93#define CLI11_DEPRECATED(reason) __declspec(deprecated(reason))
94#else
95#define CLI11_DEPRECATED(reason) __attribute__((deprecated(reason)))
96#endif
97
98// GCC < 10 doesn't ignore this in unevaluated contexts
99#if !defined(CLI11_CPP17) || (defined(__GNUC__) && !defined(__llvm__) && \
100 !defined(__INTEL_COMPILER) && __GNUC__ < 10 && __GNUC__ > 4)
101#define CLI11_NODISCARD
102#else
103#define CLI11_NODISCARD [[nodiscard]]
104#endif
105
107#ifndef CLI11_USE_STATIC_RTTI
108#if (defined(_HAS_STATIC_RTTI) && _HAS_STATIC_RTTI)
109#define CLI11_USE_STATIC_RTTI 1
110#elif defined(__cpp_rtti)
111#if (defined(_CPPRTTI) && _CPPRTTI == 0)
112#define CLI11_USE_STATIC_RTTI 1
113#else
114#define CLI11_USE_STATIC_RTTI 0
115#endif
116#elif (defined(__GCC_RTTI) && __GXX_RTTI)
117#define CLI11_USE_STATIC_RTTI 0
118#else
119#define CLI11_USE_STATIC_RTTI 1
120#endif
121#endif

130// C standard library
131// Only needed for existence checking
132#if defined CLI11_CPP17 && defined __has_include && !defined CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM
133#if __has_include(<filesystem>)
134// Filesystem cannot be used if targeting macOS < 10.15
135#if defined __MAC_OS_X_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED && __MAC_OS_X_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED < 101500
136#define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 0
137#elif defined(__wasi__)
138// As of wasi-sdk-14, filesystem is not implemented
139#define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 0
140#else
141#include <filesystem>
142#if defined __cpp_lib_filesystem && __cpp_lib_filesystem >= 201703
143#if defined _GLIBCXX_RELEASE && _GLIBCXX_RELEASE >= 9
144#define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 1
145#elif defined(__GLIBCXX__)
146// if we are using gcc and Version <9 default to no filesystem
147#define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 0
148#else
149#define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 1
150#endif
151#else
152#define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 0
153#endif
154#endif
155#endif
156#endif
157
158#if defined CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM && CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM > 0
159#include <filesystem> // NOLINT(build/include)
160#else
161#include <sys/stat.h>
162#include <sys/types.h>
163#endif

165namespace CLI {

169namespace enums {
170
172template <typename T, typename = typename std::enable_if<std::is_enum<T>::value>::type>
173std::ostream &operator<<(std::ostream &in, const T &item) {
174 // make sure this is out of the detail namespace otherwise it won't be found when needed
175 return in << static_cast<typename std::underlying_type<T>::type>(item);
176}
177
178} // namespace enums
179
181using enums::operator<<;
182
183namespace detail {
186constexpr int expected_max_vector_size{1 << 29};
187// Based on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/236129/split-a-string-in-c
189CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::string> split(const std::string &s, char delim);
190
192template <typename T>
193std::string join(const T &v, std::string delim = ",") {
194 std::ostringstream s;
195 auto beg = std::begin(v);
196 auto end = std::end(v);
197 if (beg != end) s << *beg++;
198 while (beg != end) {
199 s << delim << *beg++;
200 }
201 return s.str();
202}
203
205template <
206 typename T,
207 typename Callable,
208 typename = typename std::enable_if<!std::is_constructible<std::string, Callable>::value>::type>
209std::string join(const T &v, Callable func, std::string delim = ",") {
210 std::ostringstream s;
211 auto beg = std::begin(v);
212 auto end = std::end(v);
213 auto loc = s.tellp();
214 while (beg != end) {
215 auto nloc = s.tellp();
216 if (nloc > loc) {
217 s << delim;
218 loc = nloc;
219 }
220 s << func(*beg++);
221 }
222 return s.str();
223}
224
226template <typename T>
227std::string rjoin(const T &v, std::string delim = ",") {
228 std::ostringstream s;
229 for (std::size_t start = 0; start < v.size(); start++) {
230 if (start > 0) s << delim;
231 s << v[v.size() - start - 1];
232 }
233 return s.str();
234}
235
236// Based roughly on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/25829143/c-trim-whitespace-from-a-string
237
239CLI11_INLINE std::string &ltrim(std::string &str);
240
242CLI11_INLINE std::string &ltrim(std::string &str, const std::string &filter);
243
245CLI11_INLINE std::string &rtrim(std::string &str);
246
248CLI11_INLINE std::string &rtrim(std::string &str, const std::string &filter);
249
251inline std::string &trim(std::string &str) { return ltrim(rtrim(str)); }
252
254inline std::string &trim(std::string &str, const std::string filter) {
255 return ltrim(rtrim(str, filter), filter);
256}
257
259inline std::string trim_copy(const std::string &str) {
260 std::string s = str;
261 return trim(s);
262}
263
265CLI11_INLINE std::string &remove_quotes(std::string &str);
266
271CLI11_INLINE std::string fix_newlines(const std::string &leader, std::string input);
272
275inline std::string trim_copy(const std::string &str, const std::string &filter) {
276 std::string s = str;
277 return trim(s, filter);
278}
280CLI11_INLINE std::ostream &format_help(std::ostream &out,
281 std::string name,
282 const std::string &description,
283 std::size_t wid);
284
286CLI11_INLINE std::ostream &format_aliases(std::ostream &out,
287 const std::vector<std::string> &aliases,
288 std::size_t wid);
289
293template <typename T>
294bool valid_first_char(T c) {
295 return ((c != '-') && (c != '!') && (c != ' ') && c != '\n');
296}
297
299template <typename T>
300bool valid_later_char(T c) {
301 // = and : are value separators, { has special meaning for option defaults,
302 // and \n would just be annoying to deal with in many places allowing space here has too much
303 // potential for inadvertent entry errors and bugs
304 return ((c != '=') && (c != ':') && (c != '{') && (c != ' ') && c != '\n');
305}
306
308CLI11_INLINE bool valid_name_string(const std::string &str);
309
311inline bool valid_alias_name_string(const std::string &str) {
312 static const std::string badChars(std::string("\n") + '\0');
313 return (str.find_first_of(badChars) == std::string::npos);
314}
315
317inline bool is_separator(const std::string &str) {
318 static const std::string sep("%%");
319 return (str.empty() || str == sep);
320}
321
323inline bool isalpha(const std::string &str) {
324 return std::all_of(str.begin(), str.end(),
325 [](char c) { return std::isalpha(c, std::locale()); });
326}
327
329inline std::string to_lower(std::string str) {
330 std::transform(std::begin(str), std::end(str), std::begin(str),
331 [](const std::string::value_type &x) { return std::tolower(x, std::locale()); });
332 return str;
333}
334
336inline std::string remove_underscore(std::string str) {
337 str.erase(std::remove(std::begin(str), std::end(str), '_'), std::end(str));
338 return str;
339}
340
342CLI11_INLINE std::string find_and_replace(std::string str, std::string from, std::string to);
343
345inline bool has_default_flag_values(const std::string &flags) {
346 return (flags.find_first_of("{!") != std::string::npos);
347}
348
349CLI11_INLINE void remove_default_flag_values(std::string &flags);
350
353CLI11_INLINE std::ptrdiff_t find_member(std::string name,
354 const std::vector<std::string> names,
355 bool ignore_case = false,
356 bool ignore_underscore = false);
357
361template <typename Callable>
362inline std::string find_and_modify(std::string str, std::string trigger, Callable modify) {
363 std::size_t start_pos = 0;
364 while ((start_pos = str.find(trigger, start_pos)) != std::string::npos) {
365 start_pos = modify(str, start_pos);
366 }
367 return str;
368}
369
372CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::string> split_up(std::string str, char delimiter = '\0');
373
379CLI11_INLINE std::size_t escape_detect(std::string &str, std::size_t offset);
380
382CLI11_INLINE std::string &add_quotes_if_needed(std::string &str);
383
384} // namespace detail
385
386namespace detail {
387CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::string> split(const std::string &s, char delim) {
388 std::vector<std::string> elems;
389 // Check to see if empty string, give consistent result
390 if (s.empty()) {
391 elems.emplace_back();
392 } else {
393 std::stringstream ss;
394 ss.str(s);
395 std::string item;
396 while (std::getline(ss, item, delim)) {
397 elems.push_back(item);
398 }
399 }
400 return elems;
401}
402
403CLI11_INLINE std::string &ltrim(std::string &str) {
404 auto it = std::find_if(str.begin(), str.end(),
405 [](char ch) { return !std::isspace<char>(ch, std::locale()); });
406 str.erase(str.begin(), it);
407 return str;
408}
409
410CLI11_INLINE std::string &ltrim(std::string &str, const std::string &filter) {
411 auto it = std::find_if(str.begin(), str.end(),
412 [&filter](char ch) { return filter.find(ch) == std::string::npos; });
413 str.erase(str.begin(), it);
414 return str;
415}
416
417CLI11_INLINE std::string &rtrim(std::string &str) {
418 auto it = std::find_if(str.rbegin(), str.rend(),
419 [](char ch) { return !std::isspace<char>(ch, std::locale()); });
420 str.erase(it.base(), str.end());
421 return str;
422}
423
424CLI11_INLINE std::string &rtrim(std::string &str, const std::string &filter) {
425 auto it = std::find_if(str.rbegin(), str.rend(),
426 [&filter](char ch) { return filter.find(ch) == std::string::npos; });
427 str.erase(it.base(), str.end());
428 return str;
429}
430
431CLI11_INLINE std::string &remove_quotes(std::string &str) {
432 if (str.length() > 1 && (str.front() == '"' || str.front() == '\'')) {
433 if (str.front() == str.back()) {
434 str.pop_back();
435 str.erase(str.begin(), str.begin() + 1);
436 }
437 }
438 return str;
439}
440
441CLI11_INLINE std::string fix_newlines(const std::string &leader, std::string input) {
442 std::string::size_type n = 0;
443 while (n != std::string::npos && n < input.size()) {
444 n = input.find('\n', n);
445 if (n != std::string::npos) {
446 input = input.substr(0, n + 1) + leader + input.substr(n + 1);
447 n += leader.size();
448 }
449 }
450 return input;
451}
452
453CLI11_INLINE std::ostream &format_help(std::ostream &out,
454 std::string name,
455 const std::string &description,
456 std::size_t wid) {
457 name = " " + name;
458 out << std::setw(static_cast<int>(wid)) << std::left << name;
459 if (!description.empty()) {
460 if (name.length() >= wid) out << "\n" << std::setw(static_cast<int>(wid)) << "";
461 for (const char c : description) {
462 out.put(c);
463 if (c == '\n') {
464 out << std::setw(static_cast<int>(wid)) << "";
465 }
466 }
467 }
468 out << "\n";
469 return out;
470}
471
472CLI11_INLINE std::ostream &format_aliases(std::ostream &out,
473 const std::vector<std::string> &aliases,
474 std::size_t wid) {
475 if (!aliases.empty()) {
476 out << std::setw(static_cast<int>(wid)) << " aliases: ";
477 bool front = true;
478 for (const auto &alias : aliases) {
479 if (!front) {
480 out << ", ";
481 } else {
482 front = false;
483 }
484 out << detail::fix_newlines(" ", alias);
485 }
486 out << "\n";
487 }
488 return out;
489}
490
491CLI11_INLINE bool valid_name_string(const std::string &str) {
492 if (str.empty() || !valid_first_char(str[0])) {
493 return false;
494 }
495 auto e = str.end();
496 for (auto c = str.begin() + 1; c != e; ++c)
497 if (!valid_later_char(*c)) return false;
498 return true;
499}
500
501CLI11_INLINE std::string find_and_replace(std::string str, std::string from, std::string to) {
502 std::size_t start_pos = 0;
503
504 while ((start_pos = str.find(from, start_pos)) != std::string::npos) {
505 str.replace(start_pos, from.length(), to);
506 start_pos += to.length();
507 }
508
509 return str;
510}
511
512CLI11_INLINE void remove_default_flag_values(std::string &flags) {
513 auto loc = flags.find_first_of('{', 2);
514 while (loc != std::string::npos) {
515 auto finish = flags.find_first_of("},", loc + 1);
516 if ((finish != std::string::npos) && (flags[finish] == '}')) {
517 flags.erase(flags.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(loc),
518 flags.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(finish) + 1);
519 }
520 loc = flags.find_first_of('{', loc + 1);
521 }
522 flags.erase(std::remove(flags.begin(), flags.end(), '!'), flags.end());
523}
524
525CLI11_INLINE std::ptrdiff_t find_member(std::string name,
526 const std::vector<std::string> names,
527 bool ignore_case,
528 bool ignore_underscore) {
529 auto it = std::end(names);
530 if (ignore_case) {
531 if (ignore_underscore) {
532 name = detail::to_lower(detail::remove_underscore(name));
533 it = std::find_if(std::begin(names), std::end(names), [&name](std::string local_name) {
534 return detail::to_lower(detail::remove_underscore(local_name)) == name;
535 });
536 } else {
537 name = detail::to_lower(name);
538 it = std::find_if(std::begin(names), std::end(names), [&name](std::string local_name) {
539 return detail::to_lower(local_name) == name;
540 });
541 }
542
543 } else if (ignore_underscore) {
544 name = detail::remove_underscore(name);
545 it = std::find_if(std::begin(names), std::end(names), [&name](std::string local_name) {
546 return detail::remove_underscore(local_name) == name;
547 });
548 } else {
549 it = std::find(std::begin(names), std::end(names), name);
550 }
551
552 return (it != std::end(names)) ? (it - std::begin(names)) : (-1);
553}
554
555CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::string> split_up(std::string str, char delimiter) {
556 const std::string delims("\'\"`");
557 auto find_ws = [delimiter](char ch) {
558 return (delimiter == '\0') ? std::isspace<char>(ch, std::locale()) : (ch == delimiter);
559 };
560 trim(str);
561
562 std::vector<std::string> output;
563 bool embeddedQuote = false;
564 char keyChar = ' ';
565 while (!str.empty()) {
566 if (delims.find_first_of(str[0]) != std::string::npos) {
567 keyChar = str[0];
568 auto end = str.find_first_of(keyChar, 1);
569 while ((end != std::string::npos) &&
570 (str[end - 1] == '\\')) { // deal with escaped quotes
571 end = str.find_first_of(keyChar, end + 1);
572 embeddedQuote = true;
573 }
574 if (end != std::string::npos) {
575 output.push_back(str.substr(1, end - 1));
576 if (end + 2 < str.size()) {
577 str = str.substr(end + 2);
578 } else {
579 str.clear();
580 }
581
582 } else {
583 output.push_back(str.substr(1));
584 str = "";
585 }
586 } else {
587 auto it = std::find_if(std::begin(str), std::end(str), find_ws);
588 if (it != std::end(str)) {
589 std::string value = std::string(str.begin(), it);
590 output.push_back(value);
591 str = std::string(it + 1, str.end());
592 } else {
593 output.push_back(str);
594 str = "";
595 }
596 }
597 // transform any embedded quotes into the regular character
598 if (embeddedQuote) {
599 output.back() = find_and_replace(output.back(), std::string("\\") + keyChar,
600 std::string(1, keyChar));
601 embeddedQuote = false;
602 }
603 trim(str);
604 }
605 return output;
606}
607
608CLI11_INLINE std::size_t escape_detect(std::string &str, std::size_t offset) {
609 auto next = str[offset + 1];
610 if ((next == '\"') || (next == '\'') || (next == '`')) {
611 auto astart = str.find_last_of("-/ \"\'`", offset - 1);
612 if (astart != std::string::npos) {
613 if (str[astart] == ((str[offset] == '=') ? '-' : '/'))
614 str[offset] = ' '; // interpret this as a space so the split_up works properly
615 }
616 }
617 return offset + 1;
618}
619
620CLI11_INLINE std::string &add_quotes_if_needed(std::string &str) {
621 if ((str.front() != '"' && str.front() != '\'') || str.front() != str.back()) {
622 char quote = str.find('"') < str.find('\'') ? '\'' : '"';
623 if (str.find(' ') != std::string::npos) {
624 str.insert(0, 1, quote);
625 str.append(1, quote);
626 }
627 }
628 return str;
629}
630
631} // namespace detail
632
633// Use one of these on all error classes.
634// These are temporary and are undef'd at the end of this file.
635#define CLI11_ERROR_DEF(parent, name) \
636protected: \
637 name(std::string ename, std::string msg, int exit_code) \
638 : parent(std::move(ename), std::move(msg), exit_code) {} \
639 name(std::string ename, std::string msg, ExitCodes exit_code) \
640 : parent(std::move(ename), std::move(msg), exit_code) {} \
641 \
642public: \
643 name(std::string msg, ExitCodes exit_code) : parent(#name, std::move(msg), exit_code) {} \
644 name(std::string msg, int exit_code) : parent(#name, std::move(msg), exit_code) {}
645
646// This is added after the one above if a class is used directly and builds its own message
647#define CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(name) \
648 explicit name(std::string msg) : name(#name, msg, ExitCodes::name) {}
649
652enum class ExitCodes {
653 Success = 0,
654 IncorrectConstruction = 100,
655 BadNameString,
656 OptionAlreadyAdded,
657 FileError,
658 ConversionError,
659 ValidationError,
660 RequiredError,
661 RequiresError,
662 ExcludesError,
663 ExtrasError,
664 ConfigError,
665 InvalidError,
666 HorribleError,
667 OptionNotFound,
668 ArgumentMismatch,
669 BaseClass = 127
670};
671
672// Error definitions
673
679
681class Error : public std::runtime_error {
682 int actual_exit_code;
683 std::string error_name{"Error"};
684
685public:
686 CLI11_NODISCARD int get_exit_code() const { return actual_exit_code; }
687
688 CLI11_NODISCARD std::string get_name() const { return error_name; }
689
690 Error(std::string name, std::string msg, int exit_code = static_cast<int>(ExitCodes::BaseClass))
691 : runtime_error(msg), actual_exit_code(exit_code), error_name(std::move(name)) {}
692
693 Error(std::string name, std::string msg, ExitCodes exit_code)
694 : Error(name, msg, static_cast<int>(exit_code)) {}
695};
696
697// Note: Using Error::Error constructors does not work on GCC 4.7
698
700class ConstructionError : public Error {
701 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Error, ConstructionError)
702};
703
705class IncorrectConstruction : public ConstructionError {
706 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ConstructionError, IncorrectConstruction)
707 CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(IncorrectConstruction)
708 static IncorrectConstruction PositionalFlag(std::string name) {
709 return IncorrectConstruction(name + ": Flags cannot be positional");
710 }
711 static IncorrectConstruction Set0Opt(std::string name) {
712 return IncorrectConstruction(name + ": Cannot set 0 expected, use a flag instead");
713 }
714 static IncorrectConstruction SetFlag(std::string name) {
715 return IncorrectConstruction(name + ": Cannot set an expected number for flags");
716 }
717 static IncorrectConstruction ChangeNotVector(std::string name) {
718 return IncorrectConstruction(name +
719 ": You can only change the expected arguments for vectors");
720 }
721 static IncorrectConstruction AfterMultiOpt(std::string name) {
722 return IncorrectConstruction(
723 name +
724 ": You can't change expected arguments after you've changed the multi option policy!");
725 }
726 static IncorrectConstruction MissingOption(std::string name) {
727 return IncorrectConstruction("Option " + name + " is not defined");
728 }
729 static IncorrectConstruction MultiOptionPolicy(std::string name) {
730 return IncorrectConstruction(
731 name + ": multi_option_policy only works for flags and exact value options");
732 }
733};
734
736class BadNameString : public ConstructionError {
737 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ConstructionError, BadNameString)
738 CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(BadNameString)
739 static BadNameString OneCharName(std::string name) {
740 return BadNameString("Invalid one char name: " + name);
741 }
742 static BadNameString BadLongName(std::string name) {
743 return BadNameString("Bad long name: " + name);
744 }
745 static BadNameString DashesOnly(std::string name) {
746 return BadNameString("Must have a name, not just dashes: " + name);
747 }
748 static BadNameString MultiPositionalNames(std::string name) {
749 return BadNameString("Only one positional name allowed, remove: " + name);
750 }
751};
752
754class OptionAlreadyAdded : public ConstructionError {
755 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ConstructionError, OptionAlreadyAdded)
756 explicit OptionAlreadyAdded(std::string name)
757 : OptionAlreadyAdded(name + " is already added", ExitCodes::OptionAlreadyAdded) {}
758 static OptionAlreadyAdded Requires(std::string name, std::string other) {
759 return {name + " requires " + other, ExitCodes::OptionAlreadyAdded};
760 }
761 static OptionAlreadyAdded Excludes(std::string name, std::string other) {
762 return {name + " excludes " + other, ExitCodes::OptionAlreadyAdded};
763 }
764};
765
766// Parsing errors
767
769class ParseError : public Error {
770 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Error, ParseError)
771};
772
773// Not really "errors"
774
776class Success : public ParseError {
777 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, Success)
778 Success() : Success("Successfully completed, should be caught and quit", ExitCodes::Success) {}
779};
780
782class CallForHelp : public Success {
783 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Success, CallForHelp)
784 CallForHelp()
785 : CallForHelp("This should be caught in your main function, see examples",
786 ExitCodes::Success) {}
787};
788
790class CallForAllHelp : public Success {
791 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Success, CallForAllHelp)
792 CallForAllHelp()
793 : CallForAllHelp("This should be caught in your main function, see examples",
794 ExitCodes::Success) {}
795};
796
798class CallForVersion : public Success {
799 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Success, CallForVersion)
800 CallForVersion()
801 : CallForVersion("This should be caught in your main function, see examples",
802 ExitCodes::Success) {}
803};
804
807class RuntimeError : public ParseError {
808 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, RuntimeError)
809 explicit RuntimeError(int exit_code = 1) : RuntimeError("Runtime error", exit_code) {}
810};
811
813class FileError : public ParseError {
814 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, FileError)
815 CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(FileError)
816 static FileError Missing(std::string name) {
817 return FileError(name + " was not readable (missing?)");
818 }
819};
820
822class ConversionError : public ParseError {
823 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ConversionError)
824 CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(ConversionError)
825 ConversionError(std::string member, std::string name)
826 : ConversionError("The value " + member + " is not an allowed value for " + name) {}
827 ConversionError(std::string name, std::vector<std::string> results)
828 : ConversionError("Could not convert: " + name + " = " + detail::join(results)) {}
829 static ConversionError TooManyInputsFlag(std::string name) {
830 return ConversionError(name + ": too many inputs for a flag");
831 }
832 static ConversionError TrueFalse(std::string name) {
833 return ConversionError(name + ": Should be true/false or a number");
834 }
835};
836
838class ValidationError : public ParseError {
839 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ValidationError)
840 CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(ValidationError)
841 explicit ValidationError(std::string name, std::string msg)
842 : ValidationError(name + ": " + msg) {}
843};
844
846class RequiredError : public ParseError {
847 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, RequiredError)
848 explicit RequiredError(std::string name)
849 : RequiredError(name + " is required", ExitCodes::RequiredError) {}
850 static RequiredError Subcommand(std::size_t min_subcom) {
851 if (min_subcom == 1) {
852 return RequiredError("A subcommand");
853 }
854 return {"Requires at least " + std::to_string(min_subcom) + " subcommands",
855 ExitCodes::RequiredError};
856 }
857 static RequiredError Option(std::size_t min_option,
858 std::size_t max_option,
859 std::size_t used,
860 const std::string &option_list) {
861 if ((min_option == 1) && (max_option == 1) && (used == 0))
862 return RequiredError("Exactly 1 option from [" + option_list + "]");
863 if ((min_option == 1) && (max_option == 1) && (used > 1)) {
864 return {"Exactly 1 option from [" + option_list + "] is required and " +
865 std::to_string(used) + " were given",
866 ExitCodes::RequiredError};
867 }
868 if ((min_option == 1) && (used == 0))
869 return RequiredError("At least 1 option from [" + option_list + "]");
870 if (used < min_option) {
871 return {"Requires at least " + std::to_string(min_option) + " options used and only " +
872 std::to_string(used) + "were given from [" + option_list + "]",
873 ExitCodes::RequiredError};
874 }
875 if (max_option == 1)
876 return {"Requires at most 1 options be given from [" + option_list + "]",
877 ExitCodes::RequiredError};
878
879 return {"Requires at most " + std::to_string(max_option) + " options be used and " +
880 std::to_string(used) + "were given from [" + option_list + "]",
881 ExitCodes::RequiredError};
882 }
883};
884
886class ArgumentMismatch : public ParseError {
887 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ArgumentMismatch)
888 CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(ArgumentMismatch)
889 ArgumentMismatch(std::string name, int expected, std::size_t received)
890 : ArgumentMismatch(expected > 0
891 ? ("Expected exactly " + std::to_string(expected) +
892 " arguments to " + name + ", got " + std::to_string(received))
893 : ("Expected at least " + std::to_string(-expected) +
894 " arguments to " + name + ", got " + std::to_string(received)),
895 ExitCodes::ArgumentMismatch) {}
896
897 static ArgumentMismatch AtLeast(std::string name, int num, std::size_t received) {
898 return ArgumentMismatch(name + ": At least " + std::to_string(num) +
899 " required but received " + std::to_string(received));
900 }
901 static ArgumentMismatch AtMost(std::string name, int num, std::size_t received) {
902 return ArgumentMismatch(name + ": At Most " + std::to_string(num) +
903 " required but received " + std::to_string(received));
904 }
905 static ArgumentMismatch TypedAtLeast(std::string name, int num, std::string type) {
906 return ArgumentMismatch(name + ": " + std::to_string(num) + " required " + type +
907 " missing");
908 }
909 static ArgumentMismatch FlagOverride(std::string name) {
910 return ArgumentMismatch(name + " was given a disallowed flag override");
911 }
912 static ArgumentMismatch PartialType(std::string name, int num, std::string type) {
913 return ArgumentMismatch(name + ": " + type + " only partially specified: " +
914 std::to_string(num) + " required for each element");
915 }
916};
917
919class RequiresError : public ParseError {
920 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, RequiresError)
921 RequiresError(std::string curname, std::string subname)
922 : RequiresError(curname + " requires " + subname, ExitCodes::RequiresError) {}
923};
924
926class ExcludesError : public ParseError {
927 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ExcludesError)
928 ExcludesError(std::string curname, std::string subname)
929 : ExcludesError(curname + " excludes " + subname, ExitCodes::ExcludesError) {}
930};
931
933class ExtrasError : public ParseError {
934 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ExtrasError)
935 explicit ExtrasError(std::vector<std::string> args)
936 : ExtrasError((args.size() > 1 ? "The following arguments were not expected: "
937 : "The following argument was not expected: ") +
938 detail::rjoin(args, " "),
939 ExitCodes::ExtrasError) {}
940 ExtrasError(const std::string &name, std::vector<std::string> args)
941 : ExtrasError(name,
942 (args.size() > 1 ? "The following arguments were not expected: "
943 : "The following argument was not expected: ") +
944 detail::rjoin(args, " "),
945 ExitCodes::ExtrasError) {}
946};
947
949class ConfigError : public ParseError {
950 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ConfigError)
951 CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(ConfigError)
952 static ConfigError Extras(std::string item) {
953 return ConfigError("INI was not able to parse " + item);
954 }
955 static ConfigError NotConfigurable(std::string item) {
956 return ConfigError(item + ": This option is not allowed in a configuration file");
957 }
958};
959
961class InvalidError : public ParseError {
962 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, InvalidError)
963 explicit InvalidError(std::string name)
964 : InvalidError(name + ": Too many positional arguments with unlimited expected args",
965 ExitCodes::InvalidError) {}
966};
967
970class HorribleError : public ParseError {
971 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, HorribleError)
972 CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(HorribleError)
973};
974
975// After parsing
976
978class OptionNotFound : public Error {
979 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Error, OptionNotFound)
980 explicit OptionNotFound(std::string name)
981 : OptionNotFound(name + " not found", ExitCodes::OptionNotFound) {}
982};
983
984#undef CLI11_ERROR_DEF
985#undef CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE
986
988
989// Type tools
990
991// Utilities for type enabling
992namespace detail {
993// Based generally on https://rmf.io/cxx11/almost-static-if
995enum class enabler {};
996
998constexpr enabler dummy = {};
999} // namespace detail
1000
1006template <bool B, class T = void>
1007using enable_if_t = typename std::enable_if<B, T>::type;
1008
1010template <typename... Ts>
1011struct make_void {
1012 using type = void;
1013};
1014
1016template <typename... Ts>
1017using void_t = typename make_void<Ts...>::type;
1018
1021template <bool B, class T, class F>
1022using conditional_t = typename std::conditional<B, T, F>::type;
1023
1025template <typename T>
1026struct is_bool : std::false_type {};
1027
1029template <>
1030struct is_bool<bool> : std::true_type {};
1031
1033template <typename T>
1034struct is_shared_ptr : std::false_type {};
1035
1037template <typename T>
1038struct is_shared_ptr<std::shared_ptr<T>> : std::true_type {};
1039
1041template <typename T>
1042struct is_shared_ptr<const std::shared_ptr<T>> : std::true_type {};
1043
1045template <typename T>
1046struct is_copyable_ptr {
1047 static bool const value = is_shared_ptr<T>::value || std::is_pointer<T>::value;
1048};
1049
1051template <typename T>
1052struct IsMemberType {
1053 using type = T;
1054};
1055
1057template <>
1058struct IsMemberType<const char *> {
1059 using type = std::string;
1060};
1061
1062namespace detail {
1063
1064// These are utilities for IsMember and other transforming objects
1065
1068
1070template <typename T, typename Enable = void>
1071struct element_type {
1072 using type = T;
1073};
1074
1075template <typename T>
1076struct element_type<T, typename std::enable_if<is_copyable_ptr<T>::value>::type> {
1077 using type = typename std::pointer_traits<T>::element_type;
1078};
1079
1082template <typename T>
1083struct element_value_type {
1084 using type = typename element_type<T>::type::value_type;
1085};
1086
1089template <typename T, typename _ = void>
1090struct pair_adaptor : std::false_type {
1091 using value_type = typename T::value_type;
1092 using first_type = typename std::remove_const<value_type>::type;
1093 using second_type = typename std::remove_const<value_type>::type;
1094
1096 template <typename Q>
1097 static auto first(Q &&pair_value) -> decltype(std::forward<Q>(pair_value)) {
1098 return std::forward<Q>(pair_value);
1099 }
1101 template <typename Q>
1102 static auto second(Q &&pair_value) -> decltype(std::forward<Q>(pair_value)) {
1103 return std::forward<Q>(pair_value);
1104 }
1105};
1106
1109template <typename T>
1110struct pair_adaptor<
1111 T,
1112 conditional_t<false,
1113 void_t<typename T::value_type::first_type, typename T::value_type::second_type>,
1114 void>> : std::true_type {
1115 using value_type = typename T::value_type;
1116 using first_type = typename std::remove_const<typename value_type::first_type>::type;
1117 using second_type = typename std::remove_const<typename value_type::second_type>::type;
1118
1120 template <typename Q>
1121 static auto first(Q &&pair_value) -> decltype(std::get<0>(std::forward<Q>(pair_value))) {
1122 return std::get<0>(std::forward<Q>(pair_value));
1123 }
1125 template <typename Q>
1126 static auto second(Q &&pair_value) -> decltype(std::get<1>(std::forward<Q>(pair_value))) {
1127 return std::get<1>(std::forward<Q>(pair_value));
1128 }
1129};
1130
1131// Warning is suppressed due to "bug" in gcc<5.0 and gcc 7.0 with c++17 enabled that generates a
1132// Wnarrowing warning in the unevaluated context even if the function that was using this wasn't
1133// used. The standard says narrowing in brace initialization shouldn't be allowed but for backwards
1134// compatibility gcc allows it in some contexts. It is a little fuzzy what happens in template
1135// constructs and I think that was something GCC took a little while to work out. But regardless
1136// some versions of gcc generate a warning when they shouldn't from the following code so that
1137// should be suppressed
1138#ifdef __GNUC__
1139#pragma GCC diagnostic push
1140#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wnarrowing"
1141#endif
1142// check for constructibility from a specific type and copy assignable used in the parse detection
1143template <typename T, typename C>
1144class is_direct_constructible {
1145 template <typename TT, typename CC>
1146 static auto test(int, std::true_type) -> decltype(
1147// NVCC warns about narrowing conversions here
1148#ifdef __CUDACC__
1149#pragma diag_suppress 2361
1150#endif
1151 TT{std::declval<CC>()}
1152#ifdef __CUDACC__
1153#pragma diag_default 2361
1154#endif
1155 ,
1156 std::is_move_assignable<TT>());
1157
1158 template <typename TT, typename CC>
1159 static auto test(int, std::false_type) -> std::false_type;
1160
1161 template <typename, typename>
1162 static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1163
1164public:
1165 static constexpr bool value =
1166 decltype(test<T, C>(0, typename std::is_constructible<T, C>::type()))::value;
1167};
1168#ifdef __GNUC__
1169#pragma GCC diagnostic pop
1170#endif
1171
1172// Check for output streamability
1173// Based on
1174// https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22758291/how-can-i-detect-if-a-type-can-be-streamed-to-an-stdostream
1175
1176template <typename T, typename S = std::ostringstream>
1177class is_ostreamable {
1178 template <typename TT, typename SS>
1179 static auto test(int) -> decltype(std::declval<SS &>() << std::declval<TT>(), std::true_type());
1180
1181 template <typename, typename>
1182 static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1183
1184public:
1185 static constexpr bool value = decltype(test<T, S>(0))::value;
1186};
1187
1189template <typename T, typename S = std::istringstream>
1190class is_istreamable {
1191 template <typename TT, typename SS>
1192 static auto test(int)
1193 -> decltype(std::declval<SS &>() >> std::declval<TT &>(), std::true_type());
1194
1195 template <typename, typename>
1196 static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1197
1198public:
1199 static constexpr bool value = decltype(test<T, S>(0))::value;
1200};
1201
1203template <typename T>
1204class is_complex {
1205 template <typename TT>
1206 static auto test(int)
1207 -> decltype(std::declval<TT>().real(), std::declval<TT>().imag(), std::true_type());
1208
1209 template <typename>
1210 static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1211
1212public:
1213 static constexpr bool value = decltype(test<T>(0))::value;
1214};
1215
1217template <typename T, enable_if_t<is_istreamable<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1218bool from_stream(const std::string &istring, T &obj) {
1219 std::istringstream is;
1220 is.str(istring);
1221 is >> obj;
1222 return !is.fail() && !is.rdbuf()->in_avail();
1223}
1224
1225template <typename T, enable_if_t<!is_istreamable<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1226bool from_stream(const std::string & /*istring*/, T & /*obj*/) {
1227 return false;
1228}
1229
1230// check to see if an object is a mutable container (fail by default)
1231template <typename T, typename _ = void>
1232struct is_mutable_container : std::false_type {};
1233
1237template <typename T>
1238struct is_mutable_container<
1239 T,
1240 conditional_t<
1241 false,
1242 void_t<typename T::value_type,
1243 decltype(std::declval<T>().end()),
1244 decltype(std::declval<T>().clear()),
1245 decltype(std::declval<T>().insert(std::declval<decltype(std::declval<T>().end())>(),
1246 std::declval<const typename T::value_type &>()))>,
1247 void>> : public conditional_t<std::is_constructible<T, std::string>::value,
1248 std::false_type,
1249 std::true_type> {};
1250
1251// check to see if an object is a mutable container (fail by default)
1252template <typename T, typename _ = void>
1253struct is_readable_container : std::false_type {};
1254
1258template <typename T>
1259struct is_readable_container<
1260 T,
1261 conditional_t<false,
1262 void_t<decltype(std::declval<T>().end()), decltype(std::declval<T>().begin())>,
1263 void>> : public std::true_type {};
1264
1265// check to see if an object is a wrapper (fail by default)
1266template <typename T, typename _ = void>
1267struct is_wrapper : std::false_type {};
1268
1269// check if an object is a wrapper (it has a value_type defined)
1270template <typename T>
1271struct is_wrapper<T, conditional_t<false, void_t<typename T::value_type>, void>>
1272 : public std::true_type {};
1273
1274// Check for tuple like types, as in classes with a tuple_size type trait
1275template <typename S>
1276class is_tuple_like {
1277 template <typename SS>
1278 // static auto test(int)
1279 // -> decltype(std::conditional<(std::tuple_size<SS>::value > 0), std::true_type,
1280 // std::false_type>::type());
1281 static auto test(int)
1282 -> decltype(std::tuple_size<typename std::decay<SS>::type>::value, std::true_type{});
1283 template <typename>
1284 static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1285
1286public:
1287 static constexpr bool value = decltype(test<S>(0))::value;
1288};
1289
1291template <typename T,
1292 enable_if_t<std::is_convertible<T, std::string>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1293auto to_string(T &&value) -> decltype(std::forward<T>(value)) {
1294 return std::forward<T>(value);
1295}
1296
1298template <typename T,
1299 enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value &&
1300 !std::is_convertible<T, std::string>::value,
1301 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1302std::string to_string(const T &value) {
1303 return std::string(value); // NOLINT(google-readability-casting)
1304}
1305
1307template <typename T,
1308 enable_if_t<!std::is_convertible<std::string, T>::value &&
1309 !std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value && is_ostreamable<T>::value,
1310 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1311std::string to_string(T &&value) {
1312 std::stringstream stream;
1313 stream << value;
1314 return stream.str();
1315}
1316
1319template <typename T,
1320 enable_if_t<!std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value && !is_ostreamable<T>::value &&
1321 !is_readable_container<typename std::remove_const<T>::type>::value,
1322 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1323std::string to_string(T &&) {
1324 return {};
1325}
1326
1328template <typename T,
1329 enable_if_t<!std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value && !is_ostreamable<T>::value &&
1330 is_readable_container<T>::value,
1331 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1332std::string to_string(T &&variable) {
1333 auto cval = variable.begin();
1334 auto end = variable.end();
1335 if (cval == end) {
1336 return {"{}"};
1337 }
1338 std::vector<std::string> defaults;
1339 while (cval != end) {
1340 defaults.emplace_back(CLI::detail::to_string(*cval));
1341 ++cval;
1342 }
1343 return {"[" + detail::join(defaults) + "]"};
1344}
1345
1347template <typename T1,
1348 typename T2,
1349 typename T,
1350 enable_if_t<std::is_same<T1, T2>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1351auto checked_to_string(T &&value) -> decltype(to_string(std::forward<T>(value))) {
1352 return to_string(std::forward<T>(value));
1353}
1354
1356template <typename T1,
1357 typename T2,
1358 typename T,
1359 enable_if_t<!std::is_same<T1, T2>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1360std::string checked_to_string(T &&) {
1361 return std::string{};
1362}
1364template <typename T, enable_if_t<std::is_arithmetic<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1365std::string value_string(const T &value) {
1366 return std::to_string(value);
1367}
1369template <typename T, enable_if_t<std::is_enum<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1370std::string value_string(const T &value) {
1371 return std::to_string(static_cast<typename std::underlying_type<T>::type>(value));
1372}
1374template <typename T,
1375 enable_if_t<!std::is_enum<T>::value && !std::is_arithmetic<T>::value, detail::enabler> =
1376 detail::dummy>
1377auto value_string(const T &value) -> decltype(to_string(value)) {
1378 return to_string(value);
1379}
1380
1382template <typename T, typename def, typename Enable = void>
1383struct wrapped_type {
1384 using type = def;
1385};
1386
1388template <typename T, typename def>
1389struct wrapped_type<T, def, typename std::enable_if<is_wrapper<T>::value>::type> {
1390 using type = typename T::value_type;
1391};
1392
1394template <typename T, typename Enable = void>
1395struct type_count_base {
1396 static const int value{0};
1397};
1398
1400template <typename T>
1401struct type_count_base<
1402 T,
1403 typename std::enable_if<!is_tuple_like<T>::value && !is_mutable_container<T>::value &&
1404 !std::is_void<T>::value>::type> {
1405 static constexpr int value{1};
1406};
1407
1409template <typename T>
1410struct type_count_base<
1411 T,
1412 typename std::enable_if<is_tuple_like<T>::value && !is_mutable_container<T>::value>::type> {
1413 static constexpr int value{std::tuple_size<T>::value};
1414};
1415
1417template <typename T>
1418struct type_count_base<T, typename std::enable_if<is_mutable_container<T>::value>::type> {
1419 static constexpr int value{type_count_base<typename T::value_type>::value};
1420};
1421
1423
1425template <typename T>
1426struct subtype_count;
1427
1429template <typename T>
1430struct subtype_count_min;
1431
1433template <typename T, typename Enable = void>
1434struct type_count {
1435 static const int value{0};
1436};
1437
1439template <typename T>
1440struct type_count<T,
1441 typename std::enable_if<!is_wrapper<T>::value && !is_tuple_like<T>::value &&
1442 !is_complex<T>::value && !std::is_void<T>::value>::type> {
1443 static constexpr int value{1};
1444};
1445
1447template <typename T>
1448struct type_count<T, typename std::enable_if<is_complex<T>::value>::type> {
1449 static constexpr int value{2};
1450};
1451
1454template <typename T>
1455struct type_count<T, typename std::enable_if<is_mutable_container<T>::value>::type> {
1456 static constexpr int value{subtype_count<typename T::value_type>::value};
1457};
1458
1461template <typename T>
1462struct type_count<
1463 T,
1464 typename std::enable_if<is_wrapper<T>::value && !is_complex<T>::value &&
1465 !is_tuple_like<T>::value && !is_mutable_container<T>::value>::type> {
1466 static constexpr int value{type_count<typename T::value_type>::value};
1467};
1468
1470template <typename T, std::size_t I>
1471constexpr typename std::enable_if<I == type_count_base<T>::value, int>::type tuple_type_size() {
1472 return 0;
1473}
1474
1476template <typename T, std::size_t I>
1477 constexpr typename std::enable_if < I<type_count_base<T>::value, int>::type tuple_type_size() {
1478 return subtype_count<typename std::tuple_element<I, T>::type>::value +
1479 tuple_type_size<T, I + 1>();
1480}
1481
1483template <typename T>
1484struct type_count<T, typename std::enable_if<is_tuple_like<T>::value>::type> {
1485 static constexpr int value{tuple_type_size<T, 0>()};
1486};
1487
1489template <typename T>
1490struct subtype_count {
1491 static constexpr int value{is_mutable_container<T>::value ? expected_max_vector_size
1492 : type_count<T>::value};
1493};
1494
1496template <typename T, typename Enable = void>
1497struct type_count_min {
1498 static const int value{0};
1499};
1500
1502template <typename T>
1503struct type_count_min<
1504 T,
1505 typename std::enable_if<!is_mutable_container<T>::value && !is_tuple_like<T>::value &&
1506 !is_wrapper<T>::value && !is_complex<T>::value &&
1507 !std::is_void<T>::value>::type> {
1508 static constexpr int value{type_count<T>::value};
1509};
1510
1512template <typename T>
1513struct type_count_min<T, typename std::enable_if<is_complex<T>::value>::type> {
1514 static constexpr int value{1};
1515};
1516
1519template <typename T>
1520struct type_count_min<T,
1521 typename std::enable_if<is_wrapper<T>::value && !is_complex<T>::value &&
1522 !is_tuple_like<T>::value>::type> {
1523 static constexpr int value{subtype_count_min<typename T::value_type>::value};
1524};
1525
1527template <typename T, std::size_t I>
1528constexpr typename std::enable_if<I == type_count_base<T>::value, int>::type tuple_type_size_min() {
1529 return 0;
1530}
1531
1533template <typename T, std::size_t I>
1534 constexpr typename std::enable_if <
1535 I<type_count_base<T>::value, int>::type tuple_type_size_min() {
1536 return subtype_count_min<typename std::tuple_element<I, T>::type>::value +
1537 tuple_type_size_min<T, I + 1>();
1538}
1539
1541template <typename T>
1542struct type_count_min<T, typename std::enable_if<is_tuple_like<T>::value>::type> {
1543 static constexpr int value{tuple_type_size_min<T, 0>()};
1544};
1545
1547template <typename T>
1548struct subtype_count_min {
1549 static constexpr int value{
1550 is_mutable_container<T>::value
1551 ? ((type_count<T>::value < expected_max_vector_size) ? type_count<T>::value : 0)
1552 : type_count_min<T>::value};
1553};
1554
1556template <typename T, typename Enable = void>
1557struct expected_count {
1558 static const int value{0};
1559};
1560
1562template <typename T>
1563struct expected_count<
1564 T,
1565 typename std::enable_if<!is_mutable_container<T>::value && !is_wrapper<T>::value &&
1566 !std::is_void<T>::value>::type> {
1567 static constexpr int value{1};
1568};
1570template <typename T>
1571struct expected_count<T, typename std::enable_if<is_mutable_container<T>::value>::type> {
1572 static constexpr int value{expected_max_vector_size};
1573};
1574
1576template <typename T>
1577struct expected_count<
1578 T,
1579 typename std::enable_if<!is_mutable_container<T>::value && is_wrapper<T>::value>::type> {
1580 static constexpr int value{expected_count<typename T::value_type>::value};
1581};
1582
1583// Enumeration of the different supported categorizations of objects
1584enum class object_category : int {
1585 char_value = 1,
1586 integral_value = 2,
1587 unsigned_integral = 4,
1588 enumeration = 6,
1589 boolean_value = 8,
1590 floating_point = 10,
1591 number_constructible = 12,
1592 double_constructible = 14,
1593 integer_constructible = 16,
1594 // string like types
1595 string_assignable = 23,
1596 string_constructible = 24,
1597 other = 45,
1598 // special wrapper or container types
1599 wrapper_value = 50,
1600 complex_number = 60,
1601 tuple_value = 70,
1602 container_value = 80,
1603
1604};
1605
1607
1609template <typename T, typename Enable = void>
1610struct classify_object {
1611 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::other};
1612};
1613
1615template <typename T>
1616struct classify_object<
1617 T,
1618 typename std::enable_if<std::is_integral<T>::value && !std::is_same<T, char>::value &&
1619 std::is_signed<T>::value && !is_bool<T>::value &&
1620 !std::is_enum<T>::value>::type> {
1621 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::integral_value};
1622};
1623
1625template <typename T>
1626struct classify_object<
1627 T,
1628 typename std::enable_if<std::is_integral<T>::value && std::is_unsigned<T>::value &&
1629 !std::is_same<T, char>::value && !is_bool<T>::value>::type> {
1630 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::unsigned_integral};
1631};
1632
1634template <typename T>
1635struct classify_object<
1636 T,
1637 typename std::enable_if<std::is_same<T, char>::value && !std::is_enum<T>::value>::type> {
1638 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::char_value};
1639};
1640
1642template <typename T>
1643struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<is_bool<T>::value>::type> {
1644 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::boolean_value};
1645};
1646
1648template <typename T>
1649struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<std::is_floating_point<T>::value>::type> {
1650 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::floating_point};
1651};
1652
1654template <typename T>
1655struct classify_object<
1656 T,
1657 typename std::enable_if<!std::is_floating_point<T>::value && !std::is_integral<T>::value &&
1658 std::is_assignable<T &, std::string>::value>::type> {
1659 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::string_assignable};
1660};
1661
1663template <typename T>
1664struct classify_object<
1665 T,
1666 typename std::enable_if<!std::is_floating_point<T>::value && !std::is_integral<T>::value &&
1667 !std::is_assignable<T &, std::string>::value &&
1668 (type_count<T>::value == 1) &&
1669 std::is_constructible<T, std::string>::value>::type> {
1670 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::string_constructible};
1671};
1672
1674template <typename T>
1675struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<std::is_enum<T>::value>::type> {
1676 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::enumeration};
1677};
1678
1679template <typename T>
1680struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<is_complex<T>::value>::type> {
1681 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::complex_number};
1682};
1683
1686template <typename T>
1687struct uncommon_type {
1688 using type = typename std::conditional<
1689 !std::is_floating_point<T>::value && !std::is_integral<T>::value &&
1690 !std::is_assignable<T &, std::string>::value &&
1691 !std::is_constructible<T, std::string>::value && !is_complex<T>::value &&
1692 !is_mutable_container<T>::value && !std::is_enum<T>::value,
1693 std::true_type,
1694 std::false_type>::type;
1695 static constexpr bool value = type::value;
1696};
1697
1699template <typename T>
1700struct classify_object<
1701 T,
1702 typename std::enable_if<(!is_mutable_container<T>::value && is_wrapper<T>::value &&
1703 !is_tuple_like<T>::value && uncommon_type<T>::value)>::type> {
1704 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::wrapper_value};
1705};
1706
1708template <typename T>
1709struct classify_object<
1710 T,
1711 typename std::enable_if<uncommon_type<T>::value && type_count<T>::value == 1 &&
1712 !is_wrapper<T>::value && is_direct_constructible<T, double>::value &&
1713 is_direct_constructible<T, int>::value>::type> {
1714 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::number_constructible};
1715};
1716
1718template <typename T>
1719struct classify_object<
1720 T,
1721 typename std::enable_if<uncommon_type<T>::value && type_count<T>::value == 1 &&
1722 !is_wrapper<T>::value && !is_direct_constructible<T, double>::value &&
1723 is_direct_constructible<T, int>::value>::type> {
1724 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::integer_constructible};
1725};
1726
1728template <typename T>
1729struct classify_object<
1730 T,
1731 typename std::enable_if<uncommon_type<T>::value && type_count<T>::value == 1 &&
1732 !is_wrapper<T>::value && is_direct_constructible<T, double>::value &&
1733 !is_direct_constructible<T, int>::value>::type> {
1734 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::double_constructible};
1735};
1736
1738template <typename T>
1739struct classify_object<
1740 T,
1741 typename std::enable_if<is_tuple_like<T>::value &&
1742 ((type_count<T>::value >= 2 && !is_wrapper<T>::value) ||
1743 (uncommon_type<T>::value &&
1744 !is_direct_constructible<T, double>::value &&
1745 !is_direct_constructible<T, int>::value) ||
1746 (uncommon_type<T>::value && type_count<T>::value >= 2))>::type> {
1747 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::tuple_value};
1748 // the condition on this class requires it be like a tuple, but on some compilers (like Xcode)
1749 // tuples can be constructed from just the first element so tuples of <string, int,int> can be
1750 // constructed from a string, which could lead to issues so there are two variants of the
1751 // condition, the first isolates things with a type size >=2 mainly to get tuples on Xcode with
1752 // the exception of wrappers, the second is the main one and just separating out those cases
1753 // that are caught by other object classifications
1754};
1755
1757template <typename T>
1758struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<is_mutable_container<T>::value>::type> {
1759 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::container_value};
1760};
1761
1762// Type name print
1763
1767
1768template <typename T,
1769 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::char_value, detail::enabler> =
1770 detail::dummy>
1771constexpr const char *type_name() {
1772 return "CHAR";
1773}
1774
1775template <typename T,
1776 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::integral_value ||
1777 classify_object<T>::value == object_category::integer_constructible,
1778 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1779constexpr const char *type_name() {
1780 return "INT";
1781}
1782
1783template <typename T,
1784 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::unsigned_integral,
1785 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1786constexpr const char *type_name() {
1787 return "UINT";
1788}
1789
1790template <typename T,
1791 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::floating_point ||
1792 classify_object<T>::value == object_category::number_constructible ||
1793 classify_object<T>::value == object_category::double_constructible,
1794 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1795constexpr const char *type_name() {
1796 return "FLOAT";
1797}
1798
1800template <typename T,
1801 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::enumeration, detail::enabler> =
1802 detail::dummy>
1803constexpr const char *type_name() {
1804 return "ENUM";
1805}
1806
1808template <typename T,
1809 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::boolean_value,
1810 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1811constexpr const char *type_name() {
1812 return "BOOLEAN";
1813}
1814
1816template <typename T,
1817 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::complex_number,
1818 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1819constexpr const char *type_name() {
1820 return "COMPLEX";
1821}
1822
1824template <typename T,
1825 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value >= object_category::string_assignable &&
1826 classify_object<T>::value <= object_category::other,
1827 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1828constexpr const char *type_name() {
1829 return "TEXT";
1830}
1832template <typename T,
1833 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::tuple_value &&
1834 type_count_base<T>::value >= 2,
1835 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1836std::string type_name(); // forward declaration
1837
1839template <typename T,
1840 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::container_value ||
1841 classify_object<T>::value == object_category::wrapper_value,
1842 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1843std::string type_name(); // forward declaration
1844
1846template <typename T,
1847 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::tuple_value &&
1848 type_count_base<T>::value == 1,
1849 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1850inline std::string type_name() {
1851 return type_name<typename std::decay<typename std::tuple_element<0, T>::type>::type>();
1852}
1853
1855template <typename T, std::size_t I>
1856inline typename std::enable_if<I == type_count_base<T>::value, std::string>::type tuple_name() {
1857 return std::string{};
1858}
1859
1861template <typename T, std::size_t I>
1862inline typename std::enable_if<(I < type_count_base<T>::value), std::string>::type tuple_name() {
1863 auto str =
1864 std::string{
1865 type_name<typename std::decay<typename std::tuple_element<I, T>::type>::type>()} +
1866 ',' + tuple_name<T, I + 1>();
1867 if (str.back() == ',') str.pop_back();
1868 return str;
1869}
1870
1872template <typename T,
1873 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::tuple_value &&
1874 type_count_base<T>::value >= 2,
1875 detail::enabler>>
1876inline std::string type_name() {
1877 auto tname = std::string(1, '[') + tuple_name<T, 0>();
1878 tname.push_back(']');
1879 return tname;
1880}
1881
1883template <typename T,
1884 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::container_value ||
1885 classify_object<T>::value == object_category::wrapper_value,
1886 detail::enabler>>
1887inline std::string type_name() {
1888 return type_name<typename T::value_type>();
1889}
1890
1891// Lexical cast
1892
1894template <typename T, enable_if_t<std::is_unsigned<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1895bool integral_conversion(const std::string &input, T &output) noexcept {
1896 if (input.empty()) {
1897 return false;
1898 }
1899 char *val = nullptr;
1900 std::uint64_t output_ll = std::strtoull(input.c_str(), &val, 0);
1901 output = static_cast<T>(output_ll);
1902 if (val == (input.c_str() + input.size()) && static_cast<std::uint64_t>(output) == output_ll) {
1903 return true;
1904 }
1905 val = nullptr;
1906 std::int64_t output_sll = std::strtoll(input.c_str(), &val, 0);
1907 if (val == (input.c_str() + input.size())) {
1908 output = (output_sll < 0) ? static_cast<T>(0) : static_cast<T>(output_sll);
1909 return (static_cast<std::int64_t>(output) == output_sll);
1910 }
1911 return false;
1912}
1913
1915template <typename T, enable_if_t<std::is_signed<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1916bool integral_conversion(const std::string &input, T &output) noexcept {
1917 if (input.empty()) {
1918 return false;
1919 }
1920 char *val = nullptr;
1921 std::int64_t output_ll = std::strtoll(input.c_str(), &val, 0);
1922 output = static_cast<T>(output_ll);
1923 if (val == (input.c_str() + input.size()) && static_cast<std::int64_t>(output) == output_ll) {
1924 return true;
1925 }
1926 if (input == "true") {
1927 // this is to deal with a few oddities with flags and wrapper int types
1928 output = static_cast<T>(1);
1929 return true;
1930 }
1931 return false;
1932}
1933
1935inline std::int64_t to_flag_value(std::string val) {
1936 static const std::string trueString("true");
1937 static const std::string falseString("false");
1938 if (val == trueString) {
1939 return 1;
1940 }
1941 if (val == falseString) {
1942 return -1;
1943 }
1944 val = detail::to_lower(val);
1945 std::int64_t ret = 0;
1946 if (val.size() == 1) {
1947 if (val[0] >= '1' && val[0] <= '9') {
1948 return (static_cast<std::int64_t>(val[0]) - '0');
1949 }
1950 switch (val[0]) {
1951 case '0':
1952 case 'f':
1953 case 'n':
1954 case '-':
1955 ret = -1;
1956 break;
1957 case 't':
1958 case 'y':
1959 case '+':
1960 ret = 1;
1961 break;
1962 default:
1963 throw std::invalid_argument("unrecognized character");
1964 }
1965 return ret;
1966 }
1967 if (val == trueString || val == "on" || val == "yes" || val == "enable") {
1968 ret = 1;
1969 } else if (val == falseString || val == "off" || val == "no" || val == "disable") {
1970 ret = -1;
1971 } else {
1972 ret = std::stoll(val);
1973 }
1974 return ret;
1975}
1976
1978template <typename T,
1979 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::integral_value ||
1980 classify_object<T>::value == object_category::unsigned_integral,
1981 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1982bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1983 return integral_conversion(input, output);
1984}
1985
1987template <typename T,
1988 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::char_value, detail::enabler> =
1989 detail::dummy>
1990bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1991 if (input.size() == 1) {
1992 output = static_cast<T>(input[0]);
1993 return true;
1994 }
1995 return integral_conversion(input, output);
1996}
1997
1999template <typename T,
2000 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::boolean_value,
2001 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2002bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2003 try {
2004 auto out = to_flag_value(input);
2005 output = (out > 0);
2006 return true;
2007 } catch (const std::invalid_argument &) {
2008 return false;
2009 } catch (const std::out_of_range &) {
2010 // if the number is out of the range of a 64 bit value then it is still a number and for
2011 // this purpose is still valid all we care about the sign
2012 output = (input[0] != '-');
2013 return true;
2014 }
2015}
2016
2018template <typename T,
2019 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::floating_point,
2020 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2021bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2022 if (input.empty()) {
2023 return false;
2024 }
2025 char *val = nullptr;
2026 auto output_ld = std::strtold(input.c_str(), &val);
2027 output = static_cast<T>(output_ld);
2028 return val == (input.c_str() + input.size());
2029}
2030
2032template <typename T,
2033 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::complex_number,
2034 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2035bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2036 using XC = typename wrapped_type<T, double>::type;
2037 XC x{0.0}, y{0.0};
2038 auto str1 = input;
2039 bool worked = false;
2040 auto nloc = str1.find_last_of("+-");
2041 if (nloc != std::string::npos && nloc > 0) {
2042 worked = detail::lexical_cast(str1.substr(0, nloc), x);
2043 str1 = str1.substr(nloc);
2044 if (str1.back() == 'i' || str1.back() == 'j') str1.pop_back();
2045 worked = worked && detail::lexical_cast(str1, y);
2046 } else {
2047 if (str1.back() == 'i' || str1.back() == 'j') {
2048 str1.pop_back();
2049 worked = detail::lexical_cast(str1, y);
2050 x = XC{0};
2051 } else {
2052 worked = detail::lexical_cast(str1, x);
2053 y = XC{0};
2054 }
2055 }
2056 if (worked) {
2057 output = T{x, y};
2058 return worked;
2059 }
2060 return from_stream(input, output);
2061}
2062
2064template <typename T,
2065 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::string_assignable,
2066 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2067bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2068 output = input;
2069 return true;
2070}
2071
2073template <typename T,
2074 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::string_constructible,
2075 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2076bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2077 output = T(input);
2078 return true;
2079}
2080
2082template <typename T,
2083 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::enumeration, detail::enabler> =
2084 detail::dummy>
2085bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2086 typename std::underlying_type<T>::type val;
2087 if (!integral_conversion(input, val)) {
2088 return false;
2089 }
2090 output = static_cast<T>(val);
2091 return true;
2092}
2093
2095template <typename T,
2096 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::wrapper_value &&
2097 std::is_assignable<T &, typename T::value_type>::value,
2098 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2099bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2100 typename T::value_type val;
2101 if (lexical_cast(input, val)) {
2102 output = val;
2103 return true;
2104 }
2105 return from_stream(input, output);
2106}
2107
2108template <typename T,
2109 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::wrapper_value &&
2110 !std::is_assignable<T &, typename T::value_type>::value &&
2111 std::is_assignable<T &, T>::value,
2112 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2113bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2114 typename T::value_type val;
2115 if (lexical_cast(input, val)) {
2116 output = T{val};
2117 return true;
2118 }
2119 return from_stream(input, output);
2120}
2121
2123template <typename T,
2124 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::number_constructible,
2125 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2126bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2127 int val = 0;
2128 if (integral_conversion(input, val)) {
2129 output = T(val);
2130 return true;
2131 }
2132
2133 double dval = 0.0;
2134 if (lexical_cast(input, dval)) {
2135 output = T{dval};
2136 return true;
2137 }
2138
2139 return from_stream(input, output);
2140}
2141
2143template <typename T,
2144 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::integer_constructible,
2145 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2146bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2147 int val = 0;
2148 if (integral_conversion(input, val)) {
2149 output = T(val);
2150 return true;
2151 }
2152 return from_stream(input, output);
2153}
2154
2156template <typename T,
2157 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::double_constructible,
2158 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2159bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2160 double val = 0.0;
2161 if (lexical_cast(input, val)) {
2162 output = T{val};
2163 return true;
2164 }
2165 return from_stream(input, output);
2166}
2167
2169template <typename T,
2170 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::other &&
2171 std::is_assignable<T &, int>::value,
2172 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2173bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2174 int val = 0;
2175 if (integral_conversion(input, val)) {
2176#ifdef _MSC_VER
2177#pragma warning(push)
2178#pragma warning(disable : 4800)
2179#endif
2180 // with Atomic<XX> this could produce a warning due to the conversion but if atomic gets
2181 // here it is an old style so will most likely still work
2182 output = val;
2183#ifdef _MSC_VER
2184#pragma warning(pop)
2185#endif
2186 return true;
2187 }
2188 // LCOV_EXCL_START
2189 // This version of cast is only used for odd cases in an older compilers the fail over
2190 // from_stream is tested elsewhere an not relevant for coverage here
2191 return from_stream(input, output);
2192 // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
2193}
2194
2196template <typename T,
2197 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::other &&
2198 !std::is_assignable<T &, int>::value,
2199 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2200bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2201 static_assert(is_istreamable<T>::value,
2202 "option object type must have a lexical cast overload or streaming input "
2203 "operator(>>) defined, if it "
2204 "is convertible from another type use the add_option<T, XC>(...) with XC being "
2205 "the known type");
2206 return from_stream(input, output);
2207}
2208
2211template <
2212 typename AssignTo,
2213 typename ConvertTo,
2214 enable_if_t<std::is_same<AssignTo, ConvertTo>::value &&
2215 (classify_object<AssignTo>::value == object_category::string_assignable ||
2216 classify_object<AssignTo>::value == object_category::string_constructible),
2217 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2218bool lexical_assign(const std::string &input, AssignTo &output) {
2219 return lexical_cast(input, output);
2220}
2221
2223template <typename AssignTo,
2224 typename ConvertTo,
2225 enable_if_t<std::is_same<AssignTo, ConvertTo>::value &&
2226 std::is_assignable<AssignTo &, AssignTo>::value &&
2227 classify_object<AssignTo>::value != object_category::string_assignable &&
2228 classify_object<AssignTo>::value != object_category::string_constructible,
2229 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2230bool lexical_assign(const std::string &input, AssignTo &output) {
2231 if (input.empty()) {
2232 output = AssignTo{};
2233 return true;
2234 }
2235
2236 return lexical_cast(input, output);
2237}
2238
2240template <typename AssignTo,
2241 typename ConvertTo,
2242 enable_if_t<std::is_same<AssignTo, ConvertTo>::value &&
2243 !std::is_assignable<AssignTo &, AssignTo>::value &&
2244 classify_object<AssignTo>::value == object_category::wrapper_value,
2245 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2246bool lexical_assign(const std::string &input, AssignTo &output) {
2247 if (input.empty()) {
2248 typename AssignTo::value_type emptyVal{};
2249 output = emptyVal;
2250 return true;
2251 }
2252 return lexical_cast(input, output);
2253}
2254
2257template <typename AssignTo,
2258 typename ConvertTo,
2259 enable_if_t<std::is_same<AssignTo, ConvertTo>::value &&
2260 !std::is_assignable<AssignTo &, AssignTo>::value &&
2261 classify_object<AssignTo>::value != object_category::wrapper_value &&
2262 std::is_assignable<AssignTo &, int>::value,
2263 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2264bool lexical_assign(const std::string &input, AssignTo &output) {
2265 if (input.empty()) {
2266 output = 0;
2267 return true;
2268 }
2269 int val = 0;
2270 if (lexical_cast(input, val)) {
2271 output = val;
2272 return true;
2273 }
2274 return false;
2275}
2276
2278template <typename AssignTo,
2279 typename ConvertTo,
2280 enable_if_t<!std::is_same<AssignTo, ConvertTo>::value &&
2281 std::is_assignable<AssignTo &, ConvertTo &>::value,
2282 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2283bool lexical_assign(const std::string &input, AssignTo &output) {
2284 ConvertTo val{};
2285 bool parse_result = (!input.empty()) ? lexical_cast<ConvertTo>(input, val) : true;
2286 if (parse_result) {
2287 output = val;
2288 }
2289 return parse_result;
2290}
2291
2293template <typename AssignTo,
2294 typename ConvertTo,
2295 enable_if_t<!std::is_same<AssignTo, ConvertTo>::value &&
2296 !std::is_assignable<AssignTo &, ConvertTo &>::value &&
2297 std::is_move_assignable<AssignTo>::value,
2298 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2299bool lexical_assign(const std::string &input, AssignTo &output) {
2300 ConvertTo val{};
2301 bool parse_result = input.empty() ? true : lexical_cast<ConvertTo>(input, val);
2302 if (parse_result) {
2303 output = AssignTo(val); // use () form of constructor to allow some implicit conversions
2304 }
2305 return parse_result;
2306}
2307
2309template <typename AssignTo,
2310 typename ConvertTo,
2311 enable_if_t<classify_object<ConvertTo>::value <= object_category::other &&
2312 classify_object<AssignTo>::value <= object_category::wrapper_value,
2313 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2314bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2315 return lexical_assign<AssignTo, ConvertTo>(strings[0], output);
2316}
2317
2320template <typename AssignTo,
2321 typename ConvertTo,
2322 enable_if_t<(type_count<AssignTo>::value <= 2) && expected_count<AssignTo>::value == 1 &&
2323 is_tuple_like<ConvertTo>::value && type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value == 2,
2324 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2325bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2326 // the remove const is to handle pair types coming from a container
2327 typename std::remove_const<typename std::tuple_element<0, ConvertTo>::type>::type v1;
2328 typename std::tuple_element<1, ConvertTo>::type v2;
2329 bool retval = lexical_assign<decltype(v1), decltype(v1)>(strings[0], v1);
2330 if (strings.size() > 1) {
2331 retval = retval && lexical_assign<decltype(v2), decltype(v2)>(strings[1], v2);
2332 }
2333 if (retval) {
2334 output = AssignTo{v1, v2};
2335 }
2336 return retval;
2337}
2338
2340template <
2341 class AssignTo,
2342 class ConvertTo,
2343 enable_if_t<is_mutable_container<AssignTo>::value && is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value &&
2344 type_count<ConvertTo>::value == 1,
2345 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2346bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2347 output.erase(output.begin(), output.end());
2348 if (strings.size() == 1 && strings[0] == "{}") {
2349 return true;
2350 }
2351 bool skip_remaining = false;
2352 if (strings.size() == 2 && strings[0] == "{}" && is_separator(strings[1])) {
2353 skip_remaining = true;
2354 }
2355 for (const auto &elem : strings) {
2356 typename AssignTo::value_type out;
2357 bool retval = lexical_assign<typename AssignTo::value_type, typename ConvertTo::value_type>(
2358 elem, out);
2359 if (!retval) {
2360 return false;
2361 }
2362 output.insert(output.end(), std::move(out));
2363 if (skip_remaining) {
2364 break;
2365 }
2366 }
2367 return (!output.empty());
2368}
2369
2371template <class AssignTo,
2372 class ConvertTo,
2373 enable_if_t<is_complex<ConvertTo>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2374bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2375 if (strings.size() >= 2 && !strings[1].empty()) {
2376 using XC2 = typename wrapped_type<ConvertTo, double>::type;
2377 XC2 x{0.0}, y{0.0};
2378 auto str1 = strings[1];
2379 if (str1.back() == 'i' || str1.back() == 'j') {
2380 str1.pop_back();
2381 }
2382 auto worked = detail::lexical_cast(strings[0], x) && detail::lexical_cast(str1, y);
2383 if (worked) {
2384 output = ConvertTo{x, y};
2385 }
2386 return worked;
2387 }
2388 return lexical_assign<AssignTo, ConvertTo>(strings[0], output);
2389}
2390
2392template <
2393 class AssignTo,
2394 class ConvertTo,
2395 enable_if_t<is_mutable_container<AssignTo>::value && (expected_count<ConvertTo>::value == 1) &&
2396 (type_count<ConvertTo>::value == 1),
2397 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2398bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2399 bool retval = true;
2400 output.clear();
2401 output.reserve(strings.size());
2402 for (const auto &elem : strings) {
2403 output.emplace_back();
2404 retval =
2405 retval && lexical_assign<typename AssignTo::value_type, ConvertTo>(elem, output.back());
2406 }
2407 return (!output.empty()) && retval;
2408}
2409
2410// forward declaration
2411
2413template <
2414 class AssignTo,
2415 class ConvertTo,
2416 enable_if_t<is_mutable_container<AssignTo>::value && is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value &&
2417 type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value == 2,
2418 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2419bool lexical_conversion(std::vector<std::string> strings, AssignTo &output);
2420
2422template <
2423 class AssignTo,
2424 class ConvertTo,
2425 enable_if_t<is_mutable_container<AssignTo>::value && is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value &&
2426 type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value != 2 &&
2427 ((type_count<ConvertTo>::value > 2) ||
2428 (type_count<ConvertTo>::value > type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value)),
2429 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2430bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std::string> &strings, AssignTo &output);
2431
2433template <class AssignTo,
2434 class ConvertTo,
2435 enable_if_t<is_tuple_like<AssignTo>::value && is_tuple_like<ConvertTo>::value &&
2436 (type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value != type_count<ConvertTo>::value ||
2437 type_count<ConvertTo>::value > 2),
2438 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2439bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std::string> &strings,
2440 AssignTo &output); // forward declaration
2441
2444template <
2445 typename AssignTo,
2446 typename ConvertTo,
2447 enable_if_t<!is_tuple_like<AssignTo>::value && !is_mutable_container<AssignTo>::value &&
2448 classify_object<ConvertTo>::value != object_category::wrapper_value &&
2449 (is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value || type_count<ConvertTo>::value > 2),
2450 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2451bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2452 if (strings.size() > 1 || (!strings.empty() && !(strings.front().empty()))) {
2453 ConvertTo val;
2454 auto retval = lexical_conversion<ConvertTo, ConvertTo>(strings, val);
2455 output = AssignTo{val};
2456 return retval;
2457 }
2458 output = AssignTo{};
2459 return true;
2460}
2461
2463template <class AssignTo, class ConvertTo, std::size_t I>
2464inline typename std::enable_if<(I >= type_count_base<AssignTo>::value), bool>::type
2465tuple_conversion(const std::vector<std::string> &, AssignTo &) {
2466 return true;
2467}
2468
2470template <class AssignTo, class ConvertTo>
2471inline typename std::enable_if<!is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value &&
2472 type_count<ConvertTo>::value == 1,
2473 bool>::type
2474tuple_type_conversion(std::vector<std::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2475 auto retval = lexical_assign<AssignTo, ConvertTo>(strings[0], output);
2476 strings.erase(strings.begin());
2477 return retval;
2478}
2479
2482template <class AssignTo, class ConvertTo>
2483inline typename std::enable_if<!is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value &&
2484 (type_count<ConvertTo>::value > 1) &&
2485 type_count<ConvertTo>::value == type_count_min<ConvertTo>::value,
2486 bool>::type
2487tuple_type_conversion(std::vector<std::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2488 auto retval = lexical_conversion<AssignTo, ConvertTo>(strings, output);
2489 strings.erase(strings.begin(), strings.begin() + type_count<ConvertTo>::value);
2490 return retval;
2491}
2492
2495template <class AssignTo, class ConvertTo>
2496inline typename std::enable_if<is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value ||
2497 type_count<ConvertTo>::value != type_count_min<ConvertTo>::value,
2498 bool>::type
2499tuple_type_conversion(std::vector<std::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2500 std::size_t index{subtype_count_min<ConvertTo>::value};
2501 const std::size_t mx_count{subtype_count<ConvertTo>::value};
2502 const std::size_t mx{(std::max)(mx_count, strings.size())};
2503
2504 while (index < mx) {
2505 if (is_separator(strings[index])) {
2506 break;
2507 }
2508 ++index;
2509 }
2510 bool retval = lexical_conversion<AssignTo, ConvertTo>(
2511 std::vector<std::string>(strings.begin(),
2512 strings.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(index)),
2513 output);
2514 strings.erase(strings.begin(), strings.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(index) + 1);
2515 return retval;
2516}
2517
2519template <class AssignTo, class ConvertTo, std::size_t I>
2520inline typename std::enable_if<(I < type_count_base<AssignTo>::value), bool>::type tuple_conversion(
2521 std::vector<std::string> strings, AssignTo &output) {
2522 bool retval = true;
2523 using ConvertToElement =
2524 typename std::conditional<is_tuple_like<ConvertTo>::value,
2525 typename std::tuple_element<I, ConvertTo>::type, ConvertTo>::type;
2526 if (!strings.empty()) {
2527 retval =
2528 retval &&
2529 tuple_type_conversion<typename std::tuple_element<I, AssignTo>::type, ConvertToElement>(
2530 strings, std::get<I>(output));
2531 }
2532 retval = retval && tuple_conversion<AssignTo, ConvertTo, I + 1>(std::move(strings), output);
2533 return retval;
2534}
2535
2537template <
2538 class AssignTo,
2539 class ConvertTo,
2540 enable_if_t<is_mutable_container<AssignTo>::value && is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value &&
2541 type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value == 2,
2542 detail::enabler>>
2543bool lexical_conversion(std::vector<std::string> strings, AssignTo &output) {
2544 output.clear();
2545 while (!strings.empty()) {
2546 typename std::remove_const<
2547 typename std::tuple_element<0, typename ConvertTo::value_type>::type>::type v1;
2548 typename std::tuple_element<1, typename ConvertTo::value_type>::type v2;
2549 bool retval = tuple_type_conversion<decltype(v1), decltype(v1)>(strings, v1);
2550 if (!strings.empty()) {
2551 retval = retval && tuple_type_conversion<decltype(v2), decltype(v2)>(strings, v2);
2552 }
2553 if (retval) {
2554 output.insert(output.end(), typename AssignTo::value_type{v1, v2});
2555 } else {
2556 return false;
2557 }
2558 }
2559 return (!output.empty());
2560}
2561
2564template <class AssignTo,
2565 class ConvertTo,
2566 enable_if_t<is_tuple_like<AssignTo>::value && is_tuple_like<ConvertTo>::value &&
2567 (type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value != type_count<ConvertTo>::value ||
2568 type_count<ConvertTo>::value > 2),
2569 detail::enabler>>
2570bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2571 static_assert(!is_tuple_like<ConvertTo>::value ||
2572 type_count_base<AssignTo>::value == type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value,
2573 "if the conversion type is defined as a tuple it must be the same size as the "
2574 "type you are converting to");
2575 return tuple_conversion<AssignTo, ConvertTo, 0>(strings, output);
2576}
2577
2580template <
2581 class AssignTo,
2582 class ConvertTo,
