2583 enable_if_t<is_mutable_container<AssignTo>::value && is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value &&
2584 type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value != 2 &&
2585 ((type_count<ConvertTo>::value > 2) ||
2586 (type_count<ConvertTo>::value > type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value)),
2587 detail::enabler>>
2588bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2589 bool retval = true;
2590 output.clear();
2591 std::vector<std::string> temp;
2592 std::size_t ii{0};
2593 std::size_t icount{0};
2594 std::size_t xcm{type_count<ConvertTo>::value};
2595 auto ii_max = strings.size();
2596 while (ii < ii_max) {
2597 temp.push_back(strings[ii]);
2598 ++ii;
2599 ++icount;
2600 if (icount == xcm || is_separator(temp.back()) || ii == ii_max) {
2601 if (static_cast<int>(xcm) > type_count_min<ConvertTo>::value &&
2602 is_separator(temp.back())) {
2603 temp.pop_back();
2604 }
2605 typename AssignTo::value_type temp_out;
2606 retval =
2607 retval &&
2608 lexical_conversion<typename AssignTo::value_type, typename ConvertTo::value_type>(
2609 temp, temp_out);
2610 temp.clear();
2611 if (!retval) {
2612 return false;
2613 }
2614 output.insert(output.end(), std::move(temp_out));
2615 icount = 0;
2616 }
2617 }
2618 return retval;
2619}
2620
2622template <typename AssignTo,
2623 class ConvertTo,
2624 enable_if_t<classify_object<ConvertTo>::value == object_category::wrapper_value &&
2625 std::is_assignable<ConvertTo &, ConvertTo>::value,
2626 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2627bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2628 if (strings.empty() || strings.front().empty()) {
2629 output = ConvertTo{};
2630 return true;
2631 }
2632 typename ConvertTo::value_type val;
2633 if (lexical_conversion<typename ConvertTo::value_type, typename ConvertTo::value_type>(strings,
2634 val)) {
2635 output = ConvertTo{val};
2636 return true;
2637 }
2638 return false;
2639}
2640
2642template <typename AssignTo,
2643 class ConvertTo,
2644 enable_if_t<classify_object<ConvertTo>::value == object_category::wrapper_value &&
2645 !std::is_assignable<AssignTo &, ConvertTo>::value,
2646 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2647bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2648 using ConvertType = typename ConvertTo::value_type;
2649 if (strings.empty() || strings.front().empty()) {
2650 output = ConvertType{};
2651 return true;
2652 }
2653 ConvertType val;
2654 if (lexical_conversion<typename ConvertTo::value_type, typename ConvertTo::value_type>(strings,
2655 val)) {
2656 output = val;
2657 return true;
2658 }
2659 return false;
2660}
2661
2663inline std::string sum_string_vector(const std::vector<std::string> &values) {
2664 double val{0.0};
2665 bool fail{false};
2666 std::string output;
2667 for (const auto &arg : values) {
2668 double tv{0.0};
2669 auto comp = detail::lexical_cast<double>(arg, tv);
2670 if (!comp) {
2671 try {
2672 tv = static_cast<double>(detail::to_flag_value(arg));
2673 } catch (const std::exception &) {
2674 fail = true;
2675 break;
2676 }
2677 }
2678 val += tv;
2679 }
2680 if (fail) {
2681 for (const auto &arg : values) {
2682 output.append(arg);
2683 }
2684 } else {
2685 if (val <= static_cast<double>((std::numeric_limits<std::int64_t>::min)()) ||
2686 val >= static_cast<double>((std::numeric_limits<std::int64_t>::max)()) ||
2687 // NOLINTNEXTLINE(clang-diagnostic-float-equal,bugprone-narrowing-conversions)
2688 val == static_cast<std::int64_t>(val)) {
2689 output = detail::value_string(static_cast<int64_t>(val));
2690 } else {
2691 output = detail::value_string(val);
2692 }
2693 }
2694 return output;
2695}
2696
2697} // namespace detail
2698
2699namespace detail {
2700
2701// Returns false if not a short option. Otherwise, sets opt name and rest and returns true
2702CLI11_INLINE bool split_short(const std::string &current, std::string &name, std::string &rest);
2703
2704// Returns false if not a long option. Otherwise, sets opt name and other side of = and returns true
2705CLI11_INLINE bool split_long(const std::string &current, std::string &name, std::string &value);
2706
2707// Returns false if not a windows style option. Otherwise, sets opt name and value and returns true
2708CLI11_INLINE bool split_windows_style(const std::string &current,
2709 std::string &name,
2710 std::string &value);
2711
2712// Splits a string into multiple long and short names
2713CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::string> split_names(std::string current);
2714
2716CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> get_default_flag_values(
2717 const std::string &str);
2718
2720CLI11_INLINE std::tuple<std::vector<std::string>, std::vector<std::string>, std::string> get_names(
2721 const std::vector<std::string> &input);
2722
2723} // namespace detail
2724
2725namespace detail {
2726
2727CLI11_INLINE bool split_short(const std::string &current, std::string &name, std::string &rest) {
2728 if (current.size() > 1 && current[0] == '-' && valid_first_char(current[1])) {
2729 name = current.substr(1, 1);
2730 rest = current.substr(2);
2731 return true;
2732 }
2733 return false;
2734}
2735
2736CLI11_INLINE bool split_long(const std::string &current, std::string &name, std::string &value) {
2737 if (current.size() > 2 && current.substr(0, 2) == "--" && valid_first_char(current[2])) {
2738 auto loc = current.find_first_of('=');
2739 if (loc != std::string::npos) {
2740 name = current.substr(2, loc - 2);
2741 value = current.substr(loc + 1);
2742 } else {
2743 name = current.substr(2);
2744 value = "";
2745 }
2746 return true;
2747 }
2748 return false;
2749}
2750
2751CLI11_INLINE bool split_windows_style(const std::string &current,
2752 std::string &name,
2753 std::string &value) {
2754 if (current.size() > 1 && current[0] == '/' && valid_first_char(current[1])) {
2755 auto loc = current.find_first_of(':');
2756 if (loc != std::string::npos) {
2757 name = current.substr(1, loc - 1);
2758 value = current.substr(loc + 1);
2759 } else {
2760 name = current.substr(1);
2761 value = "";
2762 }
2763 return true;
2764 }
2765 return false;
2766}
2767
2768CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::string> split_names(std::string current) {
2769 std::vector<std::string> output;
2770 std::size_t val = 0;
2771 while ((val = current.find(',')) != std::string::npos) {
2772 output.push_back(trim_copy(current.substr(0, val)));
2773 current = current.substr(val + 1);
2774 }
2775 output.push_back(trim_copy(current));
2776 return output;
2777}
2778
2779CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> get_default_flag_values(
2780 const std::string &str) {
2781 std::vector<std::string> flags = split_names(str);
2782 flags.erase(std::remove_if(flags.begin(), flags.end(),
2783 [](const std::string &name) {
2784 return ((name.empty()) ||
2785 (!(((name.find_first_of('{') != std::string::npos) &&
2786 (name.back() == '}')) ||
2787 (name[0] == '!'))));
2788 }),
2789 flags.end());
2790 std::vector<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> output;
2791 output.reserve(flags.size());
2792 for (auto &flag : flags) {
2793 auto def_start = flag.find_first_of('{');
2794 std::string defval = "false";
2795 if ((def_start != std::string::npos) && (flag.back() == '}')) {
2796 defval = flag.substr(def_start + 1);
2797 defval.pop_back();
2798 flag.erase(def_start,
2799 std::string::npos); // NOLINT(readability-suspicious-call-argument)
2800 }
2801 flag.erase(0, flag.find_first_not_of("-!"));
2802 output.emplace_back(flag, defval);
2803 }
2804 return output;
2805}
2806
2807CLI11_INLINE std::tuple<std::vector<std::string>, std::vector<std::string>, std::string> get_names(
2808 const std::vector<std::string> &input) {
2809 std::vector<std::string> short_names;
2810 std::vector<std::string> long_names;
2811 std::string pos_name;
2812
2813 for (std::string name : input) {
2814 if (name.length() == 0) {
2815 continue;
2816 }
2817 if (name.length() > 1 && name[0] == '-' && name[1] != '-') {
2818 if (name.length() == 2 && valid_first_char(name[1]))
2819 short_names.emplace_back(1, name[1]);
2820 else
2821 throw BadNameString::OneCharName(name);
2822 } else if (name.length() > 2 && name.substr(0, 2) == "--") {
2823 name = name.substr(2);
2824 if (valid_name_string(name))
2825 long_names.push_back(name);
2826 else
2827 throw BadNameString::BadLongName(name);
2828 } else if (name == "-" || name == "--") {
2829 throw BadNameString::DashesOnly(name);
2830 } else {
2831 if (pos_name.length() > 0) throw BadNameString::MultiPositionalNames(name);
2832 pos_name = name;
2833 }
2834 }
2835
2836 return std::make_tuple(short_names, long_names, pos_name);
2837}
2838
2839} // namespace detail
2840
2841class App;
2842
2844struct ConfigItem {
2846 std::vector<std::string> parents{};
2847
2849 std::string name{};
2850
2852 std::vector<std::string> inputs{};
2853
2855 CLI11_NODISCARD std::string fullname() const {
2856 std::vector<std::string> tmp = parents;
2857 tmp.emplace_back(name);
2858 return detail::join(tmp, ".");
2859 }
2860};
2861
2863class Config {
2864protected:
2865 std::vector<ConfigItem> items{};
2866
2867public:
2869 virtual std::string to_config(const App *, bool, bool, std::string) const = 0;
2870
2872 virtual std::vector<ConfigItem> from_config(std::istream &) const = 0;
2873
2875 CLI11_NODISCARD virtual std::string to_flag(const ConfigItem &item) const {
2876 if (item.inputs.size() == 1) {
2877 return item.inputs.at(0);
2878 }
2879 if (item.inputs.empty()) {
2880 return "{}";
2881 }
2882 throw ConversionError::TooManyInputsFlag(item.fullname()); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
2883 }
2884
2886 CLI11_NODISCARD std::vector<ConfigItem> from_file(const std::string &name) const {
2887 std::ifstream input{name};
2888 if (!input.good()) throw FileError::Missing(name);
2889
2890 return from_config(input);
2891 }
2892
2894 virtual ~Config() = default;
2895};
2896
2898class ConfigBase : public Config {
2899protected:
2901 char commentChar = '#';
2903 char arrayStart = '[';
2905 char arrayEnd = ']';
2907 char arraySeparator = ',';
2909 char valueDelimiter = '=';
2911 char stringQuote = '"';
2913 char characterQuote = '\'';
2915 uint8_t maximumLayers{255};
2917 char parentSeparatorChar{'.'};
2919 int16_t configIndex{-1};
2921 std::string configSection{};
2922
2923public:
2924 std::string to_config(const App * /*app*/,
2925 bool default_also,
2926 bool write_description,
2927 std::string prefix) const override;
2928
2929 std::vector<ConfigItem> from_config(std::istream &input) const override;
2931 ConfigBase *comment(char cchar) {
2932 commentChar = cchar;
2933 return this;
2934 }
2936 ConfigBase *arrayBounds(char aStart, char aEnd) {
2937 arrayStart = aStart;
2938 arrayEnd = aEnd;
2939 return this;
2940 }
2942 ConfigBase *arrayDelimiter(char aSep) {
2943 arraySeparator = aSep;
2944 return this;
2945 }
2947 ConfigBase *valueSeparator(char vSep) {
2948 valueDelimiter = vSep;
2949 return this;
2950 }
2952 ConfigBase *quoteCharacter(char qString, char qChar) {
2953 stringQuote = qString;
2954 characterQuote = qChar;
2955 return this;
2956 }
2958 ConfigBase *maxLayers(uint8_t layers) {
2959 maximumLayers = layers;
2960 return this;
2961 }
2963 ConfigBase *parentSeparator(char sep) {
2964 parentSeparatorChar = sep;
2965 return this;
2966 }
2968 std::string &sectionRef() { return configSection; }
2970 CLI11_NODISCARD const std::string &section() const { return configSection; }
2972 ConfigBase *section(const std::string &sectionName) {
2973 configSection = sectionName;
2974 return this;
2975 }
2976
2978 int16_t &indexRef() { return configIndex; }
2980 CLI11_NODISCARD int16_t index() const { return configIndex; }
2982 ConfigBase *index(int16_t sectionIndex) {
2983 configIndex = sectionIndex;
2984 return this;
2985 }
2986};
2987
2989using ConfigTOML = ConfigBase;
2990
2992class ConfigINI : public ConfigTOML {
2993public:
2994 ConfigINI() {
2995 commentChar = ';';
2996 arrayStart = '\0';
2997 arrayEnd = '\0';
2998 arraySeparator = ' ';
2999 valueDelimiter = '=';
3000 }
3001};

3003class Option;

3006
3013
3015class Validator {
3016protected:
3018 std::function<std::string()> desc_function_{[]() { return std::string{}; }};
3019
3022 std::function<std::string(std::string &)> func_{[](std::string &) { return std::string{}; }};
3024 std::string name_{};
3026 int application_index_ = -1;
3028 bool active_{true};
3030 bool non_modifying_{false};
3031
3032 Validator(std::string validator_desc, std::function<std::string(std::string &)> func)
3033 : desc_function_([validator_desc]() { return validator_desc; }), func_(std::move(func)) {}
3034
3035public:
3036 Validator() = default;
3038 explicit Validator(std::string validator_desc)
3039 : desc_function_([validator_desc]() { return validator_desc; }) {}
3041 Validator(std::function<std::string(std::string &)> op,
3042 std::string validator_desc,
3043 std::string validator_name = "")
3044 : desc_function_([validator_desc]() { return validator_desc; }),
3045 func_(std::move(op)),
3046 name_(std::move(validator_name)) {}
3048 Validator &operation(std::function<std::string(std::string &)> op) {
3049 func_ = std::move(op);
3050 return *this;
3051 }
3054 std::string operator()(std::string &str) const;
3055
3058 std::string operator()(const std::string &str) const {
3059 std::string value = str;
3060 return (active_) ? func_(value) : std::string{};
3061 }
3062
3064 Validator &description(std::string validator_desc) {
3065 desc_function_ = [validator_desc]() { return validator_desc; };
3066 return *this;
3067 }
3069 CLI11_NODISCARD Validator description(std::string validator_desc) const;
3070
3072 CLI11_NODISCARD std::string get_description() const {
3073 if (active_) {
3074 return desc_function_();
3075 }
3076 return std::string{};
3077 }
3079 Validator &name(std::string validator_name) {
3080 name_ = std::move(validator_name);
3081 return *this;
3082 }
3084 CLI11_NODISCARD Validator name(std::string validator_name) const {
3085 Validator newval(*this);
3086 newval.name_ = std::move(validator_name);
3087 return newval;
3088 }
3090 CLI11_NODISCARD const std::string &get_name() const { return name_; }
3092 Validator &active(bool active_val = true) {
3093 active_ = active_val;
3094 return *this;
3095 }
3097 CLI11_NODISCARD Validator active(bool active_val = true) const {
3098 Validator newval(*this);
3099 newval.active_ = active_val;
3100 return newval;
3101 }
3102
3104 Validator &non_modifying(bool no_modify = true) {
3105 non_modifying_ = no_modify;
3106 return *this;
3107 }
3109 Validator &application_index(int app_index) {
3110 application_index_ = app_index;
3111 return *this;
3112 }
3114 CLI11_NODISCARD Validator application_index(int app_index) const {
3115 Validator newval(*this);
3116 newval.application_index_ = app_index;
3117 return newval;
3118 }
3120 CLI11_NODISCARD int get_application_index() const { return application_index_; }
3122 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_active() const { return active_; }
3123
3126 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_modifying() const { return !non_modifying_; }
3127
3130 Validator operator&(const Validator &other) const;
3131
3134 Validator operator|(const Validator &other) const;
3135
3137 Validator operator!() const;
3138
3139private:
3140 void _merge_description(const Validator &val1,
3141 const Validator &val2,
3142 const std::string &merger);
3143};
3144
3146class CustomValidator : public Validator {
3147public:
3148};
3149// The implementation of the built in validators is using the Validator class;
3150// the user is only expected to use the const (static) versions (since there's no setup).
3151// Therefore, this is in detail.
3152namespace detail {
3153
3155enum class path_type { nonexistent, file, directory };
3156
3158CLI11_INLINE path_type check_path(const char *file) noexcept;
3159
3161class ExistingFileValidator : public Validator {
3162public:
3163 ExistingFileValidator();
3164};
3165
3167class ExistingDirectoryValidator : public Validator {
3168public:
3169 ExistingDirectoryValidator();
3170};
3171
3173class ExistingPathValidator : public Validator {
3174public:
3175 ExistingPathValidator();
3176};
3177
3179class NonexistentPathValidator : public Validator {
3180public:
3181 NonexistentPathValidator();
3182};
3183
3185class IPV4Validator : public Validator {
3186public:
3187 IPV4Validator();
3188};
3189
3190} // namespace detail

3201const detail::ExistingPathValidator ExistingPath;
3202
3204const detail::NonexistentPathValidator NonexistentPath;
