3210template <typename DesiredType>
3211class TypeValidator : public Validator {
3212public:
3213 explicit TypeValidator(const std::string &validator_name)
3214 : Validator(validator_name, [](std::string &input_string) {
3215 auto val = DesiredType();
3216 if (!detail::lexical_cast(input_string, val)) {
3217 return std::string("Failed parsing ") + input_string + " as a " +
3218 detail::type_name<DesiredType>();
3219 }
3220 return std::string();
3221 }) {}
3222 TypeValidator() : TypeValidator(detail::type_name<DesiredType>()) {}
3223};
3224
3226const TypeValidator<double> Number("NUMBER");
3227
3230class FileOnDefaultPath : public Validator {
3231public:
3232 explicit FileOnDefaultPath(std::string default_path, bool enableErrorReturn = true);
3233};
3234
3236class Range : public Validator {
3237public:
3242 template <typename T>
3243 Range(T min_val, T max_val, const std::string &validator_name = std::string{})
3244 : Validator(validator_name) {
3245 if (validator_name.empty()) {
3246 std::stringstream out;
3247 out << detail::type_name<T>() << " in [" << min_val << " - " << max_val << "]";
3248 description(out.str());
3249 }
3250
3251 func_ = [min_val, max_val](std::string &input) {
3252 T val;
3253 bool converted = detail::lexical_cast(input, val);
3254 if ((!converted) || (val < min_val || val > max_val)) {
3255 std::stringstream out;
3256 out << "Value " << input << " not in range [";
3257 out << min_val << " - " << max_val << "]";
3258 return out.str();
3259 }
3260 return std::string{};
3261 };
3262 }
3263
3265 template <typename T>
3266 explicit Range(T max_val, const std::string &validator_name = std::string{})
3267 : Range(static_cast<T>(0), max_val, validator_name) {}
3268};
3269
3271const Range NonNegativeNumber((std::numeric_limits<double>::max)(), "NONNEGATIVE");
3272
3275const Range PositiveNumber((std::numeric_limits<double>::min)(),
3276 (std::numeric_limits<double>::max)(),
3277 "POSITIVE");
3278
3280class Bound : public Validator {
3281public:
3286 template <typename T>
3287 Bound(T min_val, T max_val) {
3288 std::stringstream out;
3289 out << detail::type_name<T>() << " bounded to [" << min_val << " - " << max_val << "]";
3290 description(out.str());
3291
3292 func_ = [min_val, max_val](std::string &input) {
3293 T val;
3294 bool converted = detail::lexical_cast(input, val);
3295 if (!converted) {
3296 return std::string("Value ") + input + " could not be converted";
3297 }
3298 if (val < min_val)
3299 input = detail::to_string(min_val);
3300 else if (val > max_val)
3301 input = detail::to_string(max_val);
3302
3303 return std::string{};
3304 };
3305 }
3306
3308 template <typename T>
3309 explicit Bound(T max_val) : Bound(static_cast<T>(0), max_val) {}
3310};
3311
3312namespace detail {
3313template <typename T,
3314 enable_if_t<is_copyable_ptr<typename std::remove_reference<T>::type>::value,
3315 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
3316auto smart_deref(T value) -> decltype(*value) {
3317 return *value;
3318}
3319
3320template <typename T,
3321 enable_if_t<!is_copyable_ptr<typename std::remove_reference<T>::type>::value,
3322 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
3323typename std::remove_reference<T>::type &smart_deref(T &value) {
3324 return value;
3325}
3327template <typename T>
3328std::string generate_set(const T &set) {
3329 using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type;
3330 using iteration_type_t =
3331 typename detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::value_type; // the type of the object pair
3332 std::string out(1, '{');
3333 out.append(detail::join(
3334 detail::smart_deref(set),
3335 [](const iteration_type_t &v) { return detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first(v); }, ","));
3336 out.push_back('}');
3337 return out;
3338}
3339
3341template <typename T>
3342std::string generate_map(const T &map, bool key_only = false) {
3343 using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type;
3344 using iteration_type_t =
3345 typename detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::value_type; // the type of the object pair
3346 std::string out(1, '{');
3347 out.append(detail::join(
3348 detail::smart_deref(map),
3349 [key_only](const iteration_type_t &v) {
3350 std::string res{detail::to_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first(v))};
3351
3352 if (!key_only) {
3353 res.append("->");
3354 res += detail::to_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::second(v));
3355 }
3356 return res;
3357 },
3358 ","));
3359 out.push_back('}');
3360 return out;
3361}
3362
3363template <typename C, typename V>
3364struct has_find {
3365 template <typename CC, typename VV>
3366 static auto test(int)
3367 -> decltype(std::declval<CC>().find(std::declval<VV>()), std::true_type());
3368 template <typename, typename>
3369 static auto test(...) -> decltype(std::false_type());
3370
3371 static const auto value = decltype(test<C, V>(0))::value;
3372 using type = std::integral_constant<bool, value>;
3373};
3374
3376template <typename T,
3377 typename V,
3378 enable_if_t<!has_find<T, V>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
3379auto search(const T &set, const V &val)
3380 -> std::pair<bool, decltype(std::begin(detail::smart_deref(set)))> {
3381 using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type;
3382 auto &setref = detail::smart_deref(set);
3383 auto it =
3384 std::find_if(std::begin(setref), std::end(setref), [&val](decltype(*std::begin(setref)) v) {
3385 return (detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first(v) == val);
3386 });
3387 return {(it != std::end(setref)), it};
3388}
3389
3391template <typename T,
3392 typename V,
3393 enable_if_t<has_find<T, V>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
3394auto search(const T &set, const V &val)
3395 -> std::pair<bool, decltype(std::begin(detail::smart_deref(set)))> {
3396 auto &setref = detail::smart_deref(set);
3397 auto it = setref.find(val);
3398 return {(it != std::end(setref)), it};
3399}
3400
3402template <typename T, typename V>
3403auto search(const T &set, const V &val, const std::function<V(V)> &filter_function)
3404 -> std::pair<bool, decltype(std::begin(detail::smart_deref(set)))> {
3405 using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type;
3406 // do the potentially faster first search
3407 auto res = search(set, val);
3408 if ((res.first) || (!(filter_function))) {
3409 return res;
3410 }
3411 // if we haven't found it do the longer linear search with all the element translations
3412 auto &setref = detail::smart_deref(set);
3413 auto it =
3414 std::find_if(std::begin(setref), std::end(setref), [&](decltype(*std::begin(setref)) v) {
3415 V a{detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first(v)};
3416 a = filter_function(a);
3417 return (a == val);
3418 });
3419 return {(it != std::end(setref)), it};
3420}
3421
3422// the following suggestion was made by Nikita Ofitserov(@himikof)
3423// done in templates to prevent compiler warnings on negation of unsigned numbers
3424
3426template <typename T>
3427inline typename std::enable_if<std::is_signed<T>::value, T>::type overflowCheck(const T &a,
3428 const T &b) {
3429 if ((a > 0) == (b > 0)) {
3430 return ((std::numeric_limits<T>::max)() / (std::abs)(a) < (std::abs)(b));
3431 }
3432 return ((std::numeric_limits<T>::min)() / (std::abs)(a) > -(std::abs)(b));
3433}
3435template <typename T>
3436inline typename std::enable_if<!std::is_signed<T>::value, T>::type overflowCheck(const T &a,
3437 const T &b) {
3438 return ((std::numeric_limits<T>::max)() / a < b);
3439}
3440
3442template <typename T>
3443typename std::enable_if<std::is_integral<T>::value, bool>::type checked_multiply(T &a, T b) {
3444 if (a == 0 || b == 0 || a == 1 || b == 1) {
3445 a *= b;
3446 return true;
3447 }
3448 if (a == (std::numeric_limits<T>::min)() || b == (std::numeric_limits<T>::min)()) {
3449 return false;
3450 }
3451 if (overflowCheck(a, b)) {
3452 return false;
3453 }
3454 a *= b;
3455 return true;
3456}
3457
3459template <typename T>
3460typename std::enable_if<std::is_floating_point<T>::value, bool>::type checked_multiply(T &a, T b) {
3461 T c = a * b;
3462 if (std::isinf(c) && !std::isinf(a) && !std::isinf(b)) {
3463 return false;
3464 }
3465 a = c;
3466 return true;
3467}
3468
3469} // namespace detail
3471class IsMember : public Validator {
3472public:
3473 using filter_fn_t = std::function<std::string(std::string)>;
3474
3476 template <typename T, typename... Args>
3477 IsMember(std::initializer_list<T> values, Args &&...args)
3478 : IsMember(std::vector<T>(values), std::forward<Args>(args)...) {}
3479
3481 template <typename T>
3482 explicit IsMember(T &&set) : IsMember(std::forward<T>(set), nullptr) {}
3483
3486 template <typename T, typename F>
3487 explicit IsMember(T set, F filter_function) {
3488 // Get the type of the contained item - requires a container have ::value_type
3489 // if the type does not have first_type and second_type, these are both value_type
3490 using element_t =
3491 typename detail::element_type<T>::type; // Removes (smart) pointers if needed
3492 using item_t =
3493 typename detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first_type; // Is value_type if not a map
3494
3495 using local_item_t =
3496 typename IsMemberType<item_t>::type; // This will convert bad types to good ones
3497 // (const char * to std::string)
3498
3499 // Make a local copy of the filter function, using a std::function if not one already
3500 std::function<local_item_t(local_item_t)> filter_fn = filter_function;
3501
3502 // This is the type name for help, it will take the current version of the set contents
3503 desc_function_ = [set]() { return detail::generate_set(detail::smart_deref(set)); };
3504
3505 // This is the function that validates
3506 // It stores a copy of the set pointer-like, so shared_ptr will stay alive
3507 func_ = [set, filter_fn](std::string &input) {
3508 local_item_t b;
3509 if (!detail::lexical_cast(input, b)) {
3510 throw ValidationError(input); // name is added later
3511 }
3512 if (filter_fn) {
3513 b = filter_fn(b);
3514 }
3515 auto res = detail::search(set, b, filter_fn);
3516 if (res.first) {
3517 // Make sure the version in the input string is identical to the one in the set
3518 if (filter_fn) {
3519 input =
3520 detail::value_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first(*(res.second)));
3521 }
3522
3523 // Return empty error string (success)
3524 return std::string{};
3525 }
3526
3527 // If you reach this point, the result was not found
3528 return input + " not in " + detail::generate_set(detail::smart_deref(set));
3529 };
3530 }
3531
3533 template <typename T, typename... Args>
3534 IsMember(T &&set, filter_fn_t filter_fn_1, filter_fn_t filter_fn_2, Args &&...other)
3535 : IsMember(
3536 std::forward<T>(set),
3537 [filter_fn_1, filter_fn_2](std::string a) { return filter_fn_2(filter_fn_1(a)); },
3538 other...) {}
3539};
3540
3542template <typename T>
3543using TransformPairs = std::vector<std::pair<std::string, T>>;
3544
3546class Transformer : public Validator {
3547public:
3548 using filter_fn_t = std::function<std::string(std::string)>;
3549
3551 template <typename... Args>
3552 Transformer(std::initializer_list<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> values, Args &&...args)
3553 : Transformer(TransformPairs<std::string>(values), std::forward<Args>(args)...) {}
3554
3556 template <typename T>
3557 explicit Transformer(T &&mapping) : Transformer(std::forward<T>(mapping), nullptr) {}
3558
3561 template <typename T, typename F>
3562 explicit Transformer(T mapping, F filter_function) {
3563 static_assert(detail::pair_adaptor<typename detail::element_type<T>::type>::value,
3564 "mapping must produce value pairs");
3565 // Get the type of the contained item - requires a container have ::value_type
3566 // if the type does not have first_type and second_type, these are both value_type
3567 using element_t =
3568 typename detail::element_type<T>::type; // Removes (smart) pointers if needed
3569 using item_t =
3570 typename detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first_type; // Is value_type if not a map
3571 using local_item_t =
3572 typename IsMemberType<item_t>::type; // Will convert bad types to good ones
3573 // (const char * to std::string)
3574
3575 // Make a local copy of the filter function, using a std::function if not one already
3576 std::function<local_item_t(local_item_t)> filter_fn = filter_function;
3577
3578 // This is the type name for help, it will take the current version of the set contents
3579 desc_function_ = [mapping]() { return detail::generate_map(detail::smart_deref(mapping)); };
3580
3581 func_ = [mapping, filter_fn](std::string &input) {
3582 local_item_t b;
3583 if (!detail::lexical_cast(input, b)) {
3584 return std::string();
3585 // there is no possible way we can match anything in the mapping if we can't convert
3586 // so just return
3587 }
3588 if (filter_fn) {
3589 b = filter_fn(b);
3590 }
3591 auto res = detail::search(mapping, b, filter_fn);
3592 if (res.first) {
3593 input = detail::value_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::second(*res.second));
3594 }
3595 return std::string{};
3596 };
3597 }
3598
3600 template <typename T, typename... Args>
3601 Transformer(T &&mapping, filter_fn_t filter_fn_1, filter_fn_t filter_fn_2, Args &&...other)
3602 : Transformer(
3603 std::forward<T>(mapping),
3604 [filter_fn_1, filter_fn_2](std::string a) { return filter_fn_2(filter_fn_1(a)); },
3605 other...) {}
3606};
3607
3609class CheckedTransformer : public Validator {
3610public:
3611 using filter_fn_t = std::function<std::string(std::string)>;
3612
3614 template <typename... Args>
3615 CheckedTransformer(std::initializer_list<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> values,
3616 Args &&...args)
3617 : CheckedTransformer(TransformPairs<std::string>(values), std::forward<Args>(args)...) {}
3618
3620 template <typename T>
3621 explicit CheckedTransformer(T mapping) : CheckedTransformer(std::move(mapping), nullptr) {}
3622
3625 template <typename T, typename F>
3626 explicit CheckedTransformer(T mapping, F filter_function) {
3627 static_assert(detail::pair_adaptor<typename detail::element_type<T>::type>::value,
3628 "mapping must produce value pairs");
3629 // Get the type of the contained item - requires a container have ::value_type
3630 // if the type does not have first_type and second_type, these are both value_type
3631 using element_t =
3632 typename detail::element_type<T>::type; // Removes (smart) pointers if needed
3633 using item_t =
3634 typename detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first_type; // Is value_type if not a map
3635 using local_item_t =
3636 typename IsMemberType<item_t>::type; // Will convert bad types to good ones
3637 // (const char * to std::string)
3638 using iteration_type_t =
3639 typename detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::value_type; // the type of the object pair
3640
3641 // Make a local copy of the filter function, using a std::function if not one already
3642 std::function<local_item_t(local_item_t)> filter_fn = filter_function;
3643
3644 auto tfunc = [mapping]() {
3645 std::string out("value in ");
3646 out += detail::generate_map(detail::smart_deref(mapping)) + " OR {";
3647 out += detail::join(
3648 detail::smart_deref(mapping),
3649 [](const iteration_type_t &v) {
3650 return detail::to_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::second(v));
3651 },
3652 ",");
3653 out.push_back('}');
3654 return out;
3655 };
3656
3657 desc_function_ = tfunc;
3658
3659 func_ = [mapping, tfunc, filter_fn](std::string &input) {
3660 local_item_t b;
3661 bool converted = detail::lexical_cast(input, b);
3662 if (converted) {
3663 if (filter_fn) {
3664 b = filter_fn(b);
3665 }
3666 auto res = detail::search(mapping, b, filter_fn);
3667 if (res.first) {
3668 input =
3669 detail::value_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::second(*res.second));
3670 return std::string{};
3671 }
3672 }
3673 for (const auto &v : detail::smart_deref(mapping)) {
3674 auto output_string =
3675 detail::value_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::second(v));
3676 if (output_string == input) {
3677 return std::string();
3678 }
3679 }
3680
3681 return "Check " + input + " " + tfunc() + " FAILED";
3682 };
3683 }
3684
3686 template <typename T, typename... Args>
3687 CheckedTransformer(T &&mapping,
3688 filter_fn_t filter_fn_1,
3689 filter_fn_t filter_fn_2,
3690 Args &&...other)
3691 : CheckedTransformer(
3692 std::forward<T>(mapping),
3693 [filter_fn_1, filter_fn_2](std::string a) { return filter_fn_2(filter_fn_1(a)); },
3694 other...) {}
3695};
3696
3698inline std::string ignore_case(std::string item) { return detail::to_lower(item); }
3699
3701inline std::string ignore_underscore(std::string item) { return detail::remove_underscore(item); }
3702
3704inline std::string ignore_space(std::string item) {
3705 item.erase(std::remove(std::begin(item), std::end(item), ' '), std::end(item));
3706 item.erase(std::remove(std::begin(item), std::end(item), '\t'), std::end(item));
3707 return item;
3708}
3709
3721class AsNumberWithUnit : public Validator {
3722public:
3727 enum Options {
3728 CASE_SENSITIVE = 0,
3729 CASE_INSENSITIVE = 1,
3730 UNIT_OPTIONAL = 0,
3731 UNIT_REQUIRED = 2,
3732 DEFAULT = CASE_INSENSITIVE | UNIT_OPTIONAL
3733 };
3734
3735 template <typename Number>
3736 explicit AsNumberWithUnit(std::map<std::string, Number> mapping,
3737 Options opts = DEFAULT,
3738 const std::string &unit_name = "UNIT") {
3739 description(generate_description<Number>(unit_name, opts));
3740 validate_mapping(mapping, opts);
3741
3742 // transform function
3743 func_ = [mapping, opts](std::string &input) -> std::string {
3744 Number num{};
3745
3746 detail::rtrim(input);
3747 if (input.empty()) {
3748 throw ValidationError("Input is empty");
3749 }
3750
3751 // Find split position between number and prefix
3752 auto unit_begin = input.end();
3753 while (unit_begin > input.begin() && std::isalpha(*(unit_begin - 1), std::locale())) {
3754 --unit_begin;
3755 }
3756
3757 std::string unit{unit_begin, input.end()};
3758 input.resize(static_cast<std::size_t>(std::distance(input.begin(), unit_begin)));
3759 detail::trim(input);
3760
3761 if (opts & UNIT_REQUIRED && unit.empty()) {
3762 throw ValidationError("Missing mandatory unit");
3763 }
3764 if (opts & CASE_INSENSITIVE) {
3765 unit = detail::to_lower(unit);
3766 }
3767 if (unit.empty()) {
3768 if (!detail::lexical_cast(input, num)) {
3769 throw ValidationError(std::string("Value ") + input +
3770 " could not be converted to " +
3771 detail::type_name<Number>());
3772 }
3773 // No need to modify input if no unit passed
3774 return {};
3775 }
3776
3777 // find corresponding factor
3778 auto it = mapping.find(unit);
3779 if (it == mapping.end()) {
3780 throw ValidationError(unit +
3781 " unit not recognized. "
3782 "Allowed values: " +
3783 detail::generate_map(mapping, true));
3784 }
3785
3786 if (!input.empty()) {
3787 bool converted = detail::lexical_cast(input, num);
3788 if (!converted) {
3789 throw ValidationError(std::string("Value ") + input +
3790 " could not be converted to " +
3791 detail::type_name<Number>());
3792 }
3793 // perform safe multiplication
3794 bool ok = detail::checked_multiply(num, it->second);
3795 if (!ok) {
3796 throw ValidationError(
3797 detail::to_string(num) + " multiplied by " + unit +
3798 " factor would cause number overflow. Use smaller value.");
3799 }
3800 } else {
3801 num = static_cast<Number>(it->second);
3802 }
3803
3804 input = detail::to_string(num);
3805
3806 return {};
3807 };
3808 }
3809
3810private:
3813 template <typename Number>
3814 static void validate_mapping(std::map<std::string, Number> &mapping, Options opts) {
3815 for (auto &kv : mapping) {
3816 if (kv.first.empty()) {
3817 throw ValidationError("Unit must not be empty.");
3818 }
3819 if (!detail::isalpha(kv.first)) {
3820 throw ValidationError("Unit must contain only letters.");
3821 }
3822 }
3823
3824 // make all units lowercase if CASE_INSENSITIVE
3825 if (opts & CASE_INSENSITIVE) {
3826 std::map<std::string, Number> lower_mapping;
3827 for (auto &kv : mapping) {
3828 auto s = detail::to_lower(kv.first);
3829 if (lower_mapping.count(s)) {
3830 throw ValidationError(
3831 std::string("Several matching lowercase unit representations are found: ") +
3832 s);
3833 }
3834 lower_mapping[detail::to_lower(kv.first)] = kv.second;
3835 }
3836 mapping = std::move(lower_mapping);
3837 }
3838 }
3839
3841 template <typename Number>
3842 static std::string generate_description(const std::string &name, Options opts) {
3843 std::stringstream out;
3844 out << detail::type_name<Number>() << ' ';
3845 if (opts & UNIT_REQUIRED) {
3846 out << name;
3847 } else {
3848 out << '[' << name << ']';
3849 }
3850 return out.str();
3851 }
3852};
3853
3854inline AsNumberWithUnit::Options operator|(const AsNumberWithUnit::Options &a,
3855 const AsNumberWithUnit::Options &b) {
3856 return static_cast<AsNumberWithUnit::Options>(static_cast<int>(a) | static_cast<int>(b));
3857}
3858
3867class AsSizeValue : public AsNumberWithUnit {
3868public:
3869 using result_t = std::uint64_t;
3870
3878 explicit AsSizeValue(bool kb_is_1000);
3879
3880private:
3882 static std::map<std::string, result_t> init_mapping(bool kb_is_1000);
3883
3885 static std::map<std::string, result_t> get_mapping(bool kb_is_1000);
3886};
3887
3888namespace detail {
3893CLI11_INLINE std::pair<std::string, std::string> split_program_name(std::string commandline);
3894
3895} // namespace detail
3897
3898CLI11_INLINE std::string Validator::operator()(std::string &str) const {
3899 std::string retstring;
3900 if (active_) {
3901 if (non_modifying_) {
3902 std::string value = str;
3903 retstring = func_(value);
3904 } else {
3905 retstring = func_(str);
3906 }
3907 }
3908 return retstring;
3909}
3910
3911CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE Validator Validator::description(std::string validator_desc) const {
3912 Validator newval(*this);
3913 newval.desc_function_ = [validator_desc]() { return validator_desc; };
3914 return newval;
3915}
3916
3917CLI11_INLINE Validator Validator::operator&(const Validator &other) const {
3918 Validator newval;
3919
3920 newval._merge_description(*this, other, " AND ");
3921
3922 // Give references (will make a copy in lambda function)
3923 const std::function<std::string(std::string & filename)> &f1 = func_;
3924 const std::function<std::string(std::string & filename)> &f2 = other.func_;
3925
3926 newval.func_ = [f1, f2](std::string &input) {
3927 std::string s1 = f1(input);
3928 std::string s2 = f2(input);
3929 if (!s1.empty() && !s2.empty()) return std::string("(") + s1 + ") AND (" + s2 + ")";
3930 return s1 + s2;
3931 };
3932
3933 newval.active_ = active_ && other.active_;
3934 newval.application_index_ = application_index_;
3935 return newval;
3936}
3937
3938CLI11_INLINE Validator Validator::operator|(const Validator &other) const {
3939 Validator newval;
3940
3941 newval._merge_description(*this, other, " OR ");
3942
3943 // Give references (will make a copy in lambda function)
3944 const std::function<std::string(std::string &)> &f1 = func_;
3945 const std::function<std::string(std::string &)> &f2 = other.func_;
3946
3947 newval.func_ = [f1, f2](std::string &input) {
3948 std::string s1 = f1(input);
3949 std::string s2 = f2(input);
3950 if (s1.empty() || s2.empty()) return std::string();
3951
3952 return std::string("(") + s1 + ") OR (" + s2 + ")";
3953 };
3954 newval.active_ = active_ && other.active_;
3955 newval.application_index_ = application_index_;
3956 return newval;
3957}
3958
3959CLI11_INLINE Validator Validator::operator!() const {
3960 Validator newval;
3961 const std::function<std::string()> &dfunc1 = desc_function_;
3962 newval.desc_function_ = [dfunc1]() {
3963 auto str = dfunc1();
3964 return (!str.empty()) ? std::string("NOT ") + str : std::string{};
3965 };
3966 // Give references (will make a copy in lambda function)
3967 const std::function<std::string(std::string & res)> &f1 = func_;
3968
3969 newval.func_ = [f1, dfunc1](std::string &test) -> std::string {
3970 std::string s1 = f1(test);
3971 if (s1.empty()) {
3972 return std::string("check ") + dfunc1() + " succeeded improperly";
3973 }
3974 return std::string{};
3975 };
3976 newval.active_ = active_;
3977 newval.application_index_ = application_index_;
3978 return newval;
3979}
3980
3981CLI11_INLINE void Validator::_merge_description(const Validator &val1,
3982 const Validator &val2,
3983 const std::string &merger) {
3984 const std::function<std::string()> &dfunc1 = val1.desc_function_;
3985 const std::function<std::string()> &dfunc2 = val2.desc_function_;
3986
3987 desc_function_ = [=]() {
3988 std::string f1 = dfunc1();
3989 std::string f2 = dfunc2();
3990 if ((f1.empty()) || (f2.empty())) {
3991 return f1 + f2;
3992 }
3993 return std::string(1, '(') + f1 + ')' + merger + '(' + f2 + ')';
3994 };
3995}
3996
3997namespace detail {
3998
3999#if defined CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM && CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM > 0
4000CLI11_INLINE path_type check_path(const char *file) noexcept {
4001 std::error_code ec;
4002 auto stat = std::filesystem::status(file, ec);
4003 if (ec) {
4004 return path_type::nonexistent;
4005 }
4006 switch (stat.type()) {
4007 case std::filesystem::file_type::none: // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
4008 case std::filesystem::file_type::not_found:
4009 return path_type::nonexistent;
4010 case std::filesystem::file_type::directory:
4011 return path_type::directory;
4012 case std::filesystem::file_type::symlink:
4013 case std::filesystem::file_type::block:
4014 case std::filesystem::file_type::character:
4015 case std::filesystem::file_type::fifo:
4016 case std::filesystem::file_type::socket:
4017 case std::filesystem::file_type::regular:
4018 case std::filesystem::file_type::unknown:
4019 default:
4020 return path_type::file;
4021 }
4022}
4023#else
4024CLI11_INLINE path_type check_path(const char *file) noexcept {
4025#if defined(_MSC_VER)
4026 struct __stat64 buffer;
4027 if (_stat64(file, &buffer) == 0) {
4028 return ((buffer.st_mode & S_IFDIR) != 0) ? path_type::directory : path_type::file;
4029 }
4030#else
4031 struct stat buffer;
4032 if (stat(file, &buffer) == 0) {
4033 return ((buffer.st_mode & S_IFDIR) != 0) ? path_type::directory : path_type::file;
4034 }
4035#endif
4036 return path_type::nonexistent;
4037}
4038#endif
4039
4040CLI11_INLINE ExistingFileValidator::ExistingFileValidator() : Validator("FILE") {
4041 func_ = [](std::string &filename) {
4042 auto path_result = check_path(filename.c_str());
4043 if (path_result == path_type::nonexistent) {
4044 return "File does not exist: " + filename;
4045 }
4046 if (path_result == path_type::directory) {
4047 return "File is actually a directory: " + filename;
4048 }
4049 return std::string();
4050 };
4051}
4052
4053CLI11_INLINE ExistingDirectoryValidator::ExistingDirectoryValidator() : Validator("DIR") {
4054 func_ = [](std::string &filename) {
4055 auto path_result = check_path(filename.c_str());
4056 if (path_result == path_type::nonexistent) {
4057 return "Directory does not exist: " + filename;
4058 }
4059 if (path_result == path_type::file) {
4060 return "Directory is actually a file: " + filename;
4061 }
4062 return std::string();
4063 };
4064}
4065
4066CLI11_INLINE ExistingPathValidator::ExistingPathValidator() : Validator("PATH(existing)") {
4067 func_ = [](std::string &filename) {
4068 auto path_result = check_path(filename.c_str());
4069 if (path_result == path_type::nonexistent) {
4070 return "Path does not exist: " + filename;
4071 }
4072 return std::string();
4073 };
4074}
4075
4076CLI11_INLINE NonexistentPathValidator::NonexistentPathValidator()
4077 : Validator("PATH(non-existing)") {
4078 func_ = [](std::string &filename) {
4079 auto path_result = check_path(filename.c_str());
4080 if (path_result != path_type::nonexistent) {
4081 return "Path already exists: " + filename;
4082 }
4083 return std::string();
4084 };
4085}
4086
4087CLI11_INLINE IPV4Validator::IPV4Validator() : Validator("IPV4") {
4088 func_ = [](std::string &ip_addr) {
4089 auto result = CLI::detail::split(ip_addr, '.');
4090 if (result.size() != 4) {
4091 return std::string("Invalid IPV4 address must have four parts (") + ip_addr + ')';
4092 }
4093 int num = 0;
4094 for (const auto &var : result) {
4095 bool retval = detail::lexical_cast(var, num);
4096 if (!retval) {
4097 return std::string("Failed parsing number (") + var + ')';
4098 }
4099 if (num < 0 || num > 255) {
4100 return std::string("Each IP number must be between 0 and 255 ") + var;
4101 }
4102 }
4103 return std::string();
4104 };
4105}
4106
4107} // namespace detail
4108
4109CLI11_INLINE FileOnDefaultPath::FileOnDefaultPath(std::string default_path, bool enableErrorReturn)
4110 : Validator("FILE") {
4111 func_ = [default_path, enableErrorReturn](std::string &filename) {
4112 auto path_result = detail::check_path(filename.c_str());
4113 if (path_result == detail::path_type::nonexistent) {
4114 std::string test_file_path = default_path;
4115 if (default_path.back() != '/' && default_path.back() != '\\') {
4116 // Add folder separator
4117 test_file_path += '/';
4118 }
4119 test_file_path.append(filename);
4120 path_result = detail::check_path(test_file_path.c_str());
4121 if (path_result == detail::path_type::file) {
4122 filename = test_file_path;
4123 } else {
4124 if (enableErrorReturn) {
4125 return "File does not exist: " + filename;
4126 }
4127 }
4128 }
4129 return std::string{};
4130 };
4131}
4132
4133CLI11_INLINE AsSizeValue::AsSizeValue(bool kb_is_1000) : AsNumberWithUnit(get_mapping(kb_is_1000)) {
4134 if (kb_is_1000) {
4135 description("SIZE [b, kb(=1000b), kib(=1024b), ...]");
4136 } else {
4137 description("SIZE [b, kb(=1024b), ...]");
4138 }
4139}
4140
4141CLI11_INLINE std::map<std::string, AsSizeValue::result_t> AsSizeValue::init_mapping(
4142 bool kb_is_1000) {
4143 std::map<std::string, result_t> m;
4144 result_t k_factor = kb_is_1000 ? 1000 : 1024;
4145 result_t ki_factor = 1024;
4146 result_t k = 1;
4147 result_t ki = 1;
4148 m["b"] = 1;
4149 for (std::string p : {"k", "m", "g", "t", "p", "e"}) {
4150 k *= k_factor;
4151 ki *= ki_factor;
4152 m[p] = k;
4153 m[p + "b"] = k;
4154 m[p + "i"] = ki;
4155 m[p + "ib"] = ki;
4156 }
4157 return m;
4158}
4159
4160CLI11_INLINE std::map<std::string, AsSizeValue::result_t> AsSizeValue::get_mapping(
4161 bool kb_is_1000) {
4162 if (kb_is_1000) {
4163 static auto m = init_mapping(true);
4164 return m;
4165 }
4166 static auto m = init_mapping(false);
4167 return m;
4168}
4169
4170namespace detail {
4171
4172CLI11_INLINE std::pair<std::string, std::string> split_program_name(std::string commandline) {
4173 // try to determine the programName
4174 std::pair<std::string, std::string> vals;
4175 trim(commandline);
4176 auto esp = commandline.find_first_of(' ', 1);
4177 while (detail::check_path(commandline.substr(0, esp).c_str()) != path_type::file) {
4178 esp = commandline.find_first_of(' ', esp + 1);
4179 if (esp == std::string::npos) {
4180 // if we have reached the end and haven't found a valid file just assume the first
4181 // argument is the program name
4182 if (commandline[0] == '"' || commandline[0] == '\'' || commandline[0] == '`') {
4183 bool embeddedQuote = false;
4184 auto keyChar = commandline[0];
4185 auto end = commandline.find_first_of(keyChar, 1);
4186 while ((end != std::string::npos) &&
4187 (commandline[end - 1] == '\\')) { // deal with escaped quotes
4188 end = commandline.find_first_of(keyChar, end + 1);
4189 embeddedQuote = true;
4190 }
4191 if (end != std::string::npos) {
4192 vals.first = commandline.substr(1, end - 1);
4193 esp = end + 1;
4194 if (embeddedQuote) {
4195 vals.first = find_and_replace(vals.first, std::string("\\") + keyChar,
4196 std::string(1, keyChar));
4197 }
4198 } else {
4199 esp = commandline.find_first_of(' ', 1);
4200 }
4201 } else {
4202 esp = commandline.find_first_of(' ', 1);
4203 }
4204
4205 break;
4206 }
4207 }
4208 if (vals.first.empty()) {
4209 vals.first = commandline.substr(0, esp);
4210 rtrim(vals.first);
4211 }
4212
4213 // strip the program name
4214 vals.second = (esp < commandline.length() - 1) ? commandline.substr(esp + 1) : std::string{};
4215 ltrim(vals.second);
4216 return vals;
4217}
4218
4219} // namespace detail
4221
4222class Option;
4223class App;
4224
4229
4230enum class AppFormatMode {
4231 Normal,
4232 All,
4233 Sub,
4234};
4235
4240class FormatterBase {
4241protected:
4244
4246 std::size_t column_width_{30};
4247
4250 std::map<std::string, std::string> labels_{};
4251
4255
4256public:
4257 FormatterBase() = default;
4258 FormatterBase(const FormatterBase &) = default;
4259 FormatterBase(FormatterBase &&) = default;
4260 FormatterBase &operator=(const FormatterBase &) = default;
4261 FormatterBase &operator=(FormatterBase &&) = default;
4262
4264 virtual ~FormatterBase() noexcept {} // NOLINT(modernize-use-equals-default)
4265
4267 virtual std::string make_help(const App *, std::string, AppFormatMode) const = 0;
4268
4272
4274 void label(std::string key, std::string val) { labels_[key] = val; }
4275
4277 void column_width(std::size_t val) { column_width_ = val; }
4278
4282
4284 CLI11_NODISCARD std::string get_label(std::string key) const {
4285 if (labels_.find(key) == labels_.end()) return key;
4286 return labels_.at(key);
4287 }
4288
4290 CLI11_NODISCARD std::size_t get_column_width() const { return column_width_; }
4291
4293};
4294
4296class FormatterLambda final : public FormatterBase {
4297 using funct_t = std::function<std::string(const App *, std::string, AppFormatMode)>;
4298
4300 funct_t lambda_;
4301
4302public:
4304 explicit FormatterLambda(funct_t funct) : lambda_(std::move(funct)) {}
4305
4307 ~FormatterLambda() noexcept override {} // NOLINT(modernize-use-equals-default)
4308
4310 std::string make_help(const App *app, std::string name, AppFormatMode mode) const override {
4311 return lambda_(app, name, mode);
4312 }
4313};
4314
4317class Formatter : public FormatterBase {
4318public:
4319 Formatter() = default;
4320 Formatter(const Formatter &) = default;
4321 Formatter(Formatter &&) = default;
4322 Formatter &operator=(const Formatter &) = default;
4323 Formatter &operator=(Formatter &&) = default;
4324
4327
4330 CLI11_NODISCARD virtual std::string make_group(std::string group,
4331 bool is_positional,
4332 std::vector<const Option *> opts) const;
4333
4335 virtual std::string make_positionals(const App *app) const;
4336
4338 std::string make_groups(const App *app, AppFormatMode mode) const;
4339
4341 virtual std::string make_subcommands(const App *app, AppFormatMode mode) const;
4342
4344 virtual std::string make_subcommand(const App *sub) const;
4345
4347 virtual std::string make_expanded(const App *sub) const;
4348
4350 virtual std::string make_footer(const App *app) const;
4351
4353 virtual std::string make_description(const App *app) const;
4354
4356 virtual std::string make_usage(const App *app, std::string name) const;
4357
4359 std::string make_help(const App * /*app*/, std::string, AppFormatMode) const override;
4360
4364
4366 virtual std::string make_option(const Option *opt, bool is_positional) const {
4367 std::stringstream out;
4368 detail::format_help(out, make_option_name(opt, is_positional) + make_option_opts(opt),
4369 make_option_desc(opt), column_width_);
4370 return out.str();
4371 }
4372
4374 virtual std::string make_option_name(const Option *, bool) const;
4375
4377 virtual std::string make_option_opts(const Option *) const;
4378
4380 virtual std::string make_option_desc(const Option *) const;
4381
4383 virtual std::string make_option_usage(const Option *opt) const;
4384
4386};
4387
4388using results_t = std::vector<std::string>;
4390using callback_t = std::function<bool(const results_t &)>;
4391
4392class Option;
4393class App;
4394
4395using Option_p = std::unique_ptr<Option>;
4397enum class MultiOptionPolicy : char {
4398 Throw,
4399 TakeLast,
4400 TakeFirst,
4401 Join,
4403 TakeAll,
4404 Sum
4405};
4406
4409template <typename CRTP>
4410class OptionBase {
4411 friend App;
4412
4413protected:
4415 std::string group_ = std::string("Options");
4416
4418 bool required_{false};
4419
4421 bool ignore_case_{false};
4422
4424 bool ignore_underscore_{false};
4425
4427 bool configurable_{true};
4428
4430 bool disable_flag_override_{false};
4431
4433 char delimiter_{'\0'};
4434
4436 bool always_capture_default_{false};
4437
4439 MultiOptionPolicy multi_option_policy_{MultiOptionPolicy::Throw};
4440
4442 template <typename T>
4443 void copy_to(T *other) const;
4444
4445public:
4446 // setters
4447
4449 CRTP *group(const std::string &name) {
4450 if (!detail::valid_alias_name_string(name)) {
4451 throw IncorrectConstruction("Group names may not contain newlines or null characters");
4452 }
4453 group_ = name;
4454 return static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
4455 }
4456
4458 CRTP *required(bool value = true) {
4459 required_ = value;
4460 return static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
4461 }
4462
4464 CRTP *mandatory(bool value = true) { return required(value); }
4465
4466 CRTP *always_capture_default(bool value = true) {
4467 always_capture_default_ = value;
4468 return static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
4469 }
4470
4471 // Getters
4472
4474 CLI11_NODISCARD const std::string &get_group() const { return group_; }
4475
4477 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_required() const { return required_; }
4478
4480 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_ignore_case() const { return ignore_case_; }
4481
4483 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_ignore_underscore() const { return ignore_underscore_; }
4484
4486 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_configurable() const { return configurable_; }
4487
4489 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_disable_flag_override() const { return disable_flag_override_; }
4490
4492 CLI11_NODISCARD char get_delimiter() const { return delimiter_; }
4493
4495 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_always_capture_default() const { return always_capture_default_; }
4496
4498 CLI11_NODISCARD MultiOptionPolicy get_multi_option_policy() const {
4499 return multi_option_policy_;
4500 }
4501
4502 // Shortcuts for multi option policy
4503
4505 CRTP *take_last() {
4506 auto *self = static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
4507 self->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeLast);
4508 return self;
4509 }
4510
4512 CRTP *take_first() {
4513 auto *self = static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
4514 self->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeFirst);
4515 return self;
4516 }
4517
4519 CRTP *take_all() {
4520 auto self = static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
4521 self->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeAll);
4522 return self;
4523 }
4524
4526 CRTP *join() {
4527 auto *self = static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
4528 self->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::Join);
4529 return self;
4530 }
4531
4533 CRTP *join(char delim) {
4534 auto self = static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
4535 self->delimiter_ = delim;
4536 self->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::Join);
4537 return self;
4538 }
4539
4541 CRTP *configurable(bool value = true) {
4542 configurable_ = value;
4543 return static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
4544 }
4545
4547 CRTP *delimiter(char value = '\0') {
4548 delimiter_ = value;
4549 return static_cast<CRTP *>(this);
4550 }
4551};
4552
4555class OptionDefaults : public OptionBase<OptionDefaults> {
4556public:
4557 OptionDefaults() = default;
4558
4559 // Methods here need a different implementation if they are Option vs. OptionDefault
4560
4562 OptionDefaults *multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy value = MultiOptionPolicy::Throw) {
4563 multi_option_policy_ = value;
4564 return this;
4565 }
4566
4568 OptionDefaults *ignore_case(bool value = true) {
4569 ignore_case_ = value;
4570 return this;
4571 }
4572
4574 OptionDefaults *ignore_underscore(bool value = true) {
4575 ignore_underscore_ = value;
4576 return this;
4577 }
4578
4580 OptionDefaults *disable_flag_override(bool value = true) {
4581 disable_flag_override_ = value;
4582 return this;
4583 }
4584
4586 OptionDefaults *delimiter(char value = '\0') {
4587 delimiter_ = value;
4588 return this;
4589 }
4590};
4591
4592class Option : public OptionBase<Option> {
4593 friend App;
4594
4595protected:
4598
4600 std::vector<std::string> snames_{};
4601
4603 std::vector<std::string> lnames_{};
4604
4608 std::vector<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> default_flag_values_{};
4609
4611 std::vector<std::string> fnames_{};
4612
4614 std::string pname_{};
4615
4617 std::string envname_{};
4618
4622
4624 std::string description_{};
4625
4627 std::string default_str_{};
4628
4630 std::string option_text_{};
4631
4635 std::function<std::string()> type_name_{[]() { return std::string(); }};
4636
4638 std::function<std::string()> default_function_{};
4639
4643
4646 int type_size_max_{1};
4648 int type_size_min_{1};
4649
4651 int expected_min_{1};
4653 int expected_max_{1};
4654
4656 std::vector<Validator> validators_{};
4657
4659 std::set<Option *> needs_{};
4660
4662 std::set<Option *> excludes_{};
4663
4667
4669 App *parent_{nullptr};
4670
4672 callback_t callback_{};
4673
4677
4679 results_t results_{};
4681 results_t proc_results_{};
4683 enum class option_state : char {
4684 parsing = 0,
4685 validated = 2,
4686 reduced = 4,
4687 callback_run = 6,
4688 };
4690 option_state current_option_state_{option_state::parsing};
4692 bool allow_extra_args_{false};
4694 bool flag_like_{false};
4696 bool run_callback_for_default_{false};
4698 bool inject_separator_{false};
4701 bool trigger_on_result_{false};
4703 bool force_callback_{false};
4705
4707 Option(std::string option_name,
4708 std::string option_description,
4709 callback_t callback,
4710 App *parent)
4711 : description_(std::move(option_description)),
4712 parent_(parent),
4713 callback_(std::move(callback)) {
4714 std::tie(snames_, lnames_, pname_) = detail::get_names(detail::split_names(option_name));
4715 }
4716
4717public:
4720
4721 Option(const Option &) = delete;
4722 Option &operator=(const Option &) = delete;
4723
4725 CLI11_NODISCARD std::size_t count() const { return results_.size(); }
4726
4728 CLI11_NODISCARD bool empty() const { return results_.empty(); }
4729
4732 explicit operator bool() const { return !empty() || force_callback_; }
4733
4735 void clear() {
4736 results_.clear();
4737 current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
4738 }
4739
4743
4745 Option *expected(int value);
4746
4748 Option *expected(int value_min, int value_max);
4749
4752 Option *allow_extra_args(bool value = true) {
4753 allow_extra_args_ = value;
4754 return this;
4755 }
4757 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_allow_extra_args() const { return allow_extra_args_; }
4760 Option *trigger_on_parse(bool value = true) {
4761 trigger_on_result_ = value;
4762 return this;
4763 }
4765 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_trigger_on_parse() const { return trigger_on_result_; }
4766
4768 Option *force_callback(bool value = true) {
4769 force_callback_ = value;
4770 return this;
4771 }
4773 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_force_callback() const { return force_callback_; }
4774
4778 Option *run_callback_for_default(bool value = true) {
4779 run_callback_for_default_ = value;
4780 return this;
4781 }
4783 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_run_callback_for_default() const { return run_callback_for_default_; }
4784
4786 Option *check(Validator validator, const std::string &validator_name = "");
4787
4790 Option *check(std::function<std::string(const std::string &)> Validator,
4791 std::string Validator_description = "",
4792 std::string Validator_name = "");
4793
4795 Option *transform(Validator Validator, const std::string &Validator_name = "");
4796
4798 Option *transform(const std::function<std::string(std::string)> &func,
4799 std::string transform_description = "",
4800 std::string transform_name = "");
4801
4804 Option *each(const std::function<void(std::string)> &func);
4805
4807 Validator *get_validator(const std::string &Validator_name = "");
4808
4810 Validator *get_validator(int index);
4811
4813 Option *needs(Option *opt) {
4814 if (opt != this) {
4815 needs_.insert(opt);
4816 }
4817 return this;
4818 }
4819
4821 template <typename T = App>
4822 Option *needs(std::string opt_name) {
4823 auto opt = static_cast<T *>(parent_)->get_option_no_throw(opt_name);
4824 if (opt == nullptr) {
4825 throw IncorrectConstruction::MissingOption(opt_name);
4826 }
4827 return needs(opt);
4828 }
4829
4831 template <typename A, typename B, typename... ARG>
4832 Option *needs(A opt, B opt1, ARG... args) {
4833 needs(opt);
4834 return needs(opt1, args...); // NOLINT(readability-suspicious-call-argument)
4835 }
4836
4838 bool remove_needs(Option *opt);
4839
4841 Option *excludes(Option *opt);
4842
4844 template <typename T = App>
4845 Option *excludes(std::string opt_name) {
4846 auto opt = static_cast<T *>(parent_)->get_option_no_throw(opt_name);
4847 if (opt == nullptr) {
4848 throw IncorrectConstruction::MissingOption(opt_name);
4849 }
4850 return excludes(opt);
4851 }
4852
4854 template <typename A, typename B, typename... ARG>
4855 Option *excludes(A opt, B opt1, ARG... args) {
4856 excludes(opt);
4857 return excludes(opt1, args...);
4858 }
4859
4861 bool remove_excludes(Option *opt);
4862
4864 Option *envname(std::string name) {
4865 envname_ = std::move(name);
4866 return this;
4867 }
4868
4873 template <typename T = App>
4874 Option *ignore_case(bool value = true);
4875
4880 template <typename T = App>
4881 Option *ignore_underscore(bool value = true);
4882
4884 Option *multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy value = MultiOptionPolicy::Throw);
4885
4887 Option *disable_flag_override(bool value = true) {
4888 disable_flag_override_ = value;
4889 return this;
4890 }
4894
4896 CLI11_NODISCARD int get_type_size() const { return type_size_min_; }
4897
4899 CLI11_NODISCARD int get_type_size_min() const { return type_size_min_; }
4901 CLI11_NODISCARD int get_type_size_max() const { return type_size_max_; }
4902
4904 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_inject_separator() const { return inject_separator_; }
4905
4907 CLI11_NODISCARD std::string get_envname() const { return envname_; }
4908
4910 CLI11_NODISCARD std::set<Option *> get_needs() const { return needs_; }
4911
4913 CLI11_NODISCARD std::set<Option *> get_excludes() const { return excludes_; }
4914
4916 CLI11_NODISCARD std::string get_default_str() const { return default_str_; }
4917
4919 CLI11_NODISCARD callback_t get_callback() const { return callback_; }
4920
4922 CLI11_NODISCARD const std::vector<std::string> &get_lnames() const { return lnames_; }
4923
4925 CLI11_NODISCARD const std::vector<std::string> &get_snames() const { return snames_; }
4926
4928 CLI11_NODISCARD const std::vector<std::string> &get_fnames() const { return fnames_; }
4930 CLI11_NODISCARD const std::string &get_single_name() const {
4931 if (!lnames_.empty()) {
4932 return lnames_[0];
4933 }
4934 if (!pname_.empty()) {
4935 return pname_;
4936 }
4937 if (!snames_.empty()) {
4938 return snames_[0];
4939 }
4940 return envname_;
4941 }
4943 CLI11_NODISCARD int get_expected() const { return expected_min_; }
4944
4946 CLI11_NODISCARD int get_expected_min() const { return expected_min_; }
4948 CLI11_NODISCARD int get_expected_max() const { return expected_max_; }
4949
4951 CLI11_NODISCARD int get_items_expected_min() const { return type_size_min_ * expected_min_; }
4952
4954 CLI11_NODISCARD int get_items_expected_max() const {
4955 int t = type_size_max_;
4956 return detail::checked_multiply(t, expected_max_) ? t : detail::expected_max_vector_size;
4957 }
4959 CLI11_NODISCARD int get_items_expected() const { return get_items_expected_min(); }
4960
4962 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_positional() const { return pname_.length() > 0; }
4963
4965 CLI11_NODISCARD bool nonpositional() const { return (snames_.size() + lnames_.size()) > 0; }
4966
4968 CLI11_NODISCARD bool has_description() const { return description_.length() > 0; }
4969
4971 CLI11_NODISCARD const std::string &get_description() const { return description_; }
4972
4974 Option *description(std::string option_description) {
4975 description_ = std::move(option_description);
4976 return this;
4977 }
4978
4979 Option *option_text(std::string text) {
4980 option_text_ = std::move(text);
4981 return this;
4982 }
4983
4984 CLI11_NODISCARD const std::string &get_option_text() const { return option_text_; }
4985
4989
4994 CLI11_NODISCARD std::string get_name(bool positional = false,
4995 bool all_options = false
4996 ) const;
4997
5001
5003 void run_callback();
5004
5006 CLI11_NODISCARD const std::string &matching_name(const Option &other) const;
5007
5009 bool operator==(const Option &other) const { return !matching_name(other).empty(); }
5010
5012 CLI11_NODISCARD bool check_name(const std::string &name) const;
5013
5015 CLI11_NODISCARD bool check_sname(std::string name) const {
5016 return (detail::find_member(std::move(name), snames_, ignore_case_) >= 0);
5017 }
5018
5020 CLI11_NODISCARD bool check_lname(std::string name) const {
5021 return (detail::find_member(std::move(name), lnames_, ignore_case_, ignore_underscore_) >=
5022 0);
5023 }
5024
5026 CLI11_NODISCARD bool check_fname(std::string name) const {
5027 if (fnames_.empty()) {
5028 return false;
5029 }
5030 return (detail::find_member(std::move(name), fnames_, ignore_case_, ignore_underscore_) >=
5031 0);
5032 }
5033
5036 CLI11_NODISCARD std::string get_flag_value(const std::string &name,
5037 std::string input_value) const;
5038
5040 Option *add_result(std::string s);
5041
5043 Option *add_result(std::string s, int &results_added);
5044
5046 Option *add_result(std::vector<std::string> s);
5047
5049 CLI11_NODISCARD const results_t &results() const { return results_; }
5050
5052 CLI11_NODISCARD results_t reduced_results() const;
5053
5055 template <typename T>
5056 void results(T &output) const {
5057 bool retval = false;
5058 if (current_option_state_ >= option_state::reduced ||
5059 (results_.size() == 1 && validators_.empty())) {
5060 const results_t &res = (proc_results_.empty()) ? results_ : proc_results_;
5061 retval = detail::lexical_conversion<T, T>(res, output);
5062 } else {
5063 results_t res;
5064 if (results_.empty()) {
5065 if (!default_str_.empty()) {
5066 // _add_results takes an rvalue only
5067 _add_result(std::string(default_str_), res);
5068 _validate_results(res);
5069 results_t extra;
5070 _reduce_results(extra, res);
5071 if (!extra.empty()) {
5072 res = std::move(extra);
5073 }
5074 } else {
5075 res.emplace_back();
5076 }
5077 } else {
5078 res = reduced_results();
5079 }
5080 retval = detail::lexical_conversion<T, T>(res, output);
5081 }
5082 if (!retval) {
5083 throw ConversionError(get_name(), results_);
5084 }
5085 }
5086
5088 template <typename T>
5089 CLI11_NODISCARD T as() const {
5090 T output;
5091 results(output);
5092 return output;
5093 }
5094
5096 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_callback_run() const {
5097 return (current_option_state_ == option_state::callback_run);
5098 }
5099
5103
5105 Option *type_name_fn(std::function<std::string()> typefun) {
5106 type_name_ = std::move(typefun);
5107 return this;
5108 }
5109
5111 Option *type_name(std::string typeval) {
5112 type_name_fn([typeval]() { return typeval; });
5113 return this;
5114 }
5115
5117 Option *type_size(int option_type_size);
5118
5120 Option *type_size(int option_type_size_min, int option_type_size_max);
5121
5123 void inject_separator(bool value = true) { inject_separator_ = value; }
5124
5126 Option *default_function(const std::function<std::string()> &func) {
5127 default_function_ = func;
5128 return this;
5129 }
5130
5132 Option *capture_default_str() {
5133 if (default_function_) {
5134 default_str_ = default_function_();
5135 }
5136 return this;
5137 }
5138
5140 Option *default_str(std::string val) {
5141 default_str_ = std::move(val);
5142 return this;
5143 }
5144
5147 template <typename X>
5148 Option *default_val(const X &val) {
5149 std::string val_str = detail::to_string(val);
5150 auto old_option_state = current_option_state_;
5151 results_t old_results{std::move(results_)};
5152 results_.clear();
5153 try {
5154 add_result(val_str);
5155 // if trigger_on_result_ is set the callback already ran
5156 if (run_callback_for_default_ && !trigger_on_result_) {
5157 run_callback(); // run callback sets the state, we need to reset it again
5158 current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
5159 } else {
5160 _validate_results(results_);
5161 current_option_state_ = old_option_state;
5162 }
5163 } catch (const CLI::Error &) {
5164 // this should be done
5165 results_ = std::move(old_results);
5166 current_option_state_ = old_option_state;
5167 throw;
5168 }
5169 results_ = std::move(old_results);
5170 default_str_ = std::move(val_str);
5171 return this;
5172 }
5173
5175 CLI11_NODISCARD std::string get_type_name() const;
5176
5177private:
5179 void _validate_results(results_t &res) const;
5180
5184 void _reduce_results(results_t &out, const results_t &original) const;
5185
5186 // Run a result through the Validators
5187 std::string _validate(std::string &result, int index) const;
5188
5190 int _add_result(std::string &&result, std::vector<std::string> &res) const;
5191};
5192
5193template <typename CRTP>
5194template <typename T>
5195void OptionBase<CRTP>::copy_to(T *other) const {
5196 other->group(group_);
5197 other->required(required_);
5198 other->ignore_case(ignore_case_);
5199 other->ignore_underscore(ignore_underscore_);
5200 other->configurable(configurable_);
5201 other->disable_flag_override(disable_flag_override_);
5202 other->delimiter(delimiter_);
5203 other->always_capture_default(always_capture_default_);
5204 other->multi_option_policy(multi_option_policy_);
5205}
5206
5207CLI11_INLINE Option *Option::expected(int value) {
5208 if (value < 0) {
5209 expected_min_ = -value;
5210 if (expected_max_ < expected_min_) {
5211 expected_max_ = expected_min_;
5212 }
5213 allow_extra_args_ = true;
5214 flag_like_ = false;
5215 } else if (value == detail::expected_max_vector_size) {
5216 expected_min_ = 1;
5217 expected_max_ = detail::expected_max_vector_size;
5218 allow_extra_args_ = true;
5219 flag_like_ = false;
5220 } else {
5221 expected_min_ = value;
5222 expected_max_ = value;
5223 flag_like_ = (expected_min_ == 0);
5224 }
5225 return this;
5226}
5227
5228CLI11_INLINE Option *Option::expected(int value_min, int value_max) {
5229 if (value_min < 0) {
5230 value_min = -value_min;
5231 }
5232
5233 if (value_max < 0) {
5234 value_max = detail::expected_max_vector_size;
5235 }
5236 if (value_max < value_min) {
5237 expected_min_ = value_max;
5238 expected_max_ = value_min;
5239 } else {
5240 expected_max_ = value_max;
5241 expected_min_ = value_min;
5242 }
5243
5244 return this;
5245}
5246
5247CLI11_INLINE Option *Option::check(Validator validator, const std::string &validator_name) {
5248 validator.non_modifying();
5249 validators_.push_back(std::move(validator));
5250 if (!validator_name.empty()) validators_.back().name(validator_name);
5251 return this;
5252}
5253
5254CLI11_INLINE Option *Option::check(std::function<std::string(const std::string &)> Validator,
5255 std::string Validator_description,
5256 std::string Validator_name) {
5257 validators_.emplace_back(Validator, std::move(Validator_description),
5258 std::move(Validator_name));
5259 validators_.back().non_modifying();
5260 return this;
5261}
5262
5263CLI11_INLINE Option *Option::transform(Validator Validator, const std::string &Validator_name) {
5264 validators_.insert(validators_.begin(), std::move(Validator));
5265 if (!Validator_name.empty()) validators_.front().name(Validator_name);
5266 return this;
5267}
5268
5269CLI11_INLINE Option *Option::transform(const std::function<std::string(std::string)> &func,
5270 std::string transform_description,
5271 std::string transform_name) {
5272 validators_.insert(validators_.begin(),
5273 Validator(
5274 [func](std::string &val) {
5275 val = func(val);
5276 return std::string{};
5277 },
5278 std::move(transform_description), std::move(transform_name)));
5279
5280 return this;
5281}
5282
5283CLI11_INLINE Option *Option::each(const std::function<void(std::string)> &func) {
5284 validators_.emplace_back(
5285 [func](std::string &inout) {
5286 func(inout);
5287 return std::string{};
5288 },
5289 std::string{});
5290 return this;
5291}
5292
5293CLI11_INLINE Validator *Option::get_validator(const std::string &Validator_name) {
5294 for (auto &Validator : validators_) {
5295 if (Validator_name == Validator.get_name()) {
5296 return &Validator;
5297 }
5298 }
5299 if ((Validator_name.empty()) && (!validators_.empty())) {
5300 return &(validators_.front());
5301 }
5302 throw OptionNotFound(std::string{"Validator "} + Validator_name + " Not Found");
5303}
5304
5305CLI11_INLINE Validator *Option::get_validator(int index) {
5306 // This is an signed int so that it is not equivalent to a pointer.
5307 if (index >= 0 && index < static_cast<int>(validators_.size())) {
5308 return &(validators_[static_cast<decltype(validators_)::size_type>(index)]);
5309 }
5310 throw OptionNotFound("Validator index is not valid");
5311}
5312
5313CLI11_INLINE bool Option::remove_needs(Option *opt) {
5314 auto iterator = std::find(std::begin(needs_), std::end(needs_), opt);
5315
5316 if (iterator == std::end(needs_)) {
5317 return false;
5318 }
5319 needs_.erase(iterator);
5320 return true;
5321}
5322
5323CLI11_INLINE Option *Option::excludes(Option *opt) {
5324 if (opt == this) {
5325 throw(IncorrectConstruction("and option cannot exclude itself"));
5326 }
5327 excludes_.insert(opt);
5328
5329 // Help text should be symmetric - excluding a should exclude b
5330 opt->excludes_.insert(this);
5331
5332 // Ignoring the insert return value, excluding twice is now allowed.
5333 // (Mostly to allow both directions to be excluded by user, even though the library does it for
5334 // you.)
5335
5336 return this;
5337}
5338
5339CLI11_INLINE bool Option::remove_excludes(Option *opt) {
5340 auto iterator = std::find(std::begin(excludes_), std::end(excludes_), opt);
5341
5342 if (iterator == std::end(excludes_)) {
5343 return false;
5344 }
5345 excludes_.erase(iterator);
5346 return true;
5347}
5348
5349template <typename T>
5350Option *Option::ignore_case(bool value) {
5351 if (!ignore_case_ && value) {
5352 ignore_case_ = value;
5353 auto *parent = static_cast<T *>(parent_);
5354 for (const Option_p &opt : parent->options_) {
5355 if (opt.get() == this) {
5356 continue;
5357 }
5358 const auto &omatch = opt->matching_name(*this);
5359 if (!omatch.empty()) {
5360 ignore_case_ = false;
5361 throw OptionAlreadyAdded("adding ignore case caused a name conflict with " +
5362 omatch);
5363 }
5364 }
5365 } else {
5366 ignore_case_ = value;
5367 }
5368 return this;
5369}
5370
5371template <typename T>
5372Option *Option::ignore_underscore(bool value) {
5373 if (!ignore_underscore_ && value) {
5374 ignore_underscore_ = value;
5375 auto *parent = static_cast<T *>(parent_);
5376 for (const Option_p &opt : parent->options_) {
5377 if (opt.get() == this) {
5378 continue;
5379 }
5380 const auto &omatch = opt->matching_name(*this);
5381 if (!omatch.empty()) {
5382 ignore_underscore_ = false;
5383 throw OptionAlreadyAdded("adding ignore underscore caused a name conflict with " +
5384 omatch);
5385 }
5386 }
5387 } else {
5388 ignore_underscore_ = value;
5389 }
5390 return this;
5391}
5392
5393CLI11_INLINE Option *Option::multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy value) {
5394 if (value != multi_option_policy_) {
5395 if (multi_option_policy_ == MultiOptionPolicy::Throw &&
5396 expected_max_ == detail::expected_max_vector_size &&
5397 expected_min_ > 1) { // this bizarre condition is to maintain backwards compatibility
5398 // with the previous behavior of expected_ with vectors
5399 expected_max_ = expected_min_;
5400 }
5401 multi_option_policy_ = value;
5402 current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
5403 }
5404 return this;
5405}
5406
5407CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE std::string Option::get_name(bool positional, bool all_options) const {
5408 if (get_group().empty()) return {}; // Hidden
5409
5410 if (all_options) {
5411 std::vector<std::string> name_list;
5412
5414 if ((positional && (!pname_.empty())) || (snames_.empty() && lnames_.empty())) {
5415 name_list.push_back(pname_);
5416 }
5417 if ((get_items_expected() == 0) && (!fnames_.empty())) {
5418 for (const std::string &sname : snames_) {
5419 name_list.push_back("-" + sname);
5420 if (check_fname(sname)) {
5421 name_list.back() += "{" + get_flag_value(sname, "") + "}";
5422 }
5423 }
5424
5425 for (const std::string &lname : lnames_) {
5426 name_list.push_back("--" + lname);
5427 if (check_fname(lname)) {
5428 name_list.back() += "{" + get_flag_value(lname, "") + "}";
5429 }
5430 }
5431 } else {
5432 for (const std::string &sname : snames_) name_list.push_back("-" + sname);
5433
5434 for (const std::string &lname : lnames_) name_list.push_back("--" + lname);
5435 }
5436
5437 return detail::join(name_list);
5438 }
5439
5440 // This returns the positional name no matter what
5441 if (positional) return pname_;
5442
5443 // Prefer long name
5444 if (!lnames_.empty()) return std::string(2, '-') + lnames_[0];
5445
5446 // Or short name if no long name
5447 if (!snames_.empty()) return std::string(1, '-') + snames_[0];
5448
5449 // If positional is the only name, it's okay to use that
5450 return pname_;
5451}
5452
5453CLI11_INLINE void Option::run_callback() {
5454 if (force_callback_ && results_.empty()) {
5455 add_result(default_str_);
5456 }
5457 if (current_option_state_ == option_state::parsing) {
5458 _validate_results(results_);
5459 current_option_state_ = option_state::validated;
5460 }
5461
5462 if (current_option_state_ < option_state::reduced) {
5463 _reduce_results(proc_results_, results_);
5464 current_option_state_ = option_state::reduced;
5465 }
5466 if (current_option_state_ >= option_state::reduced) {
5467 current_option_state_ = option_state::callback_run;
5468 if (!(callback_)) {
5469 return;
5470 }
5471 const results_t &send_results = proc_results_.empty() ? results_ : proc_results_;
5472 bool local_result = callback_(send_results);
5473
5474 if (!local_result) throw ConversionError(get_name(), results_);
5475 }
5476}
5477
5478CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE const std::string &Option::matching_name(const Option &other) const {
5479 static const std::string estring;
5480 for (const std::string &sname : snames_)
5481 if (other.check_sname(sname)) return sname;
5482 for (const std::string &lname : lnames_)
5483 if (other.check_lname(lname)) return lname;
5484
5485 if (ignore_case_ || ignore_underscore_) { // We need to do the inverse, in case we are
5486 // ignore_case or ignore underscore
5487 for (const std::string &sname : other.snames_)
5488 if (check_sname(sname)) return sname;
5489 for (const std::string &lname : other.lnames_)
5490 if (check_lname(lname)) return lname;
5491 }
5492 return estring;
5493}
5494
5495CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE bool Option::check_name(const std::string &name) const {
5496 if (name.length() > 2 && name[0] == '-' && name[1] == '-') return check_lname(name.substr(2));
5497 if (name.length() > 1 && name.front() == '-') return check_sname(name.substr(1));
5498 if (!pname_.empty()) {
5499 std::string local_pname = pname_;
5500 std::string local_name = name;
5501 if (ignore_underscore_) {
5502 local_pname = detail::remove_underscore(local_pname);
5503 local_name = detail::remove_underscore(local_name);
5504 }
5505 if (ignore_case_) {
5506 local_pname = detail::to_lower(local_pname);
5507 local_name = detail::to_lower(local_name);
5508 }
5509 if (local_name == local_pname) {
5510 return true;
5511 }
5512 }
5513
5514 if (!envname_.empty()) {
5515 // this needs to be the original since envname_ shouldn't match on case insensitivity
5516 return (name == envname_);
5517 }
5518 return false;
5519}
5520
5521CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE std::string Option::get_flag_value(const std::string &name,
5522 std::string input_value) const {
5523 static const std::string trueString{"true"};
5524 static const std::string falseString{"false"};
5525 static const std::string emptyString{"{}"};
5526 // check for disable flag override_
5527 if (disable_flag_override_) {
5528 if (!((input_value.empty()) || (input_value == emptyString))) {
5529 auto default_ind = detail::find_member(name, fnames_, ignore_case_, ignore_underscore_);
5530 if (default_ind >= 0) {
5531 // We can static cast this to std::size_t because it is more than 0 in this block
5532 if (default_flag_values_[static_cast<std::size_t>(default_ind)].second !=
5533 input_value) {
5534 throw(ArgumentMismatch::FlagOverride(name));
5535 }
5536 } else {
5537 if (input_value != trueString) {
5538 throw(ArgumentMismatch::FlagOverride(name));
5539 }
5540 }
5541 }
5542 }
5543 auto ind = detail::find_member(name, fnames_, ignore_case_, ignore_underscore_);
5544 if ((input_value.empty()) || (input_value == emptyString)) {
5545 if (flag_like_) {
5546 return (ind < 0) ? trueString
5547 : default_flag_values_[static_cast<std::size_t>(ind)].second;
5548 }
5549 return (ind < 0) ? default_str_
5550 : default_flag_values_[static_cast<std::size_t>(ind)].second;
5551 }
5552 if (ind < 0) {
5553 return input_value;
5554 }
5555 if (default_flag_values_[static_cast<std::size_t>(ind)].second == falseString) {
5556 try {
5557 auto val = detail::to_flag_value(input_value);
5558 return (val == 1) ? falseString : (val == (-1) ? trueString : std::to_string(-val));
5559 } catch (const std::invalid_argument &) {
5560 return input_value;
5561 }
5562 } else {
5563 return input_value;
5564 }
5565}
5566
5567CLI11_INLINE Option *Option::add_result(std::string s) {
5568 _add_result(std::move(s), results_);
5569 current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
5570 return this;
5571}
5572
5573CLI11_INLINE Option *Option::add_result(std::string s, int &results_added) {
5574 results_added = _add_result(std::move(s), results_);
5575 current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
5576 return this;
5577}
5578
5579CLI11_INLINE Option *Option::add_result(std::vector<std::string> s) {
5580 current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
5581 for (auto &str : s) {
5582 _add_result(std::move(str), results_);
5583 }
5584 return this;
5585}
5586
5587CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE results_t Option::reduced_results() const {
5588 results_t res = proc_results_.empty() ? results_ : proc_results_;
5589 if (current_option_state_ < option_state::reduced) {
5590 if (current_option_state_ == option_state::parsing) {
5591 res = results_;
5592 _validate_results(res);
5593 }
5594 if (!res.empty()) {
5595 results_t extra;
5596 _reduce_results(extra, res);
5597 if (!extra.empty()) {
5598 res = std::move(extra);
5599 }
5600 }
5601 }
5602 return res;
5603}
5604
5605CLI11_INLINE Option *Option::type_size(int option_type_size) {
5606 if (option_type_size < 0) {
5607 // this section is included for backwards compatibility
5608 type_size_max_ = -option_type_size;
5609 type_size_min_ = -option_type_size;
5610 expected_max_ = detail::expected_max_vector_size;
5611 } else {
5612 type_size_max_ = option_type_size;
5613 if (type_size_max_ < detail::expected_max_vector_size) {
5614 type_size_min_ = option_type_size;
5615 } else {
5616 inject_separator_ = true;
5617 }
5618 if (type_size_max_ == 0) required_ = false;
5619 }
5620 return this;
5621}
5622
5623CLI11_INLINE Option *Option::type_size(int option_type_size_min, int option_type_size_max) {
5624 if (option_type_size_min < 0 || option_type_size_max < 0) {
5625 // this section is included for backwards compatibility
5626 expected_max_ = detail::expected_max_vector_size;
5627 option_type_size_min = (std::abs)(option_type_size_min);
5628 option_type_size_max = (std::abs)(option_type_size_max);
5629 }
5630
5631 if (option_type_size_min > option_type_size_max) {
5632 type_size_max_ = option_type_size_min;
5633 type_size_min_ = option_type_size_max;
5634 } else {
5635 type_size_min_ = option_type_size_min;
5636 type_size_max_ = option_type_size_max;
5637 }
5638 if (type_size_max_ == 0) {
5639 required_ = false;
5640 }
5641 if (type_size_max_ >= detail::expected_max_vector_size) {
5642 inject_separator_ = true;
5643 }
5644 return this;
5645}
5646
5647CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE std::string Option::get_type_name() const {
5648 std::string full_type_name = type_name_();
5649 if (!validators_.empty()) {
5650 for (const auto &Validator : validators_) {
5651 std::string vtype = Validator.get_description();
5652 if (!vtype.empty()) {
5653 full_type_name += ":" + vtype;
5654 }
5655 }
5656 }
5657 return full_type_name;
5658}
5659
5660CLI11_INLINE void Option::_validate_results(results_t &res) const {
5661 // Run the Validators (can change the string)
5662 if (!validators_.empty()) {
5663 if (type_size_max_ > 1) { // in this context index refers to the index in the type
5664 int index = 0;
5665 if (get_items_expected_max() < static_cast<int>(res.size()) &&
5666 multi_option_policy_ == CLI::MultiOptionPolicy::TakeLast) {
5667 // create a negative index for the earliest ones
5668 index = get_items_expected_max() - static_cast<int>(res.size());
5669 }
5670
5671 for (std::string &result : res) {
5672 if (detail::is_separator(result) && type_size_max_ != type_size_min_ &&
5673 index >= 0) {
5674 index = 0; // reset index for variable size chunks
5675 continue;
5676 }
5677 auto err_msg = _validate(result, (index >= 0) ? (index % type_size_max_) : index);
5678 if (!err_msg.empty()) throw ValidationError(get_name(), err_msg);
5679 ++index;
5680 }
5681 } else {
5682 int index = 0;
5683 if (expected_max_ < static_cast<int>(res.size()) &&
5684 multi_option_policy_ == CLI::MultiOptionPolicy::TakeLast) {
5685 // create a negative index for the earliest ones
5686 index = expected_max_ - static_cast<int>(res.size());
5687 }
5688 for (std::string &result : res) {
5689 auto err_msg = _validate(result, index);
5690 ++index;
5691 if (!err_msg.empty()) throw ValidationError(get_name(), err_msg);
5692 }
5693 }
5694 }
5695}
5696
5697CLI11_INLINE void Option::_reduce_results(results_t &out, const results_t &original) const {
5698 // max num items expected or length of vector, always at least 1
5699 // Only valid for a trimming policy
5700
5701 out.clear();
5702 // Operation depends on the policy setting
5703 switch (multi_option_policy_) {
5704 case MultiOptionPolicy::TakeAll:
5705 break;
5706 case MultiOptionPolicy::TakeLast: {
5707 // Allow multi-option sizes (including 0)
5708 std::size_t trim_size = std::min<std::size_t>(
5709 static_cast<std::size_t>(std::max<int>(get_items_expected_max(), 1)),
5710 original.size());
5711 if (original.size() != trim_size) {
5712 out.assign(original.end() - static_cast<results_t::difference_type>(trim_size),
5713 original.end());
5714 }
5715 } break;
5716 case MultiOptionPolicy::TakeFirst: {
5717 std::size_t trim_size = std::min<std::size_t>(
5718 static_cast<std::size_t>(std::max<int>(get_items_expected_max(), 1)),
5719 original.size());
5720 if (original.size() != trim_size) {
5721 out.assign(original.begin(),
5722 original.begin() + static_cast<results_t::difference_type>(trim_size));
5723 }
5724 } break;
5725 case MultiOptionPolicy::Join:
5726 if (results_.size() > 1) {
5727 out.push_back(detail::join(
5728 original, std::string(1, (delimiter_ == '\0') ? '\n' : delimiter_)));
5729 }
5730 break;
5731 case MultiOptionPolicy::Sum:
5732 out.push_back(detail::sum_string_vector(original));
5733 break;
5734 case MultiOptionPolicy::Throw:
5735 default: {
5736 auto num_min = static_cast<std::size_t>(get_items_expected_min());
5737 auto num_max = static_cast<std::size_t>(get_items_expected_max());
5738 if (num_min == 0) {
5739 num_min = 1;
5740 }
5741 if (num_max == 0) {
5742 num_max = 1;
5743 }
5744 if (original.size() < num_min) {
5745 throw ArgumentMismatch::AtLeast(get_name(), static_cast<int>(num_min),
5746 original.size());
5747 }
5748 if (original.size() > num_max) {
5749 throw ArgumentMismatch::AtMost(get_name(), static_cast<int>(num_max),
5750 original.size());
5751 }
5752 break;
5753 }
5754 }
5755 // this check is to allow an empty vector in certain circumstances but not if expected is not
5756 // zero.
5757 // {} is the indicator for an empty container
5758 if (out.empty()) {
5759 if (original.size() == 1 && original[0] == "{}" && get_items_expected_min() > 0) {
5760 out.push_back("{}");
5761 out.push_back("%%");
5762 }
5763 } else if (out.size() == 1 && out[0] == "{}" && get_items_expected_min() > 0) {
5764 out.push_back("%%");
5765 }
5766}
5767
5768CLI11_INLINE std::string Option::_validate(std::string &result, int index) const {
5769 std::string err_msg;
5770 if (result.empty() && expected_min_ == 0) {
5771 // an empty with nothing expected is allowed
5772 return err_msg;
5773 }
5774 for (const auto &vali : validators_) {
5775 auto v = vali.get_application_index();
5776 if (v == -1 || v == index) {
5777 try {
5778 err_msg = vali(result);
5779 } catch (const ValidationError &err) {
5780 err_msg = err.what();
5781 }
5782 if (!err_msg.empty()) break;
5783 }
5784 }
5785
5786 return err_msg;
5787}
5788
5789CLI11_INLINE int Option::_add_result(std::string &&result, std::vector<std::string> &res) const {
5790 int result_count = 0;
5791 if (allow_extra_args_ && !result.empty() && result.front() == '[' &&
5792 result.back() ==
5793 ']') { // this is now a vector string likely from the default or user entry
5794 result.pop_back();
5795
5796 for (auto &var : CLI::detail::split(result.substr(1), ',')) {
5797 if (!var.empty()) {
5798 result_count += _add_result(std::move(var), res);
5799 }
5800 }
5801 return result_count;
5802 }
5803 if (delimiter_ == '\0') {
5804 res.push_back(std::move(result));
5805 ++result_count;
5806 } else {
5807 if ((result.find_first_of(delimiter_) != std::string::npos)) {
5808 for (const auto &var : CLI::detail::split(result, delimiter_)) {
5809 if (!var.empty()) {
5810 res.push_back(var);
5811 ++result_count;
5812 }
5813 }
5814 } else {
5815 res.push_back(std::move(result));
5816 ++result_count;
5817 }
5818 }
5819 return result_count;
5820}
5821
5822#ifndef CLI11_PARSE
5823#define CLI11_PARSE(app, argc, argv) \
5824 try { \
5825 (app).parse((argc), (argv)); \
5826 } catch (const CLI::ParseError &e) { \
5827 return (app).exit(e); \
5828 }
5829#endif
5830
5831namespace detail {
5832enum class Classifier {
5833 NONE,
5834 POSITIONAL_MARK,
5835 SHORT,
5836 LONG,
5837 WINDOWS_STYLE,
5838 SUBCOMMAND,
5839 SUBCOMMAND_TERMINATOR
5840};
5841struct AppFriend;
5842} // namespace detail
5843
5844namespace FailureMessage {
5845std::string simple(const App *app, const Error &e);
5846std::string help(const App *app, const Error &e);
5847} // namespace FailureMessage
5848
5850
5851enum class config_extras_mode : char { error = 0, ignore, ignore_all, capture };
5852
5853class App;
5854
5855using App_p = std::shared_ptr<App>;
5856
5857namespace detail {
5859
5860template <
5861 typename T,
5862 enable_if_t<!std::is_integral<T>::value || (sizeof(T) <= 1U), detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
5863Option *default_flag_modifiers(Option *opt) {
5864 return opt->always_capture_default();
5865}
5866
5868template <
5869 typename T,
5870 enable_if_t<std::is_integral<T>::value && (sizeof(T) > 1U), detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
5871Option *default_flag_modifiers(Option *opt) {
5872 return opt->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::Sum)->default_str("0")->force_callback();
5873}
5874
5875} // namespace detail
5876
5877class Option_group;
5879
5883class App {
5884 friend Option;
5885 friend detail::AppFriend;
5886
5887protected:
5888 // This library follows the Google style guide for member names ending in underscores
5889
5892
5894 std::string name_{};
5895
5897 std::string description_{};
5898
5900 bool allow_extras_{false};
5901
5904 config_extras_mode allow_config_extras_{config_extras_mode::ignore};
5905
5907 bool prefix_command_{false};
5908
5910 bool has_automatic_name_{false};
5911
5913 bool required_{false};
5914
5916 bool disabled_{false};
5917
5919 bool pre_parse_called_{false};
5920
5923 bool immediate_callback_{false};
5924
5926 std::function<void(std::size_t)> pre_parse_callback_{};
5927
5929 std::function<void()> parse_complete_callback_{};
5930
5932 std::function<void()> final_callback_{};
5933
5937
5939 OptionDefaults option_defaults_{};
5940
5942 std::vector<Option_p> options_{};
5943
5947
5949 std::string footer_{};
5950
5952 std::function<std::string()> footer_callback_{};
5953
5955 Option *help_ptr_{nullptr};
5956
5958 Option *help_all_ptr_{nullptr};
5959
5961 Option *version_ptr_{nullptr};
5962
5964 std::shared_ptr<FormatterBase> formatter_{new Formatter()};
5965
5967 std::function<std::string(const App *, const Error &e)> failure_message_{
5968 FailureMessage::simple};

5973
5974 using missing_t = std::vector<std::pair<detail::Classifier, std::string>>;
5975
5981 missing_t missing_{};
5982
5984 std::vector<Option *> parse_order_{};
5985

5998 std::set<App *> need_subcommands_{};

6009 std::vector<App_p> subcommands_{};

6012 bool ignore_case_{false};
6013
6015 bool ignore_underscore_{false};
6016
6019 bool fallthrough_{false};
6020
6023 bool allow_windows_style_options_{
6024#ifdef _WIN32
6025 true
6026#else
6027 false
6028#endif
6029 };
6031 bool positionals_at_end_{false};
6032
6033 enum class startup_mode : char { stable, enabled, disabled };
6036 startup_mode default_startup{startup_mode::stable};
6037
6039 bool configurable_{false};
6040
6042 bool validate_positionals_{false};
6043
6045 bool validate_optional_arguments_{false};
6046
6049 bool silent_{false};
