8876 }
8877 com->_parse(args);
8878 auto *parent_app = com->parent_;
8879 while (parent_app != this) {
8880 parent_app->_trigger_pre_parse(args.size());
8881 if (!com->silent_) {
8882 parent_app->parsed_subcommands_.push_back(com);
8883 }
8884 parent_app = parent_app->parent_;
8885 }
8886 return true;
8887 }
8888
8889 if (parent_ == nullptr) throw HorribleError("Subcommand " + args.back() + " missing");
8890 return false;
8891}
8892
8893CLI11_INLINE bool App::_parse_arg(std::vector<std::string> &args, detail::Classifier current_type) {
8894 std::string current = args.back();
8895
8896 std::string arg_name;
8897 std::string value;
8898 std::string rest;
8899
8900 switch (current_type) {
8901 case detail::Classifier::LONG:
8902 if (!detail::split_long(current, arg_name, value))
8903 throw HorribleError("Long parsed but missing (you should not see this):" +
8904 args.back());
8905 break;
8906 case detail::Classifier::SHORT:
8907 if (!detail::split_short(current, arg_name, rest))
8908 throw HorribleError("Short parsed but missing! You should not see this");
8909 break;
8910 case detail::Classifier::WINDOWS_STYLE:
8911 if (!detail::split_windows_style(current, arg_name, value))
8912 throw HorribleError("windows option parsed but missing! You should not see this");
8913 break;
8914 case detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND:
8915 case detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND_TERMINATOR:
8916 case detail::Classifier::POSITIONAL_MARK:
8917 case detail::Classifier::NONE:
8918 default:
8919 throw HorribleError("parsing got called with invalid option! You should not see this");
8920 }
8921
8922 auto op_ptr = std::find_if(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_),
8923 [arg_name, current_type](const Option_p &opt) {
8924 if (current_type == detail::Classifier::LONG)
8925 return opt->check_lname(arg_name);
8926 if (current_type == detail::Classifier::SHORT)
8927 return opt->check_sname(arg_name);
8928 // this will only get called for
8929 // detail::Classifier::WINDOWS_STYLE
8930 return opt->check_lname(arg_name) || opt->check_sname(arg_name);
8931 });
8932
8933 // Option not found
8934 if (op_ptr == std::end(options_)) {
8935 for (auto &subc : subcommands_) {
8936 if (subc->name_.empty() && !subc->disabled_) {
8937 if (subc->_parse_arg(args, current_type)) {
8938 if (!subc->pre_parse_called_) {
8939 subc->_trigger_pre_parse(args.size());
8940 }
8941 return true;
8942 }
8943 }
8944 }
8945
8946 // don't capture missing if this is a nameless subcommand and nameless subcommands can't
8947 // fallthrough
8948 if (parent_ != nullptr && name_.empty()) {
8949 return false;
8950 }
8951
8952 // If a subcommand, try the main command
8953 if (parent_ != nullptr && fallthrough_)
8954 return _get_fallthrough_parent()->_parse_arg(args, current_type);
8955
8956 // Otherwise, add to missing
8957 args.pop_back();
8958 _move_to_missing(current_type, current);
8959 return true;
8960 }
8961
8962 args.pop_back();
8963
8964 // Get a reference to the pointer to make syntax bearable
8965 Option_p &op = *op_ptr;
8967 if (op->get_inject_separator()) {
8968 if (!op->results().empty() && !op->results().back().empty()) {
8969 op->add_result(std::string{});
8970 }
8971 }
8972 if (op->get_trigger_on_parse() &&
8973 op->current_option_state_ == Option::option_state::callback_run) {
8974 op->clear();
8975 }
8976 int min_num = (std::min)(op->get_type_size_min(), op->get_items_expected_min());
8977 int max_num = op->get_items_expected_max();
8978 // check container like options to limit the argument size to a single type if the
8979 // allow_extra_flags argument is set. 16 is somewhat arbitrary (needs to be at least 4)
8980 if (max_num >= detail::expected_max_vector_size / 16 && !op->get_allow_extra_args()) {
8981 auto tmax = op->get_type_size_max();
8982 max_num = detail::checked_multiply(tmax, op->get_expected_min())
8983 ? tmax
8984 : detail::expected_max_vector_size;
8985 }
8986 // Make sure we always eat the minimum for unlimited vectors
8987 int collected = 0; // total number of arguments collected
8988 int result_count = 0; // local variable for number of results in a single arg string
8989 // deal with purely flag like things
8990 if (max_num == 0) {
8991 auto res = op->get_flag_value(arg_name, value);
8992 op->add_result(res);
8993 parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
8994 } else if (!value.empty()) { // --this=value
8995 op->add_result(value, result_count);
8996 parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
8997 collected += result_count;
8998 // -Trest
8999 } else if (!rest.empty()) {
9000 op->add_result(rest, result_count);
9001 parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
9002 rest = "";
9003 collected += result_count;
9004 }
9005
9006 // gather the minimum number of arguments
9007 while (min_num > collected && !args.empty()) {
9008 std::string current_ = args.back();
9009 args.pop_back();
9010 op->add_result(current_, result_count);
9011 parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
9012 collected += result_count;
9013 }
9014
9015 if (min_num > collected) { // if we have run out of arguments and the minimum was not met
9016 throw ArgumentMismatch::TypedAtLeast(op->get_name(), min_num, op->get_type_name());
9017 }
9018
9019 // now check for optional arguments
9020 if (max_num > collected || op->get_allow_extra_args()) { // we allow optional arguments
9021 auto remreqpos = _count_remaining_positionals(true);
9022 // we have met the minimum now optionally check up to the maximum
9023 while ((collected < max_num || op->get_allow_extra_args()) && !args.empty() &&
9024 _recognize(args.back(), false) == detail::Classifier::NONE) {
9025 // If any required positionals remain, don't keep eating
9026 if (remreqpos >= args.size()) {
9027 break;
9028 }
9029 if (validate_optional_arguments_) {
9030 std::string arg = args.back();
9031 arg = op->_validate(arg, 0);
9032 if (!arg.empty()) {
9033 break;
9034 }
9035 }
9036 op->add_result(args.back(), result_count);
9037 parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
9038 args.pop_back();
9039 collected += result_count;
9040 }
9041
9042 // Allow -- to end an unlimited list and "eat" it
9043 if (!args.empty() && _recognize(args.back()) == detail::Classifier::POSITIONAL_MARK)
9044 args.pop_back();
9045 // optional flag that didn't receive anything now get the default value
9046 if (min_num == 0 && max_num > 0 && collected == 0) {
9047 auto res = op->get_flag_value(arg_name, std::string{});
9048 op->add_result(res);
9049 parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
9050 }
9051 }
9052 // if we only partially completed a type then add an empty string if allowed for later
9053 // processing
9054 if (min_num > 0 && (collected % op->get_type_size_max()) != 0) {
9055 if (op->get_type_size_max() != op->get_type_size_min()) {
9056 op->add_result(std::string{});
9057 } else {
9058 throw ArgumentMismatch::PartialType(op->get_name(), op->get_type_size_min(),
9059 op->get_type_name());
9060 }
9061 }
9062 if (op->get_trigger_on_parse()) {
9063 op->run_callback();
9064 }
9065 if (!rest.empty()) {
9066 rest = "-" + rest;
9067 args.push_back(rest);
9068 }
9069 return true;
9070}
9071
9072CLI11_INLINE void App::_trigger_pre_parse(std::size_t remaining_args) {
9073 if (!pre_parse_called_) {
9074 pre_parse_called_ = true;
9075 if (pre_parse_callback_) {
9076 pre_parse_callback_(remaining_args);
9077 }
9078 } else if (immediate_callback_) {
9079 if (!name_.empty()) {
9080 auto pcnt = parsed_;
9081 auto extras = std::move(missing_);
9082 clear();
9083 parsed_ = pcnt;
9084 pre_parse_called_ = true;
9085 missing_ = std::move(extras);
9086 }
9087 }
9088}
9089
9090CLI11_INLINE App *App::_get_fallthrough_parent() {
9091 if (parent_ == nullptr) {
9092 throw(HorribleError("No Valid parent"));
9093 }
9094 auto *fallthrough_parent = parent_;
9095 while ((fallthrough_parent->parent_ != nullptr) && (fallthrough_parent->get_name().empty())) {
9096 fallthrough_parent = fallthrough_parent->parent_;
9097 }
9098 return fallthrough_parent;
9099}
9100
9101CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE const std::string &App::_compare_subcommand_names(
9102 const App &subcom, const App &base) const {
9103 static const std::string estring;
9104 if (subcom.disabled_) {
9105 return estring;
9106 }
9107 for (const auto &subc : base.subcommands_) {
9108 if (subc.get() != &subcom) {
9109 if (subc->disabled_) {
9110 continue;
9111 }
9112 if (!subcom.get_name().empty()) {
9113 if (subc->check_name(subcom.get_name())) {
9114 return subcom.get_name();
9115 }
9116 }
9117 if (!subc->get_name().empty()) {
9118 if (subcom.check_name(subc->get_name())) {
9119 return subc->get_name();
9120 }
9121 }
9122 for (const auto &les : subcom.aliases_) {
9123 if (subc->check_name(les)) {
9124 return les;
9125 }
9126 }
9127 // this loop is needed in case of ignore_underscore or ignore_case on one but not the
9128 // other
9129 for (const auto &les : subc->aliases_) {
9130 if (subcom.check_name(les)) {
9131 return les;
9132 }
9133 }
9134 // if the subcommand is an option group we need to check deeper
9135 if (subc->get_name().empty()) {
9136 const auto &cmpres = _compare_subcommand_names(subcom, *subc);
9137 if (!cmpres.empty()) {
9138 return cmpres;
9139 }
9140 }
9141 // if the test subcommand is an option group we need to check deeper
9142 if (subcom.get_name().empty()) {
9143 const auto &cmpres = _compare_subcommand_names(*subc, subcom);
9144 if (!cmpres.empty()) {
9145 return cmpres;
9146 }
9147 }
9148 }
9149 }
9150 return estring;
9151}
9152
9153CLI11_INLINE void App::_move_to_missing(detail::Classifier val_type, const std::string &val) {
9154 if (allow_extras_ || subcommands_.empty()) {
9155 missing_.emplace_back(val_type, val);
9156 return;
9157 }
9158 // allow extra arguments to be places in an option group if it is allowed there
9159 for (auto &subc : subcommands_) {
9160 if (subc->name_.empty() && subc->allow_extras_) {
9161 subc->missing_.emplace_back(val_type, val);
9162 return;
9163 }
9164 }
9165 // if we haven't found any place to put them yet put them in missing
9166 missing_.emplace_back(val_type, val);
9167}
9168
9169CLI11_INLINE void App::_move_option(Option *opt, App *app) {
9170 if (opt == nullptr) {
9171 throw OptionNotFound("the option is NULL");
9172 }
9173 // verify that the give app is actually a subcommand
9174 bool found = false;
9175 for (auto &subc : subcommands_) {
9176 if (app == subc.get()) {
9177 found = true;
9178 }
9179 }
9180 if (!found) {
9181 throw OptionNotFound("The Given app is not a subcommand");
9182 }
9183
9184 if ((help_ptr_ == opt) || (help_all_ptr_ == opt))
9185 throw OptionAlreadyAdded("cannot move help options");
9186
9187 if (config_ptr_ == opt) throw OptionAlreadyAdded("cannot move config file options");
9188
9189 auto iterator = std::find_if(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_),
9190 [opt](const Option_p &v) { return v.get() == opt; });
9191 if (iterator != std::end(options_)) {
9192 const auto &opt_p = *iterator;
9193 if (std::find_if(std::begin(app->options_), std::end(app->options_),
9194 [&opt_p](const Option_p &v) { return (*v == *opt_p); }) ==
9195 std::end(app->options_)) {
9196 // only erase after the insertion was successful
9197 app->options_.push_back(std::move(*iterator));
9198 options_.erase(iterator);
9199 } else {
9200 throw OptionAlreadyAdded("option was not located: " + opt->get_name());
9201 }
9202 } else {
9203 throw OptionNotFound("could not locate the given Option");
9204 }
9205}
9206
9207CLI11_INLINE void TriggerOn(App *trigger_app, App *app_to_enable) {
9208 app_to_enable->enabled_by_default(false);
9209 app_to_enable->disabled_by_default();
9210 trigger_app->preparse_callback(
9211 [app_to_enable](std::size_t) { app_to_enable->disabled(false); });
9212}
9213
9214CLI11_INLINE void TriggerOn(App *trigger_app, std::vector<App *> apps_to_enable) {
9215 for (auto &app : apps_to_enable) {
9216 app->enabled_by_default(false);
9217 app->disabled_by_default();
9218 }
9219
9220 trigger_app->preparse_callback([apps_to_enable](std::size_t) {
9221 for (const auto &app : apps_to_enable) {
9222 app->disabled(false);
9223 }
9224 });
9225}
9226
9227CLI11_INLINE void TriggerOff(App *trigger_app, App *app_to_enable) {
9228 app_to_enable->disabled_by_default(false);
9229 app_to_enable->enabled_by_default();
9230 trigger_app->preparse_callback([app_to_enable](std::size_t) { app_to_enable->disabled(); });
9231}
9232
9233CLI11_INLINE void TriggerOff(App *trigger_app, std::vector<App *> apps_to_enable) {
9234 for (auto &app : apps_to_enable) {
9235 app->disabled_by_default(false);
9236 app->enabled_by_default();
9237 }
9238
9239 trigger_app->preparse_callback([apps_to_enable](std::size_t) {
9240 for (const auto &app : apps_to_enable) {
9241 app->disabled();
9242 }
9243 });
9244}
9245
9246CLI11_INLINE void deprecate_option(Option *opt, const std::string &replacement) {
9247 Validator deprecate_warning{[opt, replacement](std::string &) {
9248 std::cout << opt->get_name() << " is deprecated please use '"
9249 << replacement << "' instead\n";
9250 return std::string();
9251 },
9252 "DEPRECATED"};
9253 deprecate_warning.application_index(0);
9254 opt->check(deprecate_warning);
9255 if (!replacement.empty()) {
9256 opt->description(opt->get_description() + " DEPRECATED: please use '" + replacement +
9257 "' instead");
9258 }
9259}
9260
9261CLI11_INLINE void retire_option(App *app, Option *opt) {
9262 App temp;
9263 auto *option_copy = temp.add_option(opt->get_name(false, true))
9264 ->type_size(opt->get_type_size_min(), opt->get_type_size_max())
9265 ->expected(opt->get_expected_min(), opt->get_expected_max())
9266 ->allow_extra_args(opt->get_allow_extra_args());
9267
9268 app->remove_option(opt);
9269 auto *opt2 = app->add_option(option_copy->get_name(false, true),
9270 "option has been retired and has no effect")
9271 ->type_name("RETIRED")
9272 ->default_str("RETIRED")
9273 ->type_size(option_copy->get_type_size_min(), option_copy->get_type_size_max())
9274 ->expected(option_copy->get_expected_min(), option_copy->get_expected_max())
9275 ->allow_extra_args(option_copy->get_allow_extra_args());
9276
9277 Validator retired_warning{[opt2](std::string &) {
9278 std::cout << "WARNING " << opt2->get_name()
9279 << " is retired and has no effect\n";
9280 return std::string();
9281 },
9282 ""};
9283 retired_warning.application_index(0);
9284 opt2->check(retired_warning);
9285}
9286
9287CLI11_INLINE void retire_option(App &app, Option *opt) { retire_option(&app, opt); }
9288
9289CLI11_INLINE void retire_option(App *app, const std::string &option_name) {
9290 auto *opt = app->get_option_no_throw(option_name);
9291 if (opt != nullptr) {
9292 retire_option(app, opt);
9293 return;
9294 }
9295 auto *opt2 = app->add_option(option_name, "option has been retired and has no effect")
9296 ->type_name("RETIRED")
9297 ->expected(0, 1)
9298 ->default_str("RETIRED");
9299 Validator retired_warning{[opt2](std::string &) {
9300 std::cout << "WARNING " << opt2->get_name()
9301 << " is retired and has no effect\n";
9302 return std::string();
9303 },
9304 ""};
9305 retired_warning.application_index(0);
9306 opt2->check(retired_warning);
9307}
9308
9309CLI11_INLINE void retire_option(App &app, const std::string &option_name) {
9310 retire_option(&app, option_name);
9311}
9312
9313namespace FailureMessage {
9314
9315CLI11_INLINE std::string simple(const App *app, const Error &e) {
9316 std::string header = std::string(e.what()) + "\n";
9317 std::vector<std::string> names;
9318
9319 // Collect names
9320 if (app->get_help_ptr() != nullptr) names.push_back(app->get_help_ptr()->get_name());
9321
9322 if (app->get_help_all_ptr() != nullptr) names.push_back(app->get_help_all_ptr()->get_name());
9323
9324 // If any names found, suggest those
9325 if (!names.empty())
9326 header += "Run with " + detail::join(names, " or ") + " for more information.\n";
9327
9328 return header;
9329}
9330
9331CLI11_INLINE std::string help(const App *app, const Error &e) {
9332 std::string header = std::string("ERROR: ") + e.get_name() + ": " + e.what() + "\n";
9333 header += app->help();
9334 return header;
9335}
9336
9337} // namespace FailureMessage
9338
9339namespace detail {
9340
9341std::string convert_arg_for_ini(const std::string &arg,
9342 char stringQuote = '"',
9343 char characterQuote = '\'');
9344
9346std::string ini_join(const std::vector<std::string> &args,
9347 char sepChar = ',',
9348 char arrayStart = '[',
9349 char arrayEnd = ']',
9350 char stringQuote = '"',
9351 char characterQuote = '\'');
9352
9353std::vector<std::string> generate_parents(const std::string &section,
9354 std::string &name,
9355 char parentSeparator);
9356
9359void checkParentSegments(std::vector<ConfigItem> &output,
9360 const std::string &currentSection,
9361 char parentSeparator);
9362} // namespace detail
9363
9364namespace detail {
9365
9366CLI11_INLINE std::string convert_arg_for_ini(const std::string &arg,
9367 char stringQuote,
9368 char characterQuote) {
9369 if (arg.empty()) {
9370 return std::string(2, stringQuote);
9371 }
9372 // some specifically supported strings
9373 if (arg == "true" || arg == "false" || arg == "nan" || arg == "inf") {
9374 return arg;
9375 }
9376 // floating point conversion can convert some hex codes, but don't try that here
9377 if (arg.compare(0, 2, "0x") != 0 && arg.compare(0, 2, "0X") != 0) {
9378 double val = 0.0;
9379 if (detail::lexical_cast(arg, val)) {
9380 return arg;
9381 }
9382 }
9383 // just quote a single non numeric character
9384 if (arg.size() == 1) {
9385 return std::string(1, characterQuote) + arg + characterQuote;
9386 }
9387 // handle hex, binary or octal arguments
9388 if (arg.front() == '0') {
9389 if (arg[1] == 'x') {
9390 if (std::all_of(arg.begin() + 2, arg.end(), [](char x) {
9391 return (x >= '0' && x <= '9') || (x >= 'A' && x <= 'F') ||
9392 (x >= 'a' && x <= 'f');
9393 })) {
9394 return arg;
9395 }
9396 } else if (arg[1] == 'o') {
9397 if (std::all_of(arg.begin() + 2, arg.end(),
9398 [](char x) { return (x >= '0' && x <= '7'); })) {
9399 return arg;
9400 }
9401 } else if (arg[1] == 'b') {
9402 if (std::all_of(arg.begin() + 2, arg.end(),
9403 [](char x) { return (x == '0' || x == '1'); })) {
9404 return arg;
9405 }
9406 }
9407 }
9408 if (arg.find_first_of(stringQuote) == std::string::npos) {
9409 return std::string(1, stringQuote) + arg + stringQuote;
9410 }
9411 return characterQuote + arg + characterQuote;
9412}
9413
9414CLI11_INLINE std::string ini_join(const std::vector<std::string> &args,
9415 char sepChar,
9416 char arrayStart,
9417 char arrayEnd,
9418 char stringQuote,
9419 char characterQuote) {
9420 std::string joined;
9421 if (args.size() > 1 && arrayStart != '\0') {
9422 joined.push_back(arrayStart);
9423 }
9424 std::size_t start = 0;
9425 for (const auto &arg : args) {
9426 if (start++ > 0) {
9427 joined.push_back(sepChar);
9428 if (!std::isspace<char>(sepChar, std::locale())) {
9429 joined.push_back(' ');
9430 }
9431 }
9432 joined.append(convert_arg_for_ini(arg, stringQuote, characterQuote));
9433 }
9434 if (args.size() > 1 && arrayEnd != '\0') {
9435 joined.push_back(arrayEnd);
9436 }
9437 return joined;
9438}
9439
9440CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::string> generate_parents(const std::string &section,
9441 std::string &name,
9442 char parentSeparator) {
9443 std::vector<std::string> parents;
9444 if (detail::to_lower(section) != "default") {
9445 if (section.find(parentSeparator) != std::string::npos) {
9446 parents = detail::split(section, parentSeparator);
9447 } else {
9448 parents = {section};
9449 }
9450 }
9451 if (name.find(parentSeparator) != std::string::npos) {
9452 std::vector<std::string> plist = detail::split(name, parentSeparator);
9453 name = plist.back();
9454 detail::remove_quotes(name);
9455 plist.pop_back();
9456 parents.insert(parents.end(), plist.begin(), plist.end());
9457 }
9458
9459 // clean up quotes on the parents
9460 for (auto &parent : parents) {
9461 detail::remove_quotes(parent);
9462 }
9463 return parents;
9464}
9465
9466CLI11_INLINE void checkParentSegments(std::vector<ConfigItem> &output,
9467 const std::string &currentSection,
9468 char parentSeparator) {
9469 std::string estring;
9470 auto parents = detail::generate_parents(currentSection, estring, parentSeparator);
9471 if (!output.empty() && output.back().name == "--") {
9472 std::size_t msize = (parents.size() > 1U) ? parents.size() : 2;
9473 while (output.back().parents.size() >= msize) {
9474 output.push_back(output.back());
9475 output.back().parents.pop_back();
9476 }
9477
9478 if (parents.size() > 1) {
9479 std::size_t common = 0;
9480 std::size_t mpair = (std::min)(output.back().parents.size(), parents.size() - 1);
9481 for (std::size_t ii = 0; ii < mpair; ++ii) {
9482 if (output.back().parents[ii] != parents[ii]) {
9483 break;
9484 }
9485 ++common;
9486 }
9487 if (common == mpair) {
9488 output.pop_back();
9489 } else {
9490 while (output.back().parents.size() > common + 1) {
9491 output.push_back(output.back());
9492 output.back().parents.pop_back();
9493 }
9494 }
9495 for (std::size_t ii = common; ii < parents.size() - 1; ++ii) {
9496 output.emplace_back();
9497 output.back().parents.assign(parents.begin(),
9498 parents.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(ii) + 1);
9499 output.back().name = "++";
9500 }
9501 }
9502 } else if (parents.size() > 1) {
9503 for (std::size_t ii = 0; ii < parents.size() - 1; ++ii) {
9504 output.emplace_back();
9505 output.back().parents.assign(parents.begin(),
9506 parents.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(ii) + 1);
9507 output.back().name = "++";
9508 }
9509 }
9510
9511 // insert a section end which is just an empty items_buffer
9512 output.emplace_back();
9513 output.back().parents = std::move(parents);
9514 output.back().name = "++";
9515}
9516} // namespace detail
9517
9518inline std::vector<ConfigItem> ConfigBase::from_config(std::istream &input) const {
9519 std::string line;
9520 std::string currentSection = "default";
9521 std::string previousSection = "default";
9522 std::vector<ConfigItem> output;
9523 bool isDefaultArray = (arrayStart == '[' && arrayEnd == ']' && arraySeparator == ',');
9524 bool isINIArray = (arrayStart == '\0' || arrayStart == ' ') && arrayStart == arrayEnd;
9525 bool inSection{false};
9526 char aStart = (isINIArray) ? '[' : arrayStart;
9527 char aEnd = (isINIArray) ? ']' : arrayEnd;
9528 char aSep = (isINIArray && arraySeparator == ' ') ? ',' : arraySeparator;
9529 int currentSectionIndex{0};
9530 while (getline(input, line)) {
9531 std::vector<std::string> items_buffer;
9532 std::string name;
9533
9534 detail::trim(line);
9535 std::size_t len = line.length();
9536 // lines have to be at least 3 characters to have any meaning to CLI just skip the rest
9537 if (len < 3) {
9538 continue;
9539 }
9540 if (line.front() == '[' && line.back() == ']') {
9541 if (currentSection != "default") {
9542 // insert a section end which is just an empty items_buffer
9543 output.emplace_back();
9544 output.back().parents =
9545 detail::generate_parents(currentSection, name, parentSeparatorChar);
9546 output.back().name = "--";
9547 }
9548 currentSection = line.substr(1, len - 2);
9549 // deal with double brackets for TOML
9550 if (currentSection.size() > 1 && currentSection.front() == '[' &&
9551 currentSection.back() == ']') {
9552 currentSection = currentSection.substr(1, currentSection.size() - 2);
9553 }
9554 if (detail::to_lower(currentSection) == "default") {
9555 currentSection = "default";
9556 } else {
9557 detail::checkParentSegments(output, currentSection, parentSeparatorChar);
9558 }
9559 inSection = false;
9560 if (currentSection == previousSection) {
9561 ++currentSectionIndex;
9562 } else {
9563 currentSectionIndex = 0;
9564 previousSection = currentSection;
9565 }
9566 continue;
9567 }
9568
9569 // comment lines
9570 if (line.front() == ';' || line.front() == '#' || line.front() == commentChar) {
9571 continue;
9572 }
9573
9574 // Find = in string, split and recombine
9575 auto pos = line.find(valueDelimiter);
9576 if (pos != std::string::npos) {
9577 name = detail::trim_copy(line.substr(0, pos));
9578 std::string item = detail::trim_copy(line.substr(pos + 1));
9579 auto cloc = item.find(commentChar);
9580 if (cloc != std::string::npos) {
9581 item.erase(cloc,
9582 std::string::npos); // NOLINT(readability-suspicious-call-argument)
9583 detail::trim(item);
9584 }
9585 if (item.size() > 1 && item.front() == aStart) {
9586 for (std::string multiline;
9587 item.back() != aEnd && std::getline(input, multiline);) {
9588 detail::trim(multiline);
9589 item += multiline;
9590 }
9591 items_buffer = detail::split_up(item.substr(1, item.length() - 2), aSep);
9592 } else if ((isDefaultArray || isINIArray) &&
9593 item.find_first_of(aSep) != std::string::npos) {
9594 items_buffer = detail::split_up(item, aSep);
9595 } else if ((isDefaultArray || isINIArray) &&
9596 item.find_first_of(' ') != std::string::npos) {
9597 items_buffer = detail::split_up(item);
9598 } else {
9599 items_buffer = {item};
9600 }
9601 } else {
9602 name = detail::trim_copy(line);
9603 auto cloc = name.find(commentChar);
9604 if (cloc != std::string::npos) {
9605 name.erase(cloc,
9606 std::string::npos); // NOLINT(readability-suspicious-call-argument)
9607 detail::trim(name);
9608 }
9609
9610 items_buffer = {"true"};
9611 }
9612 if (name.find(parentSeparatorChar) == std::string::npos) {
9613 detail::remove_quotes(name);
9614 }
9615 // clean up quotes on the items
9616 for (auto &it : items_buffer) {
9617 detail::remove_quotes(it);
9618 }
9619
9620 std::vector<std::string> parents =
9621 detail::generate_parents(currentSection, name, parentSeparatorChar);
9622 if (parents.size() > maximumLayers) {
9623 continue;
9624 }
9625 if (!configSection.empty() && !inSection) {
9626 if (parents.empty() || parents.front() != configSection) {
9627 continue;
9628 }
9629 if (configIndex >= 0 && currentSectionIndex != configIndex) {
9630 continue;
9631 }
9632 parents.erase(parents.begin());
9633 inSection = true;
9634 }
9635 if (!output.empty() && name == output.back().name && parents == output.back().parents) {
9636 output.back().inputs.insert(output.back().inputs.end(), items_buffer.begin(),
9637 items_buffer.end());
9638 } else {
9639 output.emplace_back();
9640 output.back().parents = std::move(parents);
9641 output.back().name = std::move(name);
9642 output.back().inputs = std::move(items_buffer);
9643 }
9644 }
9645 if (currentSection != "default") {
9646 // insert a section end which is just an empty items_buffer
9647 std::string ename;
9648 output.emplace_back();
9649 output.back().parents =
9650 detail::generate_parents(currentSection, ename, parentSeparatorChar);
9651 output.back().name = "--";
9652 while (output.back().parents.size() > 1) {
9653 output.push_back(output.back());
9654 output.back().parents.pop_back();
9655 }
9656 }
9657 return output;
9658}
9659
9660CLI11_INLINE std::string ConfigBase::to_config(const App *app,
9661 bool default_also,
9662 bool write_description,
9663 std::string prefix) const {
9664 std::stringstream out;
9665 std::string commentLead;
9666 commentLead.push_back(commentChar);
9667 commentLead.push_back(' ');
9668
9669 std::vector<std::string> groups = app->get_groups();
9670 bool defaultUsed = false;
9671 groups.insert(groups.begin(), std::string("Options"));
9672 if (write_description &&
9673 (app->get_configurable() || app->get_parent() == nullptr || app->get_name().empty())) {
9674 out << commentLead << detail::fix_newlines(commentLead, app->get_description()) << '\n';
9675 }
9676 for (auto &group : groups) {
9677 if (group == "Options" || group.empty()) {
9678 if (defaultUsed) {
9679 continue;
9680 }
9681 defaultUsed = true;
9682 }
9683 if (write_description && group != "Options" && !group.empty()) {
9684 out << '\n' << commentLead << group << " Options\n";
9685 }
9686 for (const Option *opt : app->get_options({})) {
9687 // Only process options that are configurable
9688 if (opt->get_configurable()) {
9689 if (opt->get_group() != group) {
9690 if (!(group == "Options" && opt->get_group().empty())) {
9691 continue;
9692 }
9693 }
9694 std::string name = prefix + opt->get_single_name();
9695 std::string value =
9696 detail::ini_join(opt->reduced_results(), arraySeparator, arrayStart, arrayEnd,
9697 stringQuote, characterQuote);
9698
9699 if (value.empty() && default_also) {
9700 if (!opt->get_default_str().empty()) {
9701 value = detail::convert_arg_for_ini(opt->get_default_str(), stringQuote,
9702 characterQuote);
9703 } else if (opt->get_expected_min() == 0) {
9704 value = "false";
9705 } else if (opt->get_run_callback_for_default()) {
9706 value = "\"\""; // empty string default value
9707 }
9708 }
9709
9710 if (!value.empty()) {
9711 if (!opt->get_fnames().empty()) {
9712 value = opt->get_flag_value(name, value);
9713 }
9714 if (write_description && opt->has_description()) {
9715 out << '\n';
9716 out << commentLead
9717 << detail::fix_newlines(commentLead, opt->get_description()) << '\n';
9718 }
9719 out << name << valueDelimiter << value << '\n';
9720 }
9721 }
9722 }
9723 }
9724 auto subcommands = app->get_subcommands({});
9725 for (const App *subcom : subcommands) {
9726 if (subcom->get_name().empty()) {
9727 if (write_description && !subcom->get_group().empty()) {
9728 out << '\n' << commentLead << subcom->get_group() << " Options\n";
9729 }
9730 out << to_config(subcom, default_also, write_description, prefix);
9731 }
9732 }
9733
9734 for (const App *subcom : subcommands) {
9735 if (!subcom->get_name().empty()) {
9736 if (subcom->get_configurable() && app->got_subcommand(subcom)) {
9737 if (!prefix.empty() || app->get_parent() == nullptr) {
9738 out << '[' << prefix << subcom->get_name() << "]\n";
9739 } else {
9740 std::string subname =
9741 app->get_name() + parentSeparatorChar + subcom->get_name();
9742 const auto *p = app->get_parent();
9743 while (p->get_parent() != nullptr) {
9744 subname = p->get_name() + parentSeparatorChar + subname;
9745 p = p->get_parent();
9746 }
9747 out << '[' << subname << "]\n";
9748 }
9749 out << to_config(subcom, default_also, write_description, "");
9750 } else {
9751 out << to_config(subcom, default_also, write_description,
9752 prefix + subcom->get_name() + parentSeparatorChar);
9753 }
9754 }
9755 }
9756
9757 return out.str();
9758}
9759
9760CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_group(std::string group,
9761 bool is_positional,
9762 std::vector<const Option *> opts) const {
9763 std::stringstream out;
9764
9765 out << "\n" << group << ":\n";
9766 for (const Option *opt : opts) {
9767 out << make_option(opt, is_positional);
9768 }
9769
9770 return out.str();
9771}
9772
9773CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_positionals(const App *app) const {
9774 std::vector<const Option *> opts = app->get_options(
9775 [](const Option *opt) { return !opt->get_group().empty() && opt->get_positional(); });
9776
9777 if (opts.empty()) return {};
9778
9779 return make_group(get_label("Positionals"), true, opts);
9780}
9781
9782CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_groups(const App *app, AppFormatMode mode) const {
9783 std::stringstream out;
9784 std::vector<std::string> groups = app->get_groups();
9785
9786 // Options
9787 for (const std::string &group : groups) {
9788 std::vector<const Option *> opts = app->get_options([app, mode, &group](const Option *opt) {
9789 return opt->get_group() == group // Must be in the right group
9790 && opt->nonpositional() // Must not be a positional
9791 && (mode != AppFormatMode::Sub // If mode is Sub, then
9792 || (app->get_help_ptr() != opt // Ignore help pointer
9793 && app->get_help_all_ptr() != opt)); // Ignore help all pointer
9794 });
9795 if (!group.empty() && !opts.empty()) {
9796 out << make_group(group, false, opts);
9797
9798 if (group != groups.back()) out << "\n";
9799 }
9800 }
9801
9802 return out.str();
9803}
9804
9805CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_description(const App *app) const {
9806 std::string desc = app->get_description();
9807 auto min_options = app->get_require_option_min();
9808 auto max_options = app->get_require_option_max();
9809 if (app->get_required()) {
9810 desc += " REQUIRED ";
9811 }
9812 if ((max_options == min_options) && (min_options > 0)) {
9813 if (min_options == 1) {
9814 desc += " \n[Exactly 1 of the following options is required]";
9815 } else {
9816 desc += " \n[Exactly " + std::to_string(min_options) +
9817 "options from the following list are required]";
9818 }
9819 } else if (max_options > 0) {
9820 if (min_options > 0) {
9821 desc += " \n[Between " + std::to_string(min_options) + " and " +
9822 std::to_string(max_options) + " of the follow options are required]";
9823 } else {
9824 desc += " \n[At most " + std::to_string(max_options) +
9825 " of the following options are allowed]";
9826 }
9827 } else if (min_options > 0) {
9828 desc += " \n[At least " + std::to_string(min_options) +
9829 " of the following options are required]";
9830 }
9831 return (!desc.empty()) ? desc + "\n" : std::string{};
9832}
9833
9834CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_usage(const App *app, std::string name) const {
9835 std::stringstream out;
9836
9837 out << get_label("Usage") << ":" << (name.empty() ? "" : " ") << name;
9838
9839 std::vector<std::string> groups = app->get_groups();
9840
9841 // Print an Options badge if any options exist
9842 std::vector<const Option *> non_pos_options =
9843 app->get_options([](const Option *opt) { return opt->nonpositional(); });
9844 if (!non_pos_options.empty()) out << " [" << get_label("OPTIONS") << "]";
9845
9846 // Positionals need to be listed here
9847 std::vector<const Option *> positionals =
9848 app->get_options([](const Option *opt) { return opt->get_positional(); });
9849
9850 // Print out positionals if any are left
9851 if (!positionals.empty()) {
9852 // Convert to help names
9853 std::vector<std::string> positional_names(positionals.size());
9854 std::transform(positionals.begin(), positionals.end(), positional_names.begin(),
9855 [this](const Option *opt) { return make_option_usage(opt); });
9856
9857 out << " " << detail::join(positional_names, " ");
9858 }
9859
9860 // Add a marker if subcommands are expected or optional
9861 if (!app->get_subcommands([](const CLI::App *subc) {
9862 return ((!subc->get_disabled()) && (!subc->get_name().empty()));
9863 })
9864 .empty()) {
9865 out << " " << (app->get_require_subcommand_min() == 0 ? "[" : "")
9866 << get_label(app->get_require_subcommand_max() < 2 ||
9867 app->get_require_subcommand_min() > 1
9868 ? "SUBCOMMAND"
9869 : "SUBCOMMANDS")
9870 << (app->get_require_subcommand_min() == 0 ? "]" : "");
9871 }
9872
9873 out << std::endl;
9874
9875 return out.str();
9876}
9877
9878CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_footer(const App *app) const {
9879 std::string footer = app->get_footer();
9880 if (footer.empty()) {
9881 return std::string{};
9882 }
9883 return "\n" + footer + "\n";
9884}
9885
9886CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_help(const App *app,
9887 std::string name,
9888 AppFormatMode mode) const {
9889 // This immediately forwards to the make_expanded method. This is done this way so that
9890 // subcommands can have overridden formatters
9891 if (mode == AppFormatMode::Sub) return make_expanded(app);
9892
9893 std::stringstream out;
9894 if ((app->get_name().empty()) && (app->get_parent() != nullptr)) {
9895 if (app->get_group() != "Subcommands") {
9896 out << app->get_group() << ':';
9897 }
9898 }
9899
9900 out << make_description(app);
9901 out << make_usage(app, name);
9902 if (app->get_aliases().size() > 0) {
9903 out << "or\n";
9904 out << make_usage(app, app->get_aliases()[0]);
9905 }
9906 out << make_positionals(app);
9907 out << make_groups(app, mode);
9908 out << make_subcommands(app, mode);
9909 out << make_footer(app);
9910
9911 return out.str();
9912}
9913
9914CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_subcommands(const App *app, AppFormatMode mode) const {
9915 std::stringstream out;
9916
9917 std::vector<const App *> subcommands = app->get_subcommands({});
9918
9919 // Make a list in definition order of the groups seen
9920 std::vector<std::string> subcmd_groups_seen;
9921 for (const App *com : subcommands) {
9922 if (com->get_name().empty()) {
9923 if (!com->get_group().empty()) {
9924 out << make_expanded(com);
9925 }
9926 continue;
9927 }
9928 std::string group_key = com->get_group();
9929 if (!group_key.empty() && std::find_if(subcmd_groups_seen.begin(), subcmd_groups_seen.end(),
9930 [&group_key](std::string a) {
9931 return detail::to_lower(a) ==
9932 detail::to_lower(group_key);
9933 }) == subcmd_groups_seen.end())
9934 subcmd_groups_seen.push_back(group_key);
9935 }
9936
9937 // For each group, filter out and print subcommands
9938 for (const std::string &group : subcmd_groups_seen) {
9939 out << "\n" << group << ":\n";
9940 std::vector<const App *> subcommands_group =
9941 app->get_subcommands([&group](const App *sub_app) {
9942 return detail::to_lower(sub_app->get_group()) == detail::to_lower(group);
9943 });
9944 for (const App *new_com : subcommands_group) {
9945 if (new_com->get_name().empty()) continue;
9946 if (mode != AppFormatMode::All) {
9947 out << make_subcommand(new_com);
9948 } else {
9949 out << new_com->help(new_com->get_name(), AppFormatMode::Sub);
9950 out << "\n";
9951 }
9952 }
9953 }
9954
9955 return out.str();
9956}
9957
9958CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_subcommand(const App *sub) const {
9959 std::stringstream out;
9960 detail::format_help(out, sub->get_display_name(true), sub->get_description(), column_width_);
9961 return out.str();
9962}
9963
9964CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_expanded(const App *sub) const {
9965 std::stringstream out;
9966 out << sub->get_display_name(true) << "\n";
9967
9968 out << make_description(sub);
9969 if (sub->get_name().empty() && !sub->get_aliases().empty()) {
9970 detail::format_aliases(out, sub->get_aliases(), column_width_ + 2);
9971 }
9972 out << make_positionals(sub);
9973 out << make_groups(sub, AppFormatMode::Sub);
9974 out << make_subcommands(sub, AppFormatMode::Sub);
9975
9976 // Drop blank spaces
9977 std::string tmp = detail::find_and_replace(out.str(), "\n\n", "\n");
9978 tmp = tmp.substr(0, tmp.size() - 1); // Remove the final '\n'
9979
9980 // Indent all but the first line (the name)
9981 return detail::find_and_replace(tmp, "\n", "\n ") + "\n";
9982}
9983
9984CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_option_name(const Option *opt, bool is_positional) const {
9985 if (is_positional) return opt->get_name(true, false);
9986
9987 return opt->get_name(false, true);
9988}
9989
9990CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_option_opts(const Option *opt) const {
9991 std::stringstream out;
9992
9993 if (!opt->get_option_text().empty()) {
9994 out << " " << opt->get_option_text();
9995 } else {
9996 if (opt->get_type_size() != 0) {
9997 if (!opt->get_type_name().empty()) out << " " << get_label(opt->get_type_name());
9998 if (!opt->get_default_str().empty()) out << " [" << opt->get_default_str() << "] ";
9999 if (opt->get_expected_max() == detail::expected_max_vector_size)
10000 out << " ...";
10001 else if (opt->get_expected_min() > 1)
10002 out << " x " << opt->get_expected();
10003
10004 if (opt->get_required()) out << " " << get_label("REQUIRED");
10005 }
10006 if (!opt->get_envname().empty())
10007 out << " (" << get_label("Env") << ":" << opt->get_envname() << ")";
10008 if (!opt->get_needs().empty()) {
10009 out << " " << get_label("Needs") << ":";
10010 for (const Option *op : opt->get_needs()) out << " " << op->get_name();
10011 }
10012 if (!opt->get_excludes().empty()) {
10013 out << " " << get_label("Excludes") << ":";
10014 for (const Option *op : opt->get_excludes()) out << " " << op->get_name();
10015 }
10016 }
10017 return out.str();
10018}
10019
10020CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_option_desc(const Option *opt) const {
10021 return opt->get_description();
10022}
10023
10024CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_option_usage(const Option *opt) const {
10025 // Note that these are positionals usages
10026 std::stringstream out;
10027 out << make_option_name(opt, true);
10028 if (opt->get_expected_max() >= detail::expected_max_vector_size)
10029 out << "...";
10030 else if (opt->get_expected_max() > 1)
10031 out << "(" << opt->get_expected() << "x)";
10032
10033 return opt->get_required() ? out.str() : "[" + out.str() + "]";
10034}
10035

Definition CLI11.hpp:8301
